description:
I have gone here by accident or without "much" choice twice now and both times have been completely different experiences yet still satisfying. This dark, two story bar is really more a dual floor club where the music is always in the 90s and the girl to guy ratio is incredibly askew (too many dicks on the dance floor). Yet, somehow with the right amount of libations, the music playing strongly, and dancing, YES DANCING, still alive and well Raven Bar doesn't just become some cool place in the city that has great 90s music. It becomes a great place in the city that has great 90s music for you and your friends. 

When it's not crowded it feels strange like most clubs. Luckily the bar areas really feel like a bar so it's not too bad. But you don't pay for cover and that's why you go early when it is that empty. But when the night comes in and takes over the place can get hot and packed real fast. 

Dancing comes in different languages. You have the dance of trying to get closer to a pretty face and vice versa, the dance of escape from a creeper. You have the dance of hand motions and winks to try and capture the bartender's attention. The dance of potty as you wait in line for 2 bathrooms in this multi-story club. And the dance of satisfaction as you and your friends sing out loud to Backstreet Boys' "I Want It That Way". 

So like a true 90s book you can choose your own adventure every night you come out here and even with some many constants you'll probably end up with a great night out with your friends. Cheers mates!
author: Sammy B.

description:
Made a reservation here for my 25th birthday party and had a blast! David Huu and the rest of the planning committee were so helpful and accommodating. They answered all my neurotic questions before the event, and also made sure everything was in place before we arrived. 

I had about 40 people in the back area with a private bar. Free entry for everyone on my guests list. If you want extra people, they have to pay $10 after 10:30pm. Cocktails ranged from $10-12, but you can also request for bottle service or take shotssss haha. My only complaint would be that we only had one bartener working for most of the night which was difficult to serve all of our drunk guests. Oh, they also offer free coat check upstairs! 

Raven provided us with cupcake tower and birthday banner, and even allowed us to put up our own decorations and balloons. They also gave me a bday tiara and free tickets for next time I come to Raven which was really sweet. The music playing was 90s/2000-2010 hip hop and R&B bopsss so it was litttt!! Definitely would recommend coming here for a party or just clubbing with friends since there's 2 dance floors. Thanks Raven staff!!
author: Kendall C.

description:
This is my go-to bar, now that I live nearby! See y'all ladies on Friday or Saturday nights on the dance floor. There are enough dudes here, so no more dudes please!

Linda is the best. They play 90s and 2000s hip hop/r&b/alternative.

Happy hour M-W ALL NIGHT!! Th-Sat until 8pm I believe :)

There's a little dance floor on the bottom floor, and a slightly larger dance floor on the upper floor which has a separate door.

Trademark nearby is to watch Warriors games. Copyright is for unique cocktails n chillin.
Bloodhound is for cocktails/beer and chillin as well! Amazing bartenders with a wealth of knowledge on alc
author: Michael K.

description:
This venue had my friend.....raven!! She'd been here before and chose this as THE spot for our one night out (in what feels like a million years). If you get your name on the guest list, there is no cover charge before 11PM. It's an easy check-in process and the also have a free coat check! The lady at check-in saw that my birthday had just passed and gave me a free drink voucher, which was a really nice touch. :)

Drinks are $10 for well drinks across the board, which is very reasonable. They also pour with a heavy hand, so a few drinks will be enough to keep you going all night! 

For us kids born in the late 80's, this place is poppin' with all the right songs. I mean, how can you go wrong with old school Jay-Z and Spice Girls?! The crowd is pretty fun and low-key, you can definitely show up in a tshirt and jeans and not feel out of place! 

Come early, there is a limit to how many people they allow on the second floor (which is where the main dance floor is), and if you get there past midnight you'll likely be waiting in line to be allowed upstairs as other patrons trickle out!
author: Sherry L.

description: Pretentious wannabe club whose "bouncers" have the demeanor of power-trippin' mall cops. Their staff has nothing better to do than patrol to find patrons to call out on obnoxious rules (e.g., no hats). They literally have a deli counter take-a-number system to get upstairs, which really isn't all that different from downstairs. Strange crowd, stick-up-the-ass staff, cover charge -- definitely not returning to this sad excuse of a club.
author: Chris L.

description:
Always a great time, this throwback bar never disappoints. Average pricing for drinks, you can avoid paying a cover charge if you check out the details on their site. There is also a free coat check upstairs. 
This place is a great place to have a birthday, they set everything up for you and the booth attendants are always super friendly. Very happy I found this spot!
author: Alejandra A.

description: Love the music and vibe, this is always my go to spot. But it's getting more crowded and harder to just go in and get to the second floor. They now make you take a number and wait.
author: Gina I.

description:
What an awesome experience! I highly recommend this bar if your going out with a big group of friends (4 or more) because you can reserve a VIP booth for FREE!!!! That way your group has a guaranteed place to sit and relax in between dancing. 
Parking is not very easy, luckily we found  parking in an alley across the street and it didn't look so sketch. 
On a Friday night, we added our names to the guest list a few hours before and got in for free around 10 pm, no one checked our names off so I'm not sure if it mattered that we did a guest list. 
We didn't reserve a booth this time but I asked the bartender and that's how I found out it's free, I would rather do that because a few times I really wanted to sit down and the majority of the seating is down stairs.. next time for sure though. 
We were going crazy with that lavender mojito drink, I felt so bad for the bartender, we were all ordering those, so we'd have to order 5 at a time! In the end I switched to a AMF and that's the drink that got me dancing.
The music was really nice, throwback 90s hip hop so it was easy to dance too, the light effects and smoke machine really bring an amazing ambience on the top floor, leaving the bottom floor boring... the top stairs bar is super loud and hard to order so we went downstairs and it was the worst mistake, there was a line to come up stairs and in order to go up we had to get a ticket, so we had more drink and just left.. it was fun while it lasted. We will remember to just get the booth and drinks upstairs and stay up there the whole time.
author: Karah G.

description:
If I lived in San Francisco, this place is a hidden gem with its great drink quality and their 80s/90s music.

They have a dance floor big enough for your party group to be in.

When I came in, the bouncer was really nice, bartender mixed our drinks to perfection and the DJ was lit. The music took me back as we were all reminiscing about back in high school which brought me and my friends on the dance floor.

The mood and lighting was great, there's even a disco ball!
The lounges were big enough and cushiony to the point my butt felt like heaven and still made me feel like a kid as if I sat on a long cushiony bar stool.

Would definitely make this my regular spot! 

NOTE:
Happy hour: Mon - Wed
Thurs - Sat is ONLY till 8!
author: Dominique G.

description: It was fun! They need more top 40s music though. Good for dancing lots of asians  there is a cash cover. Upstaira gets packed though so you might have to wait to get up there
author: Nan T.

description:
Came here for my coworkers birthday party on 90's night. Booking a table was super easy l and convenient. Found street parking around the corner. Door man checks ID's prior to entering . No wait at the door. 

Coat check in upstairs. Bar was clean with a small dance floor. 90's music was good with music videos playing on the TV's for some of the songs. Liquor selection was OK. Could of been better but had all the basics. 

Overall good vibes / atmosphere, good crowd and fun experience .
author: Eddy P.

description:
I went here on a Saturday night. Cover was $10 (I thought I was over paying cover fees). 

The crowd is alright and the music was a mix of 90's and 2000's which was a nice throwback of the good times. There were a ton of reserved tables with various parties celebrating birthday's, bachelor/ette parties, and private celebrations. 

Coat check is free.
author: Tim G.

description:
UCSF Holiday Work Party 2017

I was quite surprised to see the turn out for a holiday work party that was going to be hosted at a club/Lounge. This was a First for me, lol.
It was super cool to see my co-workers in non-scrubs; it was almost like we were all close to being human, haha! 

Raven is a cool spot. It was 50/50 for a few friends that have been here before so I tried my best to check this place out with an open mind. I must say, that this review might be a bit bias since we had the whole place to ourselves for our private event, but either way-we had a great time! 

The first floor is pretty spacious. When you walk in, the bar lines the left wall, with bench seating along the right mirrored-wall. The next room, towards the back is the dance floor front and center; then booth tables along the wall. Nice, intimate lighting is provided throughout the back room. 

The bartenders are pretty chill too. Would I return, probably!
author: Lene N.

description:
I had a great time here, but honestly it's all thanks to the amazing bar staff--and them alone. I think tonight their names were Sean and Linda, but I'm not sure. Anyway, the bartenders have made my nights at Raven bar. The music on the other hand is the definition of "meh".
Honestly, with the eclectic/wide range of music, I'd expect something better. I've been here a few times now and it seems like this place is stuck on the same, poor playlist that was drafted up by someone who has no idea what good music is. Seriously, been here 5 times now and I've heard the same playlist all 5 times. CHANGE IT UP! Take some requests or give someone else the power to pick the music.
author: Mitch B.

description:
We just celebrated my sisters bachelorette party this weekend at the Raven and it was so much fun. I sent in a request to reserve a table and within minutes, I was contacted with information which made booking a table super easy and convenient. 
The moment we got there, we were greeted and brought a menu for our bottle services.  We got there at 9PM and it was still bit mellow and not a lot of people. Once it was 10PM, boy did it get full. The 2nd floor was a bit too crowded for comfort and no room to dance. The music was a mix of 90's and 2000's which was a nice throwback of the good times. The one thing that I did find it a bit annoying is that they only had one bathroom downstairs. The servers were great and made sure we had enough/refilled our mixers, cups, and ice.  
Overall, great experience. My sister had a blast. An added plus, there was a photographer and took some awesome pics!
author: Maribel O.

description:
Fun if you want to dance to *NSYNC and Michael Jackson all night... ?

Drinks are fine and venue is nice; DJ was rude when I suggested playing something produced w/in the last 10 years
author: Brendan L.

description:
I came here with my friends for a gno. 

It was my first time,  but all of my other friends had gone multiple times before. The downstairs portion is pretty small, but there is an upstairs portion as well. 

They play an awesome mix of 90s music here!! So hip hop,  r&b, linkin park all of those throwbacks. Great place to go to hear some nostalgic music.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
You cannot beat the music here at Raven Bar. It is always my jammmn playing when I come here, and I always have a good time. I recently celebrated my birthday here and the hosts at Raven Bar were very accommodating and made planning my event very easy. Thanks so much, Raven Bar!!! 

There's usually guest list on Fridays and Saturdays, for free entry before a certain time (10pm I think...). There's a bar downstairs and upstairs, but upstairs is where the dance floor is where they also play music videos on the TVs and big screen on the wall. If you're a 90s baby and/or grew up in the early 2000s, Raven Bar will take you down memory lane where you'll be like "OOOOOHHHH!" for almost every song hahaha. 

Downstairs is a little bit more chill (I think... idk I usually spend most of my time upstairs :) ) But I do know there's a small smoking area outside on the side (if you're into that). Dress code is pretty casual, so you don't have to dress up like you're in Vegas or something. But of course, your attire should be somewhat on point and not look like you're a bum.
author: Michele L.

description:
A little late on my review but we had such a great time I wanted to give credit where it was due...

My bestfriend doesnt go out much and isn't really into huge clubs that bump EDM, so we picked out Raven to celebrate her 30th birthday. I've heard about it before from other friends and thought it would be great since they play all the 90s jams. We got bottle service and had a fun time and the DJ played all of our favorite songs! The only thing that was rough was that there was only one bathroom downstairs. Other than that the servers were very accomodating, even when our alcohol ran out they were still nice enough to refill the mixers and let us continue on with our ratchetness. David was awesome and checked on us the entire time. When some people in the group got a little too drunk he quietly let us outside instead of making a scene, and made sure we went home with water and a plastic bag. What a nice guy :)
author: Virginia R.

description:
"TIME CRISIS: The story of a club lost in time"

Raven bar is the "90s hip hop club" you always hear about. The concept is pretty dope. Let's play 90s music, throw it on a projector, and oh yeah let's throw some fog in there... and LIGHTS, can't forget the LIGHTS!

The main issue is that this place is too popular for its own good. There really just isn't much space. So unless you get there early, it'll be really hard to make it upstairs where the main dance floor is.

The entry isn't too expensive. The main bouncer at the front is nice. Drinks are average. Crowd is a bit off (this is the only place in the city you'll still see man buns in 2017).

Now the execution of the music is where its really lacking. I swear the DJ seriously just googled '90s music' and put together a playlist. He'll play some weird stuff that wasn't even popular in the 90s. He'll usually get the artist right, but play the wrong track. Seriously. This dude is literally DJ AltaVista. [EDITOR'S NOTE: For those that don't know, AltaVista is an old 90s search engine that no ones ever heard of and got shut down. Probably because it returned "This Girlie Had a Mustache" instead of "Summertime" or "I think I Can Beat  Mike Tyson" when you searched for DJ Jazzy Jeff and Will Smith]

Overall this isn't a bad place. But there are better options out there if you want to dance.

Protip: To get to the next level (upstairs) you'll need to make it past the bouncer with the fauxhawk (!) [EDITOR'S NOTE: Again, this review was written in 2017]. He'll try to tell you that the line against the wall to get upstairs is not in fact a line and you'll need to move away. Listen to him and you'll be stuck on level one forever. Play confused and the bouncer in the stairway will eventually let people up.
author: Joel L.

description:
This review is LONG overdue! I went for my birthday on a Saturday night in early March and it was everything I didn't even realize I wanted for my birthday. 
All throwback music to sing along to, a mix of genres too which was great as my group liked various types. 
The owner came over a few times to make sure our booth was being taken care of, which he really didn't need to. 
I believe the main server / host we had was George who was on top of it. Towards the middle to end of the night we didn't see him much as to be expected since it was PACKED. Or maybe he did come by and I just didn't realize it after the strong drinks haha
Overall a great place and I will definitely be back!
author: Emily C.

description:
I cannot say enough good things about Raven Bar. 

Long story short, my rowdy group of friends tried watching the Michigan vs. Villanova game down the street at the local Michigan bar, however, this bar was so packed and the bartenders were so rude, that we decided to go home to our comfy sofa to watch the game instead. 

While walking to our Lyft, we walked by Raven Bar and saw a great opportunity to watch the game; two big flat screen TVs and a smiling bartender. With a little politeness and a few promises of Taco Bell, the bartender agreed to turn on the game (and the sound!) and to take in the overflow of Michigan fans looking for a place to watch the game. Before we knew it, we had a packed bar on our hands. 

THANK YOU RAVEN BAR FOR A FUN EVENING AND FOR A SAFE PLACE TO WATCH THE GAME WITH A FRIENDLY BARTENDER.

You're appreciated.
author: Kaili L.

description: Imagine standing with your friends, literally doing nothing but chilling and waiting around. Imagine being accosted by a security guard, told you're "too drunk" for no good reason, and then being forced to wait outside. We were a gay couple and this happened to me. As an LGBT person, this is the first time this has happened to me. I would never think that in San Francisco, of all places, I would face discrimination for my sexuality and be tossed aside like I was less than dirt. I am not only hurt, I'm mortified. I will be telling every person I know that Raven Bar is a place of bigotry and hatred; a place that goes out of its way to make people feel like shit. I will tell everyone Raven Bar is an anti LGBT place. I have never been treated like this by any bar staff before and I will never return. LGBT people beware; Raven bar is homophobic and evil.
author: Dhruv D.

description: Always on the lookout for a place to dance and I like this spot! Reasonable $10 cover on a Saturday night with no line. Two levels with a line to get upstairs to the true dance floor (no money necessary) and coat check. The cocktails are pretty good to go along with the Poe theme. DJ was good:  played 1990-2000s hits and gave you time to dance! Upstairs dance floor was really packed so claim some space and enjoy while you can. Super chill though, no one was belligerent or sloppy.
author: Aisha C.

description:
I am 25 but deep down inside I'm kind of an old lady. Going to night clubs is something that now feels like a big ordeal. You have to get ready, get drinks, get pumped up, gather everybody, get to the place... wow I am tired just by writing this. 

If after all this, I manage to actually make it to the club I want to hear some great music. Music I can really dance to, maybe "sing" along with, or perhaps with miming motions that match the lyrics. These things are hard to do with EDM and it's hard to find a club that doesn't mostly play electronic music. Enter Raven.

Just like they say they play mostly 90s hip hop so if you love 90s hip hop/pop/rnb as much as I do, you will not be disappointed. The upstairs has a bar and a relatively small dance space that definitely gets packed. On really busy nights there's even a bouncer for just the upstairs. Bouncer within bouncer. Meta bouncer we'll call him. 

Downstairs area has more space but all the tables are there so it feels like less of a dedicated dance floor but nobody will stop you! They play different music on both floors. Downstairs is definitely quieter. 

Also, free coat check!!!

In conclusion, Raven is awesome and all my fellow young grandmas/grandpas should go check it out.
author: Jenny L.

description: My boyfriend got kicked out because he was "stumbling" (which he does when he's sober anyway) and therefore "drunk." Since we were surround by drunk people, I seriously question the motivation. Not sure if it was because he was gay or Indian or some other bullshit reason, but we will not be coming back here. Also, there's a $10 cover charge for what? Nothing special.
author: Tim T.

description:
I hate sf and bars, but when it's your girls bday you show up! I was happy it was 90s music which made the bar a great place for me. Then it just happened to be Hawaiian night so that was the icing on the cake. 

Pro: staff was awesome, bartenders, events staff, security -- everyone / music 

Con: we did VIP and bottle service was $350, the bottle was regular and shots were poured for us which made the bottle go quick. Out of 8 people I got one drink. Honestly I would suggest just buying drinks on your own unless they up the bottle size
author: Jennifer T.

description: Organizers treat you like royalty when you book a table. I have never been to a club that has such top-notch customer service. Very refreshing! Plus it doesn't hurt that I love throwback music.
author: Lina M.

description: Very disappointed with the greeting at this bar. My first Time in San Francisco and I was just trying to get a feel of how the bars and clubs ran around this area, I returned to raven bar and was asked if I spoke and read English in San Diego (as the promoter pointed to the door sign that was blocked by the other promoter). I was very offended by the way the security guard in the cowboy hat spoke to me and my friends. As a previous promoter, I understand that guests can have a lot of  requests; however, the security at raven bar was rude and racist.
author: Quynh-Tien P.

description: I was visiting San Francisco and my friend and I were looking for a chill lounge that played R&B music.  Yelp brought us here where they play 90's music on Thursday nights.  This was one of the highlights of our entire trip!  We sat at the bar drinking margaritas and watching music videos from the 90's while singing every word at the top of our lungs.  It took us down memory lane and we still talk about how much fun we had that night.
author: Stephanie H.

description: I came to Raven to celebrate my birthday on a Friday! I originally tried to book a table (free) but the tables were booked up (they emailed to let me know- super responsive via email! I misspelled names in the guest list and they resolved for me!) i signed up for guest list since the tables were full. Arrived about 10:15 and got in no problems! it's a cute establishment there was a crowd at the front bar so walked to the back bar and got drinks no problem....decided to head up stairs to hang by where the DJ was, pretty solid mix of different songs it's so hard to find places with a good mix of music! I will definitely come back!
author: Laneisha T.

description: I really want to like this bar, but my experience there is telling me otherwise. The drinks were okay, but the vibe is off inside. The funny thing is I really like this bar during the day, but at night it tries to hard to be a club. Go during the day. :)
author: Peter S.

description:
If you're a cougar and you're trying to meet some young newly graduates, come thru! Lol 
I loved the 90s music here! Taking it back to the good ol days! Came here tonight for my gf's bday..
author: Lenore H.

description: Great place for dancing to some '90s beats. Also great place to meet boys born in the '90s. ;) Too bad they're cheating potatoes and and tell you it's their cousin calling when it's actually their girlfriend. Riiiiight. Anyway, their website boasts a free booth with guest list, but we randomly stopped by and paid the $10 cover. It was early, and they had a few private parties blocking off the back bar and the upstairs bar, so we stayed downstairs in the front area the first half of the night. It was fun with a small dancing area, but upstairs is really where all the dancing action is. Again, great place to dance like it's 1999.
author: Anna C.

description: Our friend suggested this place and we were not disappointed. The music was great! I didn't try any of the drinks though. It did get crowded quickly so we eventually made our way against the wall on the second floor. I suggest arriving there early to avoid the line and crowd.
author: Christina M.

description: I've never been to a bar where 3 people with empty glasses could wait for so long while two bartenders did nothing.
author: DJ D.

description:
Even as a relatively young person, I would still say that I've graduated to "grandma status" and will stay as far away from nightclubs and lounges as possible. But one Friday night, my good friend was in town, and she made plans to go to Raven Bar, so I put in a surprising amount of effort to look cute and head there to hang out and maybe dance.

I had a great time, actually! We arrived around 10 before the crowd got too crazy, which also meant we could secure a good portion of the dance floor upstairs for our big group. I like that there's a free coat check upstairs. Well, you should still tip. The drinks aren't bad. The 90s hip hop music was legit, bringing us all back to our childhoods. Best of all, the spot where we were standing had air conditioning!! There was not a sweaty moment of the night, which was absolutely glorious. Can't say the same for the rest of the nightclub, but Raven Bar did a marvelous job of making its patrons feel comfortable and welcome.

While I still wouldn't raise my hand to venture to a nightclub or lounge, I'm not opposed to coming back to Raven Bar again! It's moderately sized and not super crazy. Love the more laid back vibes here. Just make sure to put yourself on the guest list whenever possible so you don't have to wait in line!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Ah Raven Bar. 

I've been holding off on this review, but now that I am retiring you, I've decided to relive the good old times. You were the place I spent my two birthdays at as a hot mess, the place I met my current boyfriend, the place my boyfriend held his birthday at, the first place my sister and I ever went out together, the first place where I witnessed men fight over my friends and I (yayUHHH should not be applauding that kind of behavior but still) --you will always be the place I hold fond memories of. Everything about you is great..from the 90s classics you play, the cool vibes and people you bring together, those delicious lychee drinks you make and for supporting small businesses, like that dirty dog cart outside your venue.

Sorry for always being a menace and thank you to the manager whose patience is undying and always says hi back to my drunken slurs, thank you to the bartender who gave me a free much needed tequila shot that one night, and thank you to the very kind
 lady at coatcheck.
author: Emily F.

description: Had a reservation for a birthday and had a good time with a group of people until some person kicked us out. So we left but the security guards outside asked us who kicked us out b/c the only people that can kick anyone out was them. The Head security named Bull (ithink) took charge and found the person that kicked us out and told us we can go back in. And he was nice enough to give us 10 passes for the inconvenience.
author: Rhea-anne M.

description:
Went to Raven Bar on a Saturday night and had an unexceptional night here.  My first issue is with the rude doormen/bouncers that work at the front, their attitudes were unfriendly and arrogant.  Relax dude, just because you wear a suit doesn't mean that you're the secret service.  This is mainly aimed at the tall, chunky Asian man and the tall African-American guy with a lot of piercings.

My second issue is with the cover charge here.. I'm not sure why it exists to be honest.  I've been to the nicest clubs in Las Vegas, Manhattan and LA and I've never had to pay a cover.  That being said, to charge anyone (whether male or female) to enter this mediocre bar is absurd.

The music was good, mostly 90s but I wouldn't return here for that.. there are plenty of other places in SF that play great music and have a better staff than the one that is employed at the Raven.
author: Sarah N.

description:
This is an age appropriate choice for old folks like me. I get so excited about Spice Girls, Backstreet Boys, R. Kelly, and all of the other 90s jams they play. It bring back amazing memories of my youth; I know, I'm really dating myself.

I've been to Raven a couple of times and I've enjoyed it. The most recently time, a friend of mine was celebrating his birthday and had a booth downstairs. I like the vibe of the dance floor upstairs a bit more but the music is the same in both areas. Alright, Yelpers in your 30s, I'll see you at Raven!
author: Yi Z.

description: I'm sorry for being a bit biased but the majority of attendees here are of Asian decent. Being from out of town we were not expecting that and even though the Marjority of the music was good it just had a different vibe that we were not enjoying. The drinks are overpriced and a bouncer tried to remove us from the top floor because we were sitting down on a bench and not standing. It was unnecessary
author: Mercy G.

description: Raven is just not fun for me. I think the music the play is fine, and the dance floor is good, but it is a pain in the ass if you ever get caught downstairs waiting to go up. There is no transparency about who can go up and when. You can get separated from your group for a A WHILE if you want to go downstairs for a smoke break or something.
author: Andrew T.

description: Had a great time with my friends here. We had bottle service and the people who work there couldn't have been nicer. Can't wait to go back and do it again!
author: Jamie B.

description: Came here to celebrate my 23rd birthday with my boyfriend on a Friday night. I added him and I to the guest list (the day before) to obtain free admission. So on my birthday, we were visiting different places in SF and lost track of time. In addition to that, the Airbnb we were staying out was a mile away, so we hiked it there in dress shoes and heels. We arrived approximately 10-15 minutes passed 11 pm (the cut off time for no cover charge, which is $10 per person). Surprisingly, the ticket holder and the bouncer were very nice and humorous, so they let us through. When the ticket holder saw my ID, she handed me a free drink card, which I immediately redeemed. It was quite busy upon arrival and the bartender was swamped, but eventually, she helped us out and was very informative when we asked questions pertaining to the drinks they had. After getting some alcohol on me, I felt buzzed and wanted to dance. The music was hit after hit, yet not many people were on the dance floor, which was mildly disappointing to me. Interior-wise, the lighting was perfect, but the dance floor is more on the small scale on the lower floor. Unfortunately, I did not get a chance to check out the top floor because my boyfriend was more buzzed than I was and we left the establishment. Overall, I loved the atmosphere and the people. No one was pushy, rowdy, or an asshole compared to most traditional club environments.
author: Tina H.

description: I hosted my friend's bachelorette here and it was great! I contacted Raven a few days before the event and they set us up with a reasonably priced bottle service table in the downstairs area. I had originally wanted to get a table upstairs, but we were actually very happy with all the space we had to dance! They treated us very well, were easy to communicate with, and even decorated the space in honor of our bride-to-be. They tell you to get there at 10pm, but as long as you let them know your real ETA beforehand, it's okay to be a little late. The music was also on point and we had a blast here.
author: Lucy C.

description:
This would be 5 stars if there were not so many people blatantly running into people throughout the night.  Actually that isn't the venue's fault.  I'll bump it up to 5 stars.

Get on the guest list on their website for free entry before 11.  I did this and got in easy peezy.  The girl working the list was observant enough to notice that it was only a week after my birthday (the reason I was going out on that particular night) and gave me a free drink ticket.  Kudos and a big thanks to her.

The guys at the front door were cool and I appreciate that as well.

There is a downstairs and upstairs, bars on both levels, dancing and music on both levels.  Music from the 90s and 2000s that matched the music videos that were being played on tv screens.  It was fun to dance to some old school classics and watch the videos that went along with them.

Drinks seemed a little on the pricey side and also seemed a little weak, but maybe I don't go out much and that is just how much they are these days.

I heard cover is $10 after 11, but you might want to check for yourself.

Street parking was easy to find at 10:30.  

Security seemed on top of things all night and it didn't seem like a place where anything bad would go down.

There was a nice mix of guys and girls.

It was not too hot which was nice.

I know this is a boring review, but I'm just trying to be informative on this one.

A few key things that I really appreciated...

1.  The music was not super loud!!!!  I was actually able to talk and hear and be heard and my ears were not ringing at the end of the night.  5 stars for that!!!!  It made everything so much more enjoyable.

2. They were not trying to do too much with the dress code.  I was able to wear jeans sneakers!!  They were all black (gammas) Jordan XIs, but still, just being able to wear comfortable shoes is a huge plus.

This is definitely a cool spot if you want to get out and dance to some old school music for a bit.  I will be back.

Also for those who smoke, there is an area downstairs that is outside for you to smoke, but do yourself a favor and stop smoking!  :)

Actually seeing how parking and entry was free and the vibe was cool, the drinks were not that expensive.
author: Ty C.

description:
I went here Friday night to celebrate a friend's bday. We were on the guest list, so we had easy entry. Otherwise its a 10$ cover charge.

Drinks: I did not enjoy the drinks. I tried their old fashioned, mojito and adios. They had very little alcohol and were super sweet. This is the main reason I did not give this bar full 5 stars.

Service: They make an extra added effort to make sure that the bday person and their group was feeling welcome. They gave my friend a tiara, had a happy birthday sign up and gave her 2 VIP passes to their club - all complimentary. So yes their service is amazing.

Ambience: They have 90s music and a nice vibe to the place. It is both good for bar and club.
author: Lovereen K.

description:
Tried to come here on a Saturday night, after ubering here from a club to see some friends inside. They were not letting people in at 1 am when it clearly says they are open until 2. We were trying to tell the security that we were trying to see our friends inside that asked another security inside if we were able to get in before and they said we would be able to. After ubering  here we weren't let in and it was really frustrating. 
Might try this place on another night but come earlier since they will probably won't let you in even though they are open anyways
author: Daniel Q.

description: Came here this past weekend on a Friday night. It's free cover charge if you're on the guest list & get here before 10 or 11, but check the website to make sure of the time. We parked on the street about 2 blocks away. There was a very short line & the bar itself was pretty small. There are two floors & each floor has a bar; the first floor actually has two bars - 1 is in the front & one in the back.. There are TVs Galore & music videos from the 90s & early 2000s playing. There is no DJ. There are bathrooms on both floors as well but be prepared to wait in line because again it is very small.The first floor doesn't really have a dance floor - it's more like an open floor area that you could dance in, if there's no room upstairs. The real dance floor is upstairs but again it is very small & you will barely have room to dance or move your elbows. Be warned, once the upstairs gets too crowded, the bouncers or security guards will start giving out tickets & forcing people to wait in line before they can go upstairs. This is a terrible rule - even if you come from the upstairs, they will still not let you back up for any reason. Truthfully, upstairs is overrated anyways so it's not worth even waiting in line for. The bouncer did a terrible job - he didn't explain this DMV ticket procedure & did not warn any of the people coming from the upstairs to the downstairs about this change. I am not returning to this place & I definitely do not recommend it to anyone at all. If you want to have a good time & party, go somewhere else. There are plenty of other places to go to - w/ more space, class, better music, etc. The last thing you need on your night out is to get stuck inside some cramp, tiny, rude establishment with bad service, bathroom odor galore, cheap music, & no dance space. Terrible all around!
author: Hu L.

description:
By far one of the most fun bars/night clubs I've been too.  Friendly bar tenders.  Bouncers were cordial and friendly.  Drinks were strong as F to boot.  But the Wednesday night "90's Hip Hop"
was awesome!  DJ was spinning it up, took requests, and had a good flow of music.  All in all a must go.  I'd say the crowd was pretty varied.  20's-40 yr olds and everyone was having a good time.
author: Terry D.

description: Came here for my birthday and had the best night ever! I had the room in the very back with my own bar and two tables and a long booth. I had about 25 guest and we were treated very well. If we needed anyone removed from our area the security escorted them out right away. The manager David also provided me with a cupcake tower for cupcakes I brought for my guest. He checked on us frequently throughout the night and was very polite. You can tell he has customer service down and takes great pride in his position. The music was awesome and the upstairs did get pretty packed but when you're a queen like myself people move out your way.  I would definitely come here again!
author: Jenn G.

description: I've celebrated my birthday at Raven Bar two years in a row and have not been disappointed.  Bottle service on Saturday nights are awesome if you're having a party!  Great service. Host takes care of you and keeps your booth private. Servers are very friendly and always checks on your drinks and keeps the tables clean.  90s music definitely brings back memories and is great for drunken dancing and "karaoke".  Just about everyone sings along when a great song comes up. I've already recommended this place to other people, and would definitely come back! Thank you David and to the rest of the staff at Raven for another successful birthday party!
author: Jules A.

description:
If you want a low-key night out, where you can chill and talk without music blasting in your ears, this is the place. 

Cover on the weekends is $10 but I think you can put yourself on guestlist and get in for free if you come earlier. Downstairs have bars, seating area, upstairs is smaller with bars and a dance floor. Music is definitely not the ratchet type, so don't come expecting to get down and dirty. 

Definitely would come back.
author: Debbie D.

description: Went here for a friends birthday. Fantastic music along with music videos-5 stars there. Small dance floors, but great employees making sure there is always a clear path. Bar has St. George gin, always a plus in my book. It's a smaller club atmosphere, so don't expect crazy crowds. I'm turning 30 this year (2017), so the music was really enjoyable!
author: Kayla B.

description: I was purposely served 5 WATER SHOTS, when I had ordered tequila shots. I have never heard of a tactic so lowly as this before. After immediately informing the bar tender, he immediately apologized excessively without surprise of what had occurred. In my mind, there is no way this was done on accident, but was purposefully done to scam customers. My party and I were perfectly sober. The bar tender did eventually pour tequila shots but offered no other amends and the tab was still to be paid for in full. I expect way more from an establishment such as this. I will not return to this place that practices in such disgraceful and unethical ways.
author: Kyron C.

description:
So we ended up here at raven bar after the game. I wasn't expecting much and I'm glad I didn't. Place was extremely small, I went directly upstairs thru the side entrance. I had to check in my backpack at the coat check.

Security were friendly. The bathroom is kinda interesting it's uni sex but one person at a time and it's located right in front of the bar. Shockingly it was pretty clean. They got alot of flights of stairs I got kinda confused.

The dance floor is crowded and small. The crowd is mixed. Cover charge was $10 I'll probably go back.
author: Mo N.

description:
Great music, cool crowd, lots of dancing and mingling upstairs. However on my most recent visit, my friends and I found out that they now have a number system to go upstairs.... It's super inefficient and ambiguous. 

We thought we could take one number for our group and get in when we were called.. However half an hour later (!!!!) our number was up and we found out that we had to take ONE NUMBER PER PERSON!!! So we couldn't get upstairs as a group and had to take new individual numbers.. The security guard took our old number and ended up issuing us new numbers.... 30 numbers away!! It took us an hour to get upstairs. -___- 

The number system should at least be clear that you have to take it individually. Security guards were not clear at all and basically just yelling at people. They weren't explaining anything so how were we supposed to know that each person had to get their own number?? Bring back the line!!! I think that process was way easier.

On a different note, Raven is still fun. The music is awesome and there's a plethora of alcohol and fun people!
author: Tara A.

description: Love this bar love the staff only thing I wasn't the biggest fan of was whoever was playing the music... they were playing 90s music but it seems like they were playing 90s music that no one really knows... And then playing a few hit songs from the 90s in between it almost felt like they DJ just went to listen to the songs they like but didn't care about what is popular. I'm a huge 90s music fan and half of those songs can't even figure out if they were even the 90s!!??
author: Sarah P.

description: Not a bad place to get your party on during the weekend. Crowd is pretty young here. The music is old hip hop and r&b with some modern hits too. The dance floor is mainly up stairs but it isn't too big. Can get a little crowded. I went with some awesome friends so we had a blast. Drinks are not cheap. We paid $11 for each tequila shot. Need to be ballin if you wanna get drunk at clubs haha. Place is pretty nice and clean. A lot of people dropped their drinks and the workers had to pick up the broken glass. I felt bad for the workers there. But if you in town, come by here. It's like $10 for entry.
author: Michael W.

description:
Raven is SO RIDICULOUSLY FUN. I came on a Saturday night and they were playing 90s music, hit after hit (we're talking Britney, a little Destiny's Child, I think I even caught a Sisqo song). My voice was slightly hoarse the day after from singing along.  If I were to give this place a rating for music and music only, they'd be getting 5 stars, HANDS DOWN. 

Unfortunately there are a couple of downsides to Raven:
-- BEWARE: phone thieves are rampant at this place! Two friends of mine have had their phones stolen straight out of their purses. Upstairs tends to get crowded so it's easy to fall victim. I'd suggest holding your phone at all times or bringing a wristlet!
-- SINGLE STALL BATHROOMS: Seeeeriouslyyyyyy? Picture a line of 10+ women waiting for one stall per level. ONE. STALL. The inefficiency of this, I just can't handle it. Please fix this.

Overall, I would be willing to go to Raven again (the music they play is just tooo gooood) but I'd be weary of overdrinking. Hold your pee and watch your possessions, but have fun on the dance floor :)
author: Stephanie C.

description: This place is So. Much. Fun.!  We walked in after 11pm, paid a $10 cover charge and was greeted with 2 floors of super fun, great to dance to music!  We went to the 2nd floor (this is where my friends who are locals suggest) and danced the night away to mostly 90's music.  I don't think there was a large enough dance floor on the lower level.  Drinks were  pretty good and easy to get at the bars.  This is my kind of bar and I hope to come back to Raven Bar next time I'm in SOMA and ready to party to throwbacks!!!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
The staff there are all really friendly.
Dance floor is really packed upstairs- you have to get a ticket and wait for your number to be called

The line to get in seemed pretty long too. So arrive early!
This place is not your typical layout of a bar/club. The bottle service tables are all downstairs and the upstairs only has like one bar and the dance floor. First impression is that this place is narrow. 

Pretty nice atmosphere though. Lots of old school songs.
author: Amy V.

description:
Came here on a Friday with my fellow classmates and friends after many recommendations for a night out after a round of midterms. I was a little surprised at first because the place seemed so small, but I settled down at the bar and started drinking. I ordered the Mule, Lychee drink, a couple of Long Islands, and some shots with my friends. The drinks, though a little expensive, were really well made! Their Long Islands didn't taste like death which I appreciate. The bartenders were really friendly and always compliant and willing when I asked for water. 

We were upstairs the whole time dancing our butts off to 90's music with a little 2000's and current pop thrown in. It was fantastic! We spilt a few drinks here and there (sorry!), but the people working there were so nice about the mess and didn't make us feel like garbage. At first, it was really quiet so my friends and I got in and started dancing, next thing I know it's packed in there! We had a hard time getting to the bar and back to the dance floor because of all the people there!

There's also a coat check for free which is nice. Warning: go to the restroom early and don't break the seal because there's only 2 toilets upstairs and 2 downstairs. It definitely was a long wait to take a leak.

I'd definitely like to come back wearing tennis shoes. It's super fun and super chill here!
author: Tiffany N.

description: Extremely rude bouncers. We had a reservation and they still made us wait in line for 20+ min. Genuinely have never been treated so aggressively. Good music though.
author: Ani M.

description: Honestly the worst bar I've ever been to, do not come here. The bouncer are rude , the guy to girl ratio is awful , don't waste your time . It's a guy fest here
author: Jordan D.

description:
Seriously amazing ! I love this place this is definitely a club I will go back into. Get there before 10 o'clock the line gets long and sometimes you can't  even get in. 

The Music: did you played throwback from the 90s with the video to match and for people who are just there to hang and listen this is an amazing spot specially if you are between 25 to 30.. 

The bar: Sam is awesome. I wasn't really sure what drink I wanted and he asked me my flavor profile. Sure enough he was able to meet my expectation of a perfect drink. I had whiskey with ginger and lemon on the rocks.. Love it! 

Ambiance: feel like a mix of young and Mid .. This is your spot. Very divers and fun crowd. I really like the vibe in this club.

Restrooms in both floor.. But once the second floor gets crowded, they will not let you back upstairs so be cautious if you leave. The bouncers a security was super nice though. 

I had a really great time.
author: Sharrie N.

description: I had an amazing time with 15 of my friends last weekend!We booked a booth, bottle service and they even set-up cute decor and wrote a card of congrats prior to our arrival. We wanted somewhere we would be able to dance and enjoy our friends that were visiting from all over the country. If you and your friends enjoy 90's throwback jams & delicious drinks - this is the place for you! Bonus - they offer free coat check too. The owner David was absolutely wonderful to work with as were all of the staff we met. Highly recommended!!!
author: Kris V.

description:
Get yourself on the guest list so you don't have to pay cover. Cover was like $10 so not bad regardless. 

Went last Friday night and it was a good time! Got there a little before 11:00. We didn't have to wait in line too long. Loved the 90s pop and hip hop. Everyone in our group was dancing and having a good time. 

There was a wait to get upstairs but worth it. Fun times! Will definitely come again!
author: Joan S.

description:
Raven USED to be the spot. But after this experience, I probably won't be coming back. They hold up the line, and the security will tell you 15-20mins to get in. That actually means 1hr. 

The worst part is that they don't tell you that once you pay $10cover, you have to wait for another line to go upstairs (only reason to go Raven is upstairs). 

The stupid thing is Raven now hand out number tickets to go upstairs. WTF! Am I at a restaurant or at a customer service line!!??!? At this point, I'm number 74 and the number says 34. 

Raven you disappoint. I know of the head of security too. He used to be the bartender and everything was chill. 

Won't be coming back again unless my life depends on it.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Raven is always my go to place as the bartenders are top notch and the staff is always friendly and helpful. Usually they play 90s classics and it's a great time though the music can get a bit repetitive if you are a frequent visitor.

But last night was something different. I started my yelp account because of it. There was a new DJ that was playing hits from 90s to today and it was awesome. People were really feeling it and having a good time. Even though it was packed, you still had room to dance.

I hope that DJ sticks around so we have a bit more variety in the music.
author: Brandon A.

description:
Went to Raven on a Friday night with friends as a VIP; as a result, we got a orange wrist band that illustrates VIP. They were playing 90s music that night and charging $14 a drink. Raven has two floors playing 90s music on both floors. Things were okay initially until it got later into the night where we were told that we weren't allowed upstairs despite the fact we had VIP. 

I would not recommend paying for a table because you will be treated no differently from someone who pays general admission. For example if you and your friends have a table upstairs, you may not be allowed to go up there despite the fact of whether or not you have a VIP wrist band. My friends found that to be bullshit so we left and asked the guy outside (Asian dude in suit with spiky hair who the security guards claimed to be the manager) what difference does it make for a party who paid for bottle service (VIP wrist band) vs someone who randomly walks in. The employee stated the benefits of having a VIP band is you can go upstairs whenever you'd like. Consequently, I told him what happened and then he says oh you're orange so your only allowed downstairs and if you have a blue wristband you're only allowed upstairs. I'll let you guys interpret that yourself but going forward, if I go back, I'm definitely not getting bottle service. 

I recommend signing up for guest list because this place is not worth paying cover for or bottle service. If you can get in on the guest list and if they actually honor it, this place is worth checking out. Otherwise, don't waste your money here.
author: John C.

description: Was visiting SF for a weekend and ended up here. Great throwback music and vibe. I even left my card here and they were gracious enough to mail it to me - that's pretty unreal service!
author: Yun Z.

description:
Oh Raven Bar, Oh Raven Bar. Have we both seen the best and the not so best times together... 

Tired of the constant hiphop scene and itching to enter the decades of Britney Spears, Whitney Houston, N'sync, and today's hits - Raven Bar is the place to be. Two floors with two different dj's, allows you more music choices as you may prefer one floor over the other. With three different bars to order from, it is more likely that you will be served as soon as possible. 

If you decide to come here, PUT YOUR NAME ON THE GUESTLIST. Only downfall for me is  that you have to enter in full names of you and your guests. You can't just pick and choose on the day of who you decide to bring. Because of this, I believe their guestlist fills up quite quickly. Be sure to come before 11pm to avoid paying $10 cover (which is fairly cheap in SF).

Shots are $9, mixed drinks I believe are $12. Staff, bartenders and bouncers are super friendly and nice!
author: Jana V.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SF with fairly priced drinks and great music!! 

Always remember to sign up for the Guest list in advance or else you'll end up lining up for a little while and pay the 10 dollar cover! To differentiate the floors, the downstairs is more like a pre game and a little milder, while the upstairs is where all the partying happens! The upstairs is filled with lights and loud 90s music. Just beware of the sticky floors and how hot it can get up there. It also gets pretty packed by midnight so make sure you are already up there by 11 ish! 

Overall, the bartenders and staff are super nice! One of the bartenders gave me a water before I left and I seriously thank her for stopping a potential terrible hang over! Even though the security can be a little strict sometimes, they are usually fair and just try to make sure the club doesn't get too rowdy. Raven is seriously a guaranteed good night and would come here again in a heart beat!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
90s night on Saturday!! Couldn't think of a better music decade to get a bunch of 20 year olds pumped. Dancing is upstairs, mingling is downstairs. BUT don't be fooled. If you have to go to the bathroom, wait in line at the upstairs bathroom because otherwise after 11:30ish there is a line downstairs to get upstairs and that's just worse. 

$10 cover (lame) but worth it every now any then.
author: Kelly G.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. Any place that plays 90s/hiphop/r&b and its music videos(!!) warrants an automatic approval from me. That coupled that with a relaxed dress code and a dance floor definitely make this my kind of place. BUT as always, there are downsides. Drinks are expensive (what's new?), $10 cover after a certain time, there's only two single stall bathrooms for women in this ENTIRE PLACE, and the top floor is typically jam packed, making it hard to dance. These downsides are fairly common across the board for all bars/clubs so I guess these could be overlooked if I'm a) drunk or b) having a really good time.  

However, bottle service is a different story. I came here recently to celebrate a friend's birthday and we ordered bottle service. What I liked was that we could specify our group size beforehand and have them all added to the guest list. Not sure if we could add more, but we were able to add 20 people to our guest list. Mind you, that's 20 people who could come and skip paying cover. Thought it was nice that they set up birthday signs around our table, gave the birthday girl a little birthday tiara and both birthday celebrants a couple vouchers for no cover. Those were pretty much the only things I 'liked' about bottle service. 

The bottle service itself was pretty mediocre, and that's me being polite. Our juice and soda carafes were empty fairly quick and were probably only refilled maybe twice the entire time we were there. It took forever to flag down someone to refill our drinks and even longer for them to come back with it. We killed our 2 bottles very early on in the night and decided to bite the bullet and purchase a 3rd, but even that took a long time also. At one point, I even forked over $3 at the bar to buy soda because our runner was taking too long. Having 20+ people standing around waiting for the bottle, cups and juice/soda is just unacceptable, especially when you're paying money for it. The redeeming factor in all this though, is that these issues were brought up to management by the birthday celebrants and they were able to come up with a compromise.

Overall,  just the music alone makes this a pretty good place. Just skip the bottle service unless you wanna spend your entire night waiting.
author: Gabrielle S.

description:
Lolz Raven Bar.

I love this place. Great music, good vibes, reasonable drinks, and friendly staff. So why the three stars?

It just gets SO CROWDED on weekend nights. Like unbearably, can barely with my 6'0 tall frame and pretty strong passive-aggressive pushes get through the crowd and to the bathroom in less than ten minutes crowded. It's hard to enjoy yourself no matter how good the music when there's too many damn people.

I'll be back, but I'll probably complain about the crowds again. Comme ci, comme ça.
author: Courtney C.

description: Me and a guest list of 30 people came this past Saturday to celebrate my gf 21st bday and I can honestly say everyone had a great time. David the manager as well as the bouncer Bull and Ryan took really great care of us offering us water, chips etc. they continue to check in with us asking if we needed anything and it was just great vibes all around. I would give it more stars if I could but I def would recommend coming back to celebrate more events here!!
author: Marvin M.

description:
I came here for a birthday party, and it was awesome! I came before 10 PM (yes, super early) because we weren't on guest list, and my friend didn't want to pay $10 cover fee.

These are my observations:
- The bathroom is tiny. There's one stall on the first floor and one upstairs.

- There are two floors, and we were on the second floor the whole time. Can't comment on the first floor. I heard they closed off the second floor when it reached capacity. You need a wrist band to go up.

- Don't need to buy bottle service to reserve a table (said birthday boy... he bought one later anyway).

- They have water dispensers on the side of the bar. No more asking the bartender for water! Great idea!

- FREE coat check on second floor. Leave a tip to be nice though. :)

- The bartenders were really nice too. :)

- They play 90's hip hop/pop music and even projected the music videos on a screen on the dance floor. Play that BSB song!

- Older crowd = yay! I think the crowd around mid-20's instead of early 20's.

Overall, great place to be at! It's more laid back than a club, but not as much as a bar. I LIKE IT. 4.5 stars! Minus 0.5 stars for bathroom situation. :X
author: Michelle L.

description:
"Let's go to Raven!" These 4 words instill me with fear and excitement, at the same time. Excitement? Because I've never had a bad time at Raven, and the music selection (90's hiphop and R&B) makes it absolute paradise. Fear? Dreading the cramped dance floor, crazy drunkards, and impending hangover that will certainly hit the next morning. 

Like many bar-clubs in SF, the bar is on the bottom floor, and if you want to dance, you'll go upstairs. It gets incredibly crowded later on in the night, and sometimes they don't let you back up for a while if there are too many people... My only gripe. 

You can reserve the back section of the bottom floor, which is awesome for parties of any sort. It probably would seat about 20 people, maybe 40 max standing. 

**Tip**: Put your name on the guestlist if you know you'll be there before 11! Otherwise you'll have to pay $10 cover.
author: Christine L.

description: Wasn't too crowded. Upstairs and downstairs. Drink were good. Not watered down. Street parking available
author: Quincy J. R.

description:
Finally a bar that plays music you can actually dance to! After an unsuccessful night at Mighty, which just wasn't our scene, we randomly picked Raven after seeing it on a couple top 10 lists. Since we had a pretty big group, we just decided to do bottle service since it would get us in with no cover and it just seemed more convenient. Maybe we're just used to Chicago's absurd prices, but the going rate for these bottles actually seemed reasonable. They gave us a table on the first floor. 

As for the atmosphere, the DJ was throwin down 90s jams all night and the crowd was lovin it. There was some great energy on the dance floor upstairs and everyone was just having a good time. The only con was that it was super crowded everywhere you went. It was especially annoying since there was barely any private space in our area and people kept bumping into our table as they were passing by.

Overall, it's pretty tough to pick places to go out at night based on Yelp reviews, but if you're looking for some Top 40 type dance music and don't mind crowds, this is a pretty good spot to check out.
author: Mike M.

description:
Celebrated a birthday here with coworkers. The music was great ( consisted of mostly 90's hip hop and r&b) so needless to say, with a bunch of mid-20-somethings to early 30-somethings, it turned into a karaoke sing-along jam session!

The line moved very quickly, and since my friends were on the guest-list (w/ bottle service) we were able to get in free of charge and they actually honored their guest list unlike many places that do the switcharoo at the door and make you pay with no legitimate reason.
author: Brittney B.

description:
I'm gonna Wreck It! 

Arrive early because this place fills up fast. If you put your name on the guest list, which is super easy via their website, you get in free before 11:00. The front bar area is very narrow. We were piled up 3 deep waiting for them to get our bottle service area set up. There is a larger area in the back and an upstairs with a DJ, bar and area for bottle service. Once our Wreck It Ralph party of 20 area was ready upstairs, we had a blast. Clean, comfy couches and plenty of servers. The music and lighting that the DJ was kicking out was perfect. There was even a large screen on the wall displaying music videos. 

As for the drinks, $9 seems a little steep for a rum & Coke. But hey, you are in San Francisco. At least it was strong & easily obtained. I would definitely come back, theme party or not. 

Remember when I said to get there early? We left at 11:30 and there was a healthy line to get upstairs and an even more impressive line around the block to get in the front door.
author: Jenn N.

description: After two days of recuperating I'm ready to write my review lol. I hosted my sisters' birthday party here on Saturday 4/14. We are super old, so I was a little apprehensive, but how can you go wrong with 90s throwbacks and bottle service. I booked and confirmed the party online with David. He was more than accommodating in my requests (providing an off the menu mixer and increasing my guest list) and answered emails promptly. We were in their VIP area, upstairs next to another bar, the coat check, and the dance floor. The night of the party he came to introduce himself and checked back a few times during the evening. Our server George, did a good job of making sure we had everything we needed-cups, ice, mixers, etc. The bottles were comparably priced, music was good, and a good time was had by all. The whole Raven Bar staff was gracious and very helpful. Thank you David, George, and Melissa for such a great time. Looking forward to having another party to celebrate!
author: Rosalia P.

description:
Updating my review for today - Saturday evening crowd - no diversity at all .. extremely noisy ( seem underage) and unruly . Need to see more engagement from the bouncers to shun off the unruly teenagers . 

Seen this past few weeks .. imma try one more week , after that bye bye little raven
author: Feedback M.

description: Great, chill place to have a birthday party! I really liked the patio area and dance floor upstairs. My friend held her 25th birthday party here, if you call far enough in advance and get there before 10 pm you get the table for no deposit fee. I'd definitely come back here to throw a party or just for a night of fun!
author: Meagan M.

description: Signed up to have my bday there last night and everything was awesome! The doorman remembered us from last time we were here which was uber impressive. The woman who helped me to my table, B, was super hospitable. When it got loud and crowded Sam the bartender was still able to hear my friends and I out to make drinks timely under cool composure. Later on Hannah made me "The Devil's Margarita(?)" which I loved-- tasted like I was a dragon breathing smokey, savory campfire. I also really love the way the DJ transitions inbetween songs, he really knows what he's doing! This is a by and large awesome venue with great staff, just try and get there before it starts to get crowded at 11:00 and everything should be fine.
author: Priscilla F.

description:
Awesome place for a gamut of different events. 

Downstairs: the venue has lots of tables and an outside patio. Most of the tables downstairs are reserved for events (usually birthdays, going-away parties or bachelorette parties). 

Upstairs: this is where it's at! On a typical Saturday evening, you can usually find me and our crew dancing the night away here :) They started doing this ticket system to manage the queue so you can grab a #, run off grab a drink, then come upstairs once your number shows on the screen.

Music is always spot on! 90s, R&B, throwback with lots of Justin (Timberlake, not Bieber) and BritBrit - Oops, It's Gonna Be Me!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Oh man this is a great club!
They did have cover ($10) for a saturday night around 12am, but it was well worth it. It took us a little bit of waiting to get to the top floor, but when we got there it was crazy. The bar was not very crowded, so easy to get drinks. The floor was packed and everyone was in a great mood.
It wasn't a gigantic place so that was a good thing since people used up most of the area and it felt lively. The DJ was awesome, he played a few 90s songs (Larger than Life) and the crowd went crazy.

The highlight was the lazers/lights they had put up, its hard to describe so take a look at the attached photos/videos!

I'd definitely go back to this place again!
author: Arjan N.

description:
THE POSITIVES: 
(+) Raven is probably my favorite bar/ dance lounge on the weekends because THE MUSIC IS BOMB ( dot) COM. I love the whole EDM scene sometimes but it's all about the old school hip hop and this place is hands down the best when it comes to the throwback.

(+) Raven is super on point with their reservation system. The downstairs area is free for booking so if you're planning on having a birthday party then I would recommend emailing them 2/3 weeks ahead of time to get the area booked. You just need to buy your own drinks but it's nice to have your own space. The upstairs space is reserved for bottle service so that's a whole different story. 

THE NEGATIVES:
(- - -) TIP / WARNING/ BEWARE: I would give this place a 4/5 star but bumping it down to 3 stars (the music saved it from 2 stars) because BEWARE OF PHONE THIEVES. I know it's not the club's fault but the crowd is super sketch most of the time. Two of my friends lost their phones this past weekend (and not because they were drunk or wasted but because someone straight up reached into their bags and stole their phones). We notified the securities and they said 6 other people also had their phones stolen that night.... are you .freaking kidding me.. So yes, bring a wristlet or hold onto your phone at all times!!

(-) The crowd control also kind of sucks when it's busy. There's a $10 cover after 10pm and the RIDICULOUS wait to get upstairs can range from 10-30 minutes. If you're planning on coming here around 12/1pm, save the troubles and just hang out downstairs instead of wasting your time in line.
author: Tram N.

description: If you're looking for an intimate speakeasy style lounge then look no further. Raven Bar promotes classy vibes, depending on your alcohol intake, with groovin' jams from old time favorites to crowd pleasing Top 40s (there's even hip hop, which is rare these days, which I'm a huge fan of). Check this place out if you're in the area but don't wait till 11:30pm; this spot fills up quick!
author: Shaun G.

description:
Some friends and I came here on a Saturday night and got there around 11 pm. The line was so long.. and we didn't get in until around 12! Luckily, we were on the guest list and got in for free though.. I'm all for that free stuff :P Otherwise, the cover is $10. 

My friends and I immediately headed over to the bar in the back of the first level. Drinks here are pretty pricey! Each drink we got was about $12.. the drinks were pretty strong so I guess they were worth it.

The place is so crowded that when we tried to head up to the second floor, we could only do so in a 1:1 ratio. As one person came down, one person could go up. So my friends slowly ascended the stairs one by one to this seemingly magical second floor. It took about 10- 15 minutes to get my group of ~10 people up. 

When we got to that second floor, we could see why they were enforcing that rule. It was SO crowded! But it was well worth the wait to come upstairs. The lights here (at least on the second floor) were really unique. They had blue spotted lights that made everyone look like aliens (lol) and other types of lights. Every now and then, fog would mysteriously appear around our feet too! They also projected the music video for whatever song was on on the wall! 

Now what I was not expecting from this night was their music choice. It was basically all 90's music! And some from Top 40. My friends and I really enjoyed just belting out the lyrics we forgot we had committed to memory from those days :P They played songs like 1,2 Step.. and even Fresh Prince of Bel Air lol. Oh, and a lot of Beyonce too! Apparently every Thursday night, it'll be 1999 at Raven Bar.

Overall, I had so much fun here! I would come back again if I am guestlisted :)
author: Sandy Y.

description:
The Good:
* I like the choice of music, some current.. with a mix of britney spears and nsync! YES!!! lol

The Bad:
* I had to pay for cover $10 lame
* and wait in line for 30 minutes

The Weird:
* I had to wait in another line to get upstairs 20 minutes
author: Juliann C.

description:
To the team at Raven Bar & Lounge,

I am not sure where to begin. From the moment I sent my inquiry to host my cousin Rose's bachelorette party, I experienced genuine professionalism. David, thank you so much for your efficency and and quick responses. I had quite a few questions that you answered in detail up to the night before the party. Fast forward to the night of the Bachelorette Party. As we were approaching Raven, the gentlemen at the door were so cool. So cool that one of the girls ask him for some skittles and he gave her some. Our hostess, B met us at the door and took us to our table. She got us started right away. B was very professional in explaining  the issue we were having with the payment. She gave me some instruction and the problem was fixed. As the night progressed, the fun continued. We were so impressed at how attentive everyone was to us, making sure we were having a good time. The music was amazing and we danced all night. The most important person of the night, the bachelorette, enjoyed herself thoroughly. Again, thank you all so much for making Rose's night a memory for the books!! We will definitely be back.
author: Cathy S.

description: I went to Raven for the first time a couple of days ago and it seems like a pretty chill bar. I will say that they're pretty nice about letting people get in for free that are on the guest list. My friends and I showed up around 10:45 on a Friday night and there was a long ass line.. We were still in line when it hit 11 (when guest list closes) but a girl walked through the line asking if anyone was on guest list. She checked our IDs and let us in for free! whoo hoo! If there's one con about this place its that there is only one stall for the women downstairs... Who in their right mind decided to put one stall at a bar?!?! There was a long line to go pee but had to go so bad! LOL other than that I actually had a pretty good time. Raven plays 90s music which is a nice option to have. Totally reminded me of my childhood. lol good songs and chill people!
author: Kelly S.

description:
I cannot stop "raven" about Raven Bar!

PROS: 
- No cover for entrance before 11:00 PM (with guest list) 
- $10 cover for entrance after 10:00 PM (no guest list)
- GREAT dancing music: R&B, Hip Hop, 90s, Top 40s
- Music videos play on their huge TV screens
- Good drinks and friendly bartenders!
- Free coat check upstairs
- More of a laid back vibe
- Not a lot of creepers (hooray)

CONS: 
- Dance floors (upstairs/downstairs) can get crowded

Raven is the go-to dance spot for me and my friends! We love dancing here and belting out into songs that we know (e.g. Nsync's "Bye bye bye" or TLC's "No Scrubs")! You'll definitely have a good time.
author: Kristal D.

description:
Good place for some casual fun and showing off crazy moves on the dance floor. Like everyone else, I like the idea that they play Top 40 and a variety of hip-hop to music from the 90s and old school stuff. The dress code isn't extremely strict here which I like; I've seen guys with backpacks (they have hooks under the bar!) and t-shirts that look like they just got off work to other guys in nice button ups; girls in a plain shirt and jeans to girls dolled up in heels and skirts. I've also experienced more fun with people here because the vibe isn't meant to be super "clubby", and you can still have conversations with people around you. Go upstairs for some dance floor action!

The downside of this place is that it's small. You're bound to have lots of body-body contact whether you like it or not by the dance floor or the bar. Great opportunity to make new friends right?! The drinks are about the same as a nightclub though; roughly $12 for any cocktail and about $7 for a beer on draft. 

I've also noticed the high demand for this place has gone down a little bit which makes guest list easier to sign up on! Get in before 11PM for free entry otherwise it's $10 after.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I really like Raven! Came here on a Thursday and there was no cover.

HUGE fan of the 90s music. Drinks here are super cheap (relatively). Very chill place for thirsty Thursday to just kick it with friends and DANCE!!!!
author: Susan L.

description: Over priced drinks. Bad service- cheap alcohol. Raven has really awful bartenders: a female bartender upstairs judged me and my friends as "drunk" when we were really just having a good time (had not seen each other for a year)... We had been there for no more than 30 minutes and yet they refused to give us service and consequently kicked me and my friend out of the bar for simply questioning their choice of service... no staff member was helpful and in the end one of the security guards went as far as to push me even when I was complying with their rules. This place is too hyped
author: Martha M.

description:
Raven is a dance bar and SO much fun. I also love that the management cares about keeping their clientele happy instead of squeezing money out of them, as evidenced by their easy to navigate website, clear guest list instructions, and attention toward their yelp page.

There's a $10 cover that starts at 10:00 on Fridays and Saturdays, but you can avoid it by signing the guest list on the website and arriving before 11:00. The crowd inside trends younger, which might be because the music is mostly 2000's to present. I liked that it was mostly throwback hiphop and pop; most places to dance in the city focus on EDM. The crowd has been friendly and respectful every time I've been here - full, but no pushing or grabbing.

Drinks aren't bad for SOMA. All in all, Raven is my friend group's go-to bar and is highly recommended.
author: Varsha S.

description: Took friends from out of town to Raven Bar at the end of a night of bar-hopping. Relatively reasonable $10 cover charge and 90's music playing - which we really enjoyed! The staff was super friendly. Only con was that drinks were a bit on the pricier side.
author: Evelyn W.

description: DJ that plays edm, 90s music, and r&b? What more do you want? Oh and there's also room for dancing upstairs. I felt like everybody has their birthday parties here. There's also free coat check, which is greatly appreciated because it's so cold in sf. The drinks are relatively cheap so keep them coming
author: Randy L.

description:
This place is okay. The upstairs can get really crowded quickly. There's a bar upstairs and downstairs with one bathroom on each floor. I dunno why there's only one bathroom since this place gets really packed.

The good thing about this place is that it's fairly empty before 10pm and you don't have to pay a cover until after 10pm. The bad news is if you get there after 10pm, the line is ridiculous. A word to the wise, don't go outside after 10pm or you'll get stuck in the line. Suck it up and stay inside.

My friend reserved a spot and bottle service that came with a bottle of Jameson and three types of sodas.

This was a good spot for Halloween. I've been here on other nights where it wasn't wall to wall crowded and it was just okay. Bars like these aren't really my scene though. I guess that means I'm getting old. Overall, three stars...not amazing but nothing to write home about either.
author: Amy J.

description:
A group of us came here for my friend's bachelorette party. We got on the list and did not pay cover (as long as you arrive before 11:00 p.m.) We started the night with shots of whiskey. 

The music here is great for dancing - R&B, hip hop, and some throwback to the 90's. Everyone had a really good time. The original plan was actually to stay for a bit and consider moving to a second venue just to mix it up, but everyone ended up having so much fun that we stayed. 

By the way, there is a liquor store right next door in case you want to pick up some stuff for the after party...
author: Jenn C.

description:
I came to Raven for a friend's birthday and I would definitely consider coming back! 

I recommend singing up for the guestlist as soon as as you decide on coming because they do close the guestlist once it's full. Better safe than sorry!
