Expect to wait awhile if you come closer to 11pm when guestlist closes. A girl was checking the line and stamping those on the guestlist. My friends and I got our stamps but still had to pay $10 right at 11pm. What's the point of stamping everyone then?

The music here is pretty good for the most part! They played old school 90's/early 2000's and hip hop. I will say that the music started off great but worsened to obscure songs the longer I was there... to the point where my friends and I were confused as to how to even dance to certain a songs. Perhaps that's how they get people to leave towards the end of the night.

As for drinks, my friends and I had bottle service and they were nice enough to check to make sure the mixers were refilled. I had their lychee cocktail which was refreshing! Not your typical watered down, 75% ice drink. 

- As a side note, the crowd here is primarily Asian. 
- They do have a free coat check, so take advantage of that. 
- Parking can be difficult, as expected in the city. 
- The dress code here is relaxed, so no need to bust out a dress and heels unless you want to!

Overall, Raven has great drinks and music so I would recommend checking it out on your next night out in the city.
author: Charlene E.

description: Good music, great vibe. Hurry!  Happy hour til 8pm.  They accept credit cards- very attentive staff!!
author: Duncan H.

description: Not my scene. I went here on a whim, bumped into an acquaintance. I had one drink which was tasty but not cheap. With the entrance fee that put my expense at $24. For what? The music was hip-hop from the '90s. People joyously danced and sang along. Some of the tunes I didn't recognize and were really dorky. It was over-crowded. The bouncers were friendly and one of them let me upstairs. People were having a ball but I didn't click with the vibes. A conventional, claustrophobic club on a Saturday night....
author: Paul M.

description:
It's a pretty chill bar in the city.   They have a couple dance floors and a three bars.   We got there to meet a group celebrating a birthday.   They were late so we just chilled at the main bar for an hour while we waited for them.   It's a younger crowd there for sure, like late 20's.   But the people were all low key and having a good time.   Once the rest of our party got there, we hung out in the back bar area.   There were two bartenders there, one was teaching the other.   The experienced guy poured great drinks all night long.   The newer bartender was learning, but was making rookie mistakes.   That's ok, everyone has to learn.   Some of the drinks were pretty complex, but the experienced guy nailed them.   The dance floor got going pretty good too.   
Will I be back?   Sure, why not?
author: Bill C.

description:
I used to really love this place. I would like to refer to myself as an OG for this venue space. I've been coming here since it was Dragon SF. So I have definitely seen it at its best and its worst.

The pros: The music is great and the drinks aren't too expensive. I also really like the manager (not sure if he's the owner too), but he is super nice and friendly. Every time I go there he always comes up to me and tells me "Thank you for waiting. It shouldn't be too much longer." Honestly, to me thats really nice of someone to do. Most place don't care if you are waiting. Also, the bottle service area is great, especially the one upstairs. Love it!

The cons: The space is pretty small and narrow so be careful. There is a 2nd floor, but sometimes there are so many people that you have to wait in line just to get upstairs. Also I think the DJ is a little power hungry. I guess they installed a new AC system in the place and if the DJ sees anyone near it he'll get the bouncers to kick them out. I understand he's doing his job and the AC is probably expensive, but if it was that precious then maybe you should put a sign warning people. Look at that! Problem solved and no more angry drunk patrons.

Lastly, make sure to get on the guest list so you don't have to pay, but make sure you get there before it closes at 11 pm. Be careful though, if you get there too late, they'll just make you wait there to give the illusion that a ton of people want to be in there and that it is packed.
author: Theo T.

description:
Party up top, business on the bottom.  We crashed some futuristic dance party that was going on here last Tuesday at the upstairs bar.  The bar was packed, as was the dance floor, but the music was fun, like 90s jams. Although the dance floor is pretty small, there were still a lot of people getting down. I like the blue lasers, they looked pretty dope.
  At the bar they make a good old fashioned, can take a while to get drink when its busy.  Nice little neighborhood bar.
author: Spencer W.

description:
Not a bad place to dance to some old school hip hop! I love my EDM, but it's hard to find a club/bar that still plays those throwback jams!! It takes me way back! Love my 90's music haha.

The drinks here are definitely expensive (~$13), but they're good and not watered down either. I love the Lychee Bliss. The bathrooms are pretty clean too.

It gets a little crowded upstairs on the dance floor, and it's definitely a younger crowd. Overall, I had a good time here and would come back again if I'm not too sick of alcohol yet. (Not gonna lie, the AMF's got me...)

Beware - $10 cover charge after 10 pm, unless you're on the guest list.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Went to Holy Cow first at 10:25pm to get in for free, was alright. Friends decided to meet at Raven instead ($10 cover)

Music: backstreet boys, classic bay area hip hop, pop crowd pleasers, (no fetty wap)

Space: tight and narrow, 2 bars downstairs, 1 bar upstairs, aka perfect for having fun (vs huge empty open areas at Holy Cow), small and tight outside smoking area for getting to know strangers

Service: excellent on a busy Friday night, $9 shots (vs $12 at Holy Cow), took about 15 minutes to go upstairs around 12am, bouncers and bartenders were very friendly
author: Lana D.

description: Fun spot for dancing especially if you're trying to avoid EDM music ( my #1 goal when I go out). They play the usual hip hop/throwback stuff and you'll definitely have a good night of dancing. The drinks are super wallet friendly as well. They have a back bar space that you can reserve for a private party which is great for birthday parties and such. Upstairs can get pretty crowded later into the night and there can be a line to go up, but I like that they keep the downstairs area fun too. The main bummer is that there isn't much else around this bar if you wanted to hit up second spot. Also, they charge $10 cover (get on their online guest list to avoid it) which I think is a bit steep.
author: Renu A.

description: First time coming to this bar in San Fran. Here for a friends 30th bday celebration. Had bottle service and Linda was great with customer service. Always made sure our juices and drinks were refilled and that we were having fun! Loved the music tonight! Oldies and throwbacks to 90s! Definitely would come back again!
author: Sara S.

description: We came to celebrate my boyfriends 39th birthday and my girlfriends 40th. We reserved a table and the hostess were awesome! The manager even came by to introduce himself, wish then a happy birthday and gave them a birthday card. There was even a few party decorations. The music was awesome! 90s music! We danced all night. I will definitely be back the next time we're in SF!
author: Amelia N.

description:
I hate this place. The music is fine but it's over capacity and they still admit people in. My sis and her man almost got into a fight because they were bumping into other dancers. 
The staff wasn't helpful either. I wanted to speak to the manager and they said they don't know where he is. Awful experience and will never return.  I hope they get fined someday for over admitting people. Selfish owner doesn't even care about the safety of the people who could easily hurt themselves from bumping into others. 
Avoid at all cost.
author: Tay O.

description:
my girl and I ended up going to this place because our first option was closed for private event.
There was a long line outside the door but the wait wasn't that long.$10 door.
They play old school 90s & 00s music- which I loved. the dance floor is quite small but not much people were dancing so it didnt bother me.
would love to go back
author: Learnee L.

description:
We celebrated a birthday and reserved a table with bottle service. We communicated with David and from the beginning, the planning went so smoothly. David returned all my emails quickly and helped us plan an amazing night! They made it so easy and convenient and everything was ready by the time we arrived. The only reason it's 4 stars instead of 5 is because the music was just okay. I wish there was more pop music
!
author: Jill Y.

description:
Not feeling like dancing to EDM tonight? THEN GO HERE!

It's a small-medium size dance/bar lounge with 2 floors. Great music that ranges from 90's hip hop to top 40s to boy band favorites like Backstreet Boys. They even have the music videos playing on their huge TV screens upstairs to make you that much more nostalgic.

No need to freeze in line, they have complimentary coach check upstairs ;). It's quite casual so feel free to wear what you want!

Cover: free before 11pm w/ guest-list and $10 after 10pm with no guest-list!
author: Kathy L.

description:
I moved to SF to get out more, be able to drink a lot and be able to cab back home,  and have access to the most eligible men in the U.S. but then a couple things happened. 1. I got a bf, so no more eligible men for me  2.Uber and Lyft raised their surcharge prices to exorbitant levels, and 3. I found Raven. So now I don't go anywhere else, because all I need is Raven!
 
They play my hip hop music all night long (none of that EDM bs), they  intermix the  hip hop music of my youth ( late 1990's-2000) and I don't need to worry about paying for drinks because....I have a bf ;) #boysshouldbuythedrinks
author: Julianna I.

description: Despite the crowd not being my absolute favorite, the music is ALWAYS amazing and drinks are very strong. If I were to ever be at a loss of where to go for a night out, I will always think of (and most likely visit) Raven Bar.
author: Tina T.

description: Went on a Friday night for cocktails. They were decent. Prices typical for SF.  Bartenders were extremely nice. Place emptied out completely by 8pm. Is this a Friday thing in SF?  Enjoyed my time there.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
One word for this place L-O-V-E!!!!  

On my Friday pub crawling adventure, my friend suggested this bar after our wine tasting was  a dud and boy was I impressed.  I got there around 5 when the front bar was empty, then the crowds started building up.  There are 3 sections, the front bar, the lounge place in the middle and the top level with a dance floor.  The decor was pretty and upscale.  

For drinks I think I had something similar to a Basil Gimlet, very refreshing and delish! My other cocktail was a Lychee Martini.  Both are a definite must try!  Overall I am very pleased and impressed with my experience here and I cannot wait to go back for some more HH!!!  Definitely my go to spot from now on.
author: Katie N.

description: Love Raven! Great music every time I go, lots of throwbacks, plenty of space and options to move from front bar to dance floor to back bar to upstairs, good drinks and reasonably priced. Definitely has become a great go to spot for me and my group.
author: Crystal C.

description:
New Years 2015 was a success!

Their New Years entrance fee was $35 with free party flavors and a free mini bottle of champagne! 

My friends and I were scrambling to get party flavors thinking Raven Bar would only offer the minimal. But I am so glad we weren't able to get any! (We went to BK beforehand to get food, and desperately took some BK crowns for plan b...) When we entered, they had the exact party favors we wanted. 2015 tiaras and eyeglasses! You should've seen the looks on our faces.. priceless. 

Even though we had a big group, we decided against getting a table. Online it said we only needed to get one bottle, but when my friend was contacted, she was told 2. No thanks, we don't need that much to have fun anyways. 

For drinks, most of us got their Lychee Bliss, Ciroc peach vodka, Chambord, Cointreau, lychee, orange. I was really surprised they used real lychee rather than syrup! It was really good, and it was topped off with a lychee piece, a plus! My other friend got their Herbal Remedy, Zubrowka bison grass vodka, St. Germain, lime, apple, agave & muddled basil. I took a sip and it was light and refreshing! 

For the dance area, we went to the second floor. It was the perfect amount of people, not too crowded but not too empty. It was packed by midnight though. And wow, their type of music was totally in our zone. Literally, throwback Thursday. From 90's to today's hit, every song was on point! 

A few downsides. They expected us to carry the champagne drink ticket till midnight. I wish they had a better way of issuing that, because my friend misplaced hers early in the night and we couldn't do anything about it. Security would've been helpful on the second floor, there was a guy smoking in the corner in the midst of the fog machine and it was gross. 

Overall, it wasn't too bad but could've been better. In the end, we all had a good time. 

P.S. They only have one bathroom! So the wait might take a while.

They have free coat checks on the second floor.
author: Winnie I.

description:
This place is fun, yet pretty unforgettable. Drinks are good and prices are not too bad considering the location. Ravens plays 90's music that will make you have nostalgia, and it's always a good time since many of the songs you'll be able to sing along to.

Overall, it gets super crowded, and there isn't much space in there as it is. I think it is worth a visit, and I'm sure you'll enjoy your time if you're ok with many people in your space.

Pros: 3 stars
+nostalgic 90's music you can sing to
+good drink selection 
+not overpriced for a downtown lounge 

Cons: -2 stars 
+crowded/packed due to small space
+only 1 bathroom per floor (per gender)
author: Alex B.

description: I came here for my birthday with my friends and we all had a great time. The club gave me a complimentary drink too :) I loved their music because it was a mixture of the 90s to current hip hop/rap/R&B. I definitely would come back here!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Had an awesome time yesterday at Raven's bar! Friday's are when they play 90s music which is just a win win situation. The cost for drinks is also a reasonable price. The Long Island and AMF cost $12 dollars and was pretty good. Love the good vibes raven's bar gives. Theirs are two floors. The ground floor is more of a laid back kind of feeling while upstairs is where the real party and dancing begins. Make sure to put your name on the guest list before you go to this bar so you can get in for free but make sure you go before 11pm or you pay the cover charge.
author: Roseanne V.

description: The bar pours shitty drinks. Bouncers think they're tough.  Poor management all around and ten dollar cover for one of the worst bars in San Fran.
author: B. S.

description:
First experience of SF night life. So different (in a good way) compared to LA. This is probably the first time I saw Mariah Carey on screen at a club, ever! 10/10 music selection- old school hip hop. Two story lounge- good vibes, good energy. Thanks to our bartender Chris for my birthday drinks ^_^. Drinks were such a good price, it'd make you feel like tipping. 

Entry fee from what I heard was $10 for a Saturday night. Not bad at all. No line when we walked up, but a really nice amount of people inside- crowded, but walkable. I'm happy we hit up this bar for my 23rd!
author: Linda L.

description:
Overall awesome experience!
Cover: free before 11 w/ guestlist. $10 after 10 with no guestlist

Drinks: fast and just enough alcohol! But felt a bit watered down. Loved their lychee bliss but bartender Su? Gave me 50% ice so it felt like I was drinking 8oz iced tea in a tall glass (12oz). Tried rum and coke as well. Okay for $9 each. Should've checked in to get yelp offer for $3 off drinks but oh well.

Atmosphere: very chill! Loved the hip hop songs for Friday night which were very upbeat. Crowd was mostly asian males so ladies beware lol. I had a fairly big group for my friends birthday (10-15) and it got packed on the Dance floor upstairs.
author: May A.

description:
I went to Raven Bar for a YEE back when I lived in SF and had an amazing time. Raven Bar's high standards for cocktails, modern and classy interior and great service stuck with me, so when it came time to plan my high school reunion, I had it in the back of my mind to throw the event here. Unfortunately for me and the rest of the reunion committee, we had basically no venue budget since our high school didn't assist with reunions. Luckily, Raven Bar came to the rescue. I submitted an event inquiry on their website and they got back to me right away. I explained to David our situation and he was able to reserve us the upper lounge for free, with DJ, as long as we could bring in $500 towards bar purchases. Communicating with David and his team was super easy via email, and something I truly appreciated since I had to plan the event remote from Las Vegas. They provided us with a separate entrance for our event, privacy for 3 hours (although we could have opted for 4 hours), signage for our event outside, and a personalized table-top cocktail menu with drinks that paid homage to our high school. DJ Mark was great at providing music video mixing during the event and playing a ton of songs from the late 90s and early 2000s. He also made sure the slideshow we provided was playing on 3 of their TV screens (while music videos played in the rest). Luckily, hitting the $500 bar tab was super easy since their bartenders make tasty drinks. I was really impressed at everyone's professionalism and would throw another event here in a heartbeat. If I lived in the Bay Area still, I would definitely break my rule of staying at home whenever possible, and come out here for their chill vibe, great music and thoughtful cocktails. Everyone had such a fun time at the reunion and we got so many compliments on venue selection!

(Sidenote: some folks did order food from Triptych and have it delivered to Raven Bar - the sweet potato fries were yummy!)
author: Ghia G.

description:
This is the place to be.  I love that they play hip hop and R&B.  All other places nowadays only play EDM.  It is so amusing when Nelly- Ride Wit Me comes on.  Everyone seems to react to this song the most.  They act like they know the words to the song and start dancing.  It is just hilarious to watch.  There are also televisions on the walls showing the music videos which I think is cool.  

They also have multiple table services on the main level and top floor. The top floor consists of a small dance area located in the back.  Bathrooms are located on both floors.  There is a smoking area located on the bottom as well.  Drinks can be purchased at the three bar areas that they offer.  Ventilation is really good here.  One must not need to worry about it being too hot.  

Overall, a good place for friends to hang out and have a good time.  This place gets the Victor stamp of approval.
author: Victor L.

description:
You say you want non-pretentious fun with 90's hip-hop(and later) music to dance to, stiff drinks, and super cool management and staff that's easy to deal with? Go to Raven then.

Their public guest-list gets you in for free before 11 pm or else it's $10. There are two bars downstairs with four booths(that can be reserved ahead of time), and a dance area in between the booths. There is another bar, private table, and main dance floor upstairs which by the wee hours of the night could get congested as the staircase traffic is regulated. 

The GM, David, was super friendly and thorough to deal with when I reserved a table, and all of their staff provided superior customer service during the entire night.
author: Dennis W.

description:
When I first heard that we were going to hold our after party to celebrate my birthday at Raven, I honestly wasn't sure what to expect. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised! My fiance was able to pre-arrange with the GM a nice booth to hold our party of 20 and they even had birthday decorations on the wall, and a birthday crown for me to wear. I was so very impressed! At the last minute we decided to not have my birthday cake at dinner and so we brought the cake into Raven hoping they could accommodate us. Again, David the GM, instantly sprang into action and grabbed a server to bring over forks, plates, serving knife, and even a candle for me.

The service at the bar was amazing also! The wait at 11pm wasn't bad and when one of the bartenders heard it was my birthday he bought my girlfriend and I a drink(and it was a double drink, at least). Later in the night, when I needed some water and I was about to pour some from self service bottle at the bar, the bartender instantly handed me two bottled waters without me saying a word. I don't remember receiving such friendly and warm service at a bar.

There are two bars on the first floor and because I was having such a good time dancing with my friends in front our booth near the back bar, I didn't venture upstairs, where my friends said it was packed like sardines.

The music all night was 90's, and mostly hip hop, which is fabulous for dancing and just having a good time. I think we all hear enough EDM these days to take a break from it once in a while.
author: Angela L.

description:
Came to Raven on a random Wednesday night while I was up in SF for a work conference. It was pretty empty... and that was the most awesome part. There was enough room to walk around, chill, and dance. Bartenders give you their undivided attention. The music was the next best thing... played everything from TLC to new top 40's shit to Backstreet Boys. I went from drinking to dancing to Chasin' Waterfalls to dancing to Shmurda to singing "I want it that wayyyyyyyyy" ... it was awesome.

Don't go here on a Saturday though. I heard it's hot as balls and Asian central and disgusting. Well unless you're into that.
author: Elysse P.

description:
Raven, you got me crushin on you.

Bartenders that actually smile, HOT HOT HOT dance floor (2nd floor is much better!), booths for private parties and an outside patio to cool yourself if it gets too stuffy inside.

I don't go clubbing anymore, but Raven brought me back. Waaay back into the 80's 90's and the boy band era.  I mean, Justin Timberlake didn't even have chest hair! (oooh, but I still like him though) And it's good to end the night with hip-hop music coz let's face it, all that twerking you do at home in your living room? FINALLY pays off, right?! :p

I loved the Fuego cocktail, which has tequila, jalapeño, cucumber and lime juice. If you need to take the edge off a little bit, do an extra shot of tequila at the bar. Don Julio knows wassup.
author: Janice C.

description: Dope spot, music was 90% 90s. Good crowd (lots of Asians).
author: Kevin N.

description: I love the 90s music and the screen that plays music video. Top floor is bomb but it could get crowded. The best thing is the staff they are all so sweet from the bouncers to the people working in the club. So I had a general guest list but I was 10 minutes late and they pulled strings so we can come in for free. I popped my knee dancing and fell and the staff inside help me up found me a place to sit and check if I was okay every 5 minutes and asked if I needed anything and it was like 3 staff. The environment is super chill.
author: Sofia L.

description: This Saturday the 30th I celebrated my 30th birthday at Raven Bar. I am so glad we chose Raven. The staff was very accommodating, the price was very good, the music was awesome, and I kept meeting friendly people who were up for a good night like my group and I. We loved the mix of music that they were playing. David was easy to talk to and since we were communicating through email, he got back to me really fast. The drink prices were pretty decent for San Francisco. All in all it was a totally memorable night! Thank you Raven Bar for having my guest and I we all had so much fun! We will definitely come back!!!
author: Norlynn P.

description: I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!! I've usually gone on Saturday nights and I have never been disappointed. In my opinion they have the best music - almost always 90s, early 00s hip hop and rap. Cover is $10/person, and there is a free coat check which is nice. The biggest dance floor is on the 2nd floor up the stairs. The bathrooms are clean and I've never really had to wait in a long bathroom line before.
author: Vanessa M.

description: Vibe was great here, got in easily with a group of friends and they were checking in coats for free which was nice. The music was awesome as I love to dance but edm and all the mainstream stuff can get repetitive and boring. Had a great time here while I was visiting the bay!
author: Shareen D.

description: Great location!  Love the atmosphere!  We came to celebrate my girl's birthday and the staff members were amazing!  So attentive and accommodating!!
author: Janelle D.

description: Signed up on website. Sadly, the website made an error and my friends and I weren't on the guest list. The ticket taker on Saturday 9/23 was rude and unapologetic to the error. Thankfully, the two bouncers were kind and professional. While we stay had to pay the bouncers we're kind and apologetic. Maybe the raven should hire new ticket takers who have skills in customer service or just give their bouncers more money.
author: Zoe G.

description:
I haven't been to a venue that even resembles a club in forever! So I wasn't sure if I was going to like Raven. Surprisingly, I had a great time! They play great music here. A mix of 80s/90s/early 2000s, hip hop, pop, etc. A lot of my favs. Plus I do love dancing!

It can get crowded, so if you'd like to dance the night away, get there early so you can get upstairs. There's a bar and dance floor there. They only let a certain number of people up there at a time, so the line can get a little long. Downstairs, it's a little more loungy, but it can get super stuffy when crowded. I found myself out in the smoking patio for the last hour or so since I needed air.

Not sure if there's a cover, but we were on a table guest list and got in for free. We did show up early though. Around 10p.

Again great music and a nice vibe. Given my old age, I almost skipped going to Raven since I felt too old for the club scene. I'm glad I didn't!
author: Elena N.

description: This is the type of bar/lounge I've been searching for! 1. We got there right before 10 so we didn't pay a cover fee 2. They played 90s music all night which totally brought us back. We sang our hearts out and had a blast 3. You can reserve a whole booth for FREE which came clutch when wanting to take a break from dancing 4. LINDA! She is AMAZING. The cutest, most sweetest waitress. She constantly came by and brought us bottled waters for FREE and came by to clean our tables off and just to make sure we didn't need anything. The customer service here is amazing and so are the vibes. I highly recommend!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
We didn't mean to come here, but stumbled in as we were waiting for a show down the street to begin. What a great random treat! The space is excellent for a casual drink or a more ruckus time with friends. 

I was truly impressed with the mixologist behind the bar! He was clearly knowledgeable, and improvised very well. 

raven will definately be added to our regualrs list when in that neighborhood.
author: Greg F.

description:
Had my bday here, nothing short of amazing in customer service. 
David made sure all of our guests were taken care of and was incredibly professional and friendly in doing so. 
Security was helpful bringing a bottle of water and napkins to a friend who couldn't get in due to inebriation who was also bleeding after a fall. 
Sam and Hannah took care of our table needs and were very friendly. 
Jeff checked on us often to make sure everything was okay as well. They even got me a birthday card.
Natalie was very friendly in coat check!
Nothing bad about the night.
author: Matt T.

description:
Maybe it's just (the grossly immature 10 year old in) me, but as we walked into Raven, I just wanted to start screaming, "CAW! CAW!" at the top of my lungs.  Fortunately for me, my friends, and everyone within shouting distance, I restrained myself, for fear of overly embarrassing the birthday girl.  (Side note: And no, not as some sort of mating call to attract the ladies, as my friend suggested.  Plus, if it did work, I would have some serious questions about those girls...).

Over the last year or so, Raven has, for better or worse, become quite a popular spot in SoMa.  The only reason why I say "worse" is that, despite having two floors, the place isn't all that spacious.  In fact, it gets really cramped really fast, so arriving earlier is better.  While we were able to walk right upstairs (with no cover), our friends arrived 45 minutes later and had to wait in line downstairs.  Thus, once you make it upstairs, stay there. 

Since we spent pretty much the entire night on the upper level, I can't speak to what the lower level is like.   Upstairs though, there's a good amount going on - more of a club-ish vibe, with a decently sized bar, a handful of tables, bathrooms, and a modest sized dance floor.  The highlight though might have been the music (and the lax dress code), which was mostly top-40 and hip-hop ranging from 90's hits to today.

If it weren't for how uncomfortably crowded the upper level got, and if my friends and I were still into the scene, I'm sure I'd be an advocate for returning to Raven.  It certainly doesn't hurt that there's a Mission Dog Cart right outside either.  In this case though, Raven Bar was just fine for a quick hit-and-run for a birthday party, and far more appealing than some of the clubs and venues we used to go to.

THREE AND A HALF rounded down.

CAW!
author: Mike L.

description:
I am actually a pretty big fan of this place, surprisingly, since I didn't expect to like it at all. I came here for a birthday party where my friends got a table, and found out many other of my friends were also at the same bar by coincidence! 

The bar area at the entrance is small, but very well staffed with several bartenders tending to the thirsty crowd. It was more crowded around 11pm than it was around 12am. The back bar is super busy through and it takes a while to get service. 

They have some top shelf liquor in the front, not so much in the back. They play music / mostly hip hop on the weekends so you will find lots of sweaty people and good and bad dancing. Definitely a great place to check out for a group / party. Don't expect craft drinks tho!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Booked a table with bottle service for a birthday. I have to say they have amazing service, the price was not bad at all and the music was great! We went on a Friday night. They were really attentive and the manager was super nice and checked in once in a while to make sure we were good! Best birthday we have ever celebrated with the best service!
author: Gabriela A.

description:
Had a fun time for a friend's birthday here. She had the back of the first floor reserved and we essentially had that separate bar in the back to ourselves. The back was still part of the flow of the bar but felt like its own room which was nice.

No cover before 10pm! Show up early.

Saturday night drinks menu 7/13/13: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/raven-bar-san-francisco?select=zBS33N8QW1KnUV52Ug1oxg#zBS33N8QW1KnUV52Ug1oxg

* Switchblade - 4 stars
(spicy yet smooth; bright yet intense.  Raven's spicy signature cocktail blends our homemade jalapeno cilantro honey syrup and fresh citrus with premium tequila)
Great spicy drink! Light and refreshing.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Wow! What a great place to have a birthday party! We reserved the back room for a birthday and everything was set up perfectly! Signs, a free tiara, and roped off area. 

We ran into a snag where there wasn't a separate line for the birthday guests, but David took care of us. He made the night feel special and allowed us to expedite our friends in, even with the free reservation.

All in all, we had a blast! They gave us a drink voucher, vip pass for next time, and more. Definitely having more parties here! They went above and beyond!
author: Albert K.

description:
Raven Bar

Last night I got tired of binge watching Netflix's Orange is the new black season 2, so I decided to come out to the city to meet up with some friends. I looked at the yelp reviews prior, so I wasn't really that thrilled to come here but I needed to get out. 

My first thoughts upon walking towards Raven was, "Lines lines lines yeah!" (Read that with Thompson Twins in mind)

If you want to practice being patient you won't be disappointed coming here. There's a line for EVERYTHING. 
A line to get in, a line to use the restroom, and line to go upstairs ('m not kidding) accompanied by a bouncer that guards the stairs.
Prepare to stand in line and pointlessly scroll through your instagram or FB feed on your smart phone.

There is a $10 cover charge and that includes ladies as well, which I thought was kind of odd. Don't ladies usually always get in for free? 

Also, the floors are STICKY as hell. It gets so crowded that people bump into each other and it becomes a wet and wild contest with all the spilled drinks sloshing in the air and splashing on the floor. 

They play some old school nostalgic hip hop which was actually pretty nice. Everyone was reciting the lyrics to the songs they used to dance to in middle school. They played songs like "Ghetto superstar", "Dilemma", "Everybody in the club getting tipsy", etc. Basically everything I haven't heard in ages.

The crowd was friendly and the drinks were strong. 
Overall I had a good night.  

3/5 stars
author: Tim C.

description: The staff is fantastic. Alas the clientele has become a haven for entitled, horrible people - so if you want to have a good time, you won't have it there because of who the bar attracts. I don't think the people going there are having a good time. You can't be that collectively toxic and enjoy *anything*.
author: Diana R.

description:
Raven bar is a cute and intimate place to swing by and grab a drink. Happy hour goes until 8pm so it's plenty of time. There are sections of couches for a perfect group environment and the drinks are quite tasty. 

I was there for happy hour and specialty cocktails were $9. Beers are $5 and wines are $6-7. It's not too bad for San Francisco. Basically this place is a nice place to chillax for a hit before hitting up another spot for the night. 

There is absolutely no food tho- another reason to not stay long.
author: April Z.

description:
I chose Raven Bar as the venue for my birthday party because my best friend had her birthday here a couple of years ago and it was so much fun. This time around it was even better!

Booking a table is FREE, no bottle service is required, and you get to have up to 19 people on a private guest list for free entry all night! Reserving a space was super easy. I filled out an online request form 2-3 weeks before the event and I received an e-mail from David the General Manager a few days later. We finalized the details of the reservation and he answered all my questions through e-mail. It was very quick and easy. AND on the day of my party David came up to my booth and personally greeted me. I even got a birthday tiara and a card with 2 VIP passes. 

My party was the Saturday after Thanksgiving so it was pretty packed. Me and a small group from my party arrived around 9-930. It wasn't crowded that early in the night but definitely filled up later on, but I had a pretty big group with me so we held down our space haha. There was a little bit of a wait for the line to go upstairs to the main dance floor but a friend of mine was able to talk to "a guy" who spoke to the bouncer guarding the stairs and he got a group of us to skip the line. I LOVE the music the play at Raven Bar! A lot of throwbacks. The drinks are average price for an SF bar but very good. One of the best places for Midori Sour. 

All in all I had an amazing time and all of my friends they had a lot of fun too. I will definitely be coming back to Raven Bar and also recommend it to others!
author: Miko I.

description:
Celebrated my birthday on a Saturday night in August and thoroughly enjoyed myself (from what I can remember tehehe).

I love that you can reserve a booth WITHOUT bottle service (be sure to book it at least a few weeks in advance on their website since they tend to fill up quickly). 

The communication process was seamless - I sent a request on Raven Bar's website on 7/27/15 for a 20-person booth (I believe that's the largest booth you can reserve) for a birthday celebration on 8/15/15. I got a response the following day (7/28/15) from David stating that there was only one booth left. I obviously swooped on that real quick and he was very quick to reply and confirm everything! He said I would receive a separate email the Monday before the event where I can add up to 20 people (including myself) on a private all-night guest list. Once Mon, 8/10/15 rolled by, lo' and behold there was my email and private guestlist link! 

$10 cover starts at 10pm. I know some Yelpers said they had issues with the private guestlist and still had to pay $10, but all my friends who came in after 10pm had no problems at all - happy friends = happy birthday girl. 

Kudos for actually having a "Happy Birthday" banner and a sign that said "Tina's Birthday Party" on the wall and table - I definitely wasn't expecting anything to be honest so I appreciated the gestures! The booth itself seemed pretty small to fit 20 people, but who sits down the whole time anyway? 

Loved the music! It was a good mix of top 40s, your favorite hits from the 2000s, and some 90s hiphop. It wasn't superrr crowded but it was still a full house from what I can remember. If anyone's wondering, crowd itself consisted of mainly whites and Asians. There was no rowdiness or aggressive groping (ladies, I know you feel me on this one) - so that was a plus. But what I do remember is LISA THE BARTENDER - super cute Asian girl with the sweetest personality. She took care of me and my friends at the bar and even named a drink after me. What was the drink made of? Your guess is as good as mine. But it was delicious. 

Would I come back again? Definitely.
author: Tee C.

description: 90s music videos blasting on a huge screen --- awesome!!! And really great drinks, I highly recommend the Herbal Remedy (refreshing mix with vodka). This is a two story bar/lounge, with a good wild crowd. It of course got crazy packed after midnight, just like every place at this point in the city. I would for sure recommend for you to check this place out, mostly for the Thursday 90s night!
author: Nikita K.

description:
Average bar based on my own preferences, but if the music appeals to you, then it's worth checking out.  

Pros:
- Friendly bartender 
- Bar/lounge balance is great! Dance floor on the 2nd floor and bars on on both floors. 
- Free coat check on the weekends! + tip of course 

Neutral:
- Average prices - $12 per cocktail

Cons:
- Music hits one specific genre on Friday nights, which is the night I went: 90s hip hop. So if you're not in your late twenties, then chances are that you aren't going to be familiar with a lot of the music.
author: Irene X.

description: Very nice cozy lounge. Drinks were off the chain, literally exceeded expectations. Staff was nice and friendly and although the DJ present on a Monday night they still had some good music playing. I will definitely be back.
author: Koby G.

description: Always loved Raven, have been going here for years.  However the DJ tonight was EXTREMELY rude, condescending, and disrespectful.  It's absolutely understandable if a DJ may not be familiar with a song, but there is a much more polite and respectful way to address a customer's song request. The rude DJ was an absolute buzz kill to a good night and made me want to leave.
author: Christine C.

description: Had my birthday party here and it was awesome. First, you can get a free reservation for a booth, WITHOUT bottle service!! How awesome is that? Plus you get a free private 20-person guest list (read: no cover for your guests) for your event. Awesome again. I've never been to Raven but the music here is awesome. Who doesn't love throwback 90s pop and hip hop? Awesome time guaranteed.
author: Sherry L.

description: This is a very nice and chill bar. We stopped by when we got lost looking for another bar. Sam the bartender was really great and suggested that we take a tour of anchor brewing which we did the next day and it was amazing! Definitely will come back again when I'm in town.
author: Paula S.

description:
Absolutely amazing! I love this place. 

I decided to have my birthday party here this year because I've heard great things. They were so accommodating and let me book a large table reservation for free! No bottle service required. When I had arrived I didn't expect much but I had a large table booth and they had set up a sign and things that said happy birthday to me! All personalized. Super sweet!

The music was awesome. 90s hits all night long made me feel like a kid again. So fun and it's awesome that they have the music videos playing a long with the songs, a blast from the past! The dancing can get a little crowded, but what good dance floor doesn't?! 

Now onto the drinks. The bar is crowded but when you can get to the bad it's awesome. All the bar tenders are great and when you tell them to "surprise you" with a drink, they really do and it's always great! The bartenders know their stuff!

The one thing I didn't like was that I had a personal guestlist with my friends on it but they only had 1 line outside. My friends would wait in the long line but raven said they would go trough the line and ask if ppl were on the list so that they would get in faster. This was not the case. This is the only thing that upset me. Otherwise it was a great place and I can definitely see myself going back!
author: Elysia M.

description:
Hate EDM? Love throwback hip hop/R&B? Then Raven Bar is the hot spot for your drunk self!

First time on a Friday night. Parking was surprisingly not a problem; we parked about a block away from the venue. But parking in the city always depends on the time and area, but from previous experience, finding parking on Folsom is pretty stress free. 

Got in for free because me and my friends signed up for the guest list earlier in the day. If you're on the guest list, arrive before 11pm. Ive heard that sometimes, the line may get long so take that into consideration and time accordingly that you get checked in by 11 to get in for free. If all else fails and you need to pay, it's about $10 for the cover fee. FREE COATCHECK! like whaaat, I was appalled because that is rare.

The music.... omg. I'm a big fan of throwback R&B and hip hop, so I felt like I was taken back to the 90s and early 2000s. Plus they play the music videos, which was pretty nostalgic. The crowd was cool; got pretty crowded upstairs, but everyone was having a good time.

The drinks were the usual, about like $12 or more. Pregame, bar hop, and ending the night at the Raven Bar equals a night that's totally worth the hangover.
author: Margaret W.

description: Great place to hang out! Always bumping, and the music selection is great! Can get a bit crowded, especially upstairs.
author: Kinsley W.

description:
Lookin' for a place that plays a variety from old school hip-hop to top 40? This is the place to be!

I've come here in multiple occasions - birthdays, hang outs, etc; it's a nice go to place on Folsom. One thing that erks me is that sometimes they would hold the line because they've reached maximum capacity... I mean I guess that's cool for the people inside that don't have to be squished in between sweaty bodies, but it sucks for people that are outsiiiide... And this place has two stories, I don't really see it get THAT crowded except the top floor's dance floor. And then magically after it's past 11PM (when GL closes) the line magicallyyy moves forward... lol.

There's multiple bars and I've only really bought drinks from the upstairs bar, but my experience from upstairs has been great. They're really good at giving their attention to all the people that want to order drinks. Shoutout to the real homies!

Oh yeah, there's also a coat check area for yaaaa. So ladies, if you bring a jacket, that advantage of that instead of freezing as you walk back to your car. But don't forget your jacket because they might toss it out after a certain grace period, but if that's the case, feel free to call them and let them know what you left behind - they're friendly :)
author: Nicole C.

description: Great music selections, and a good bar and wait staff. A very unique 90's hip hop vibe and one of my new favorite SF bars.
author: Brock F.

description: Reserved a table for my group of 35 friends to celebrate my birthday! From the beginning, David Luu was super helpful and very organized. Would definetly recommend to celebrate a birthday here!
author: Jose Angelo G.

description: Cool spot for drinks, definitely has changed as the tech boom has taken over the area. Bartenders are always friendly and helpful, drinks are decent and the space isn't too bad. Happy hour can become pretty busy, so get there a bit earlier.
author: Annette S.

description:
I took an uber here on a Friday night because I can only imagine how insane parking is. When we arrive there was a short line outside. After paying a cover fee we were about to walk in but then they stopped us and made us get back in line. The guys working there seem frantic as if they didn't know what they were doing. After waiting another 10 minutes they let us in and wow was it packed. 

The amount of people in there was insane. You could barely move and the bar is ALL the way in the back, great. Then they have these stairs that lead you to the second floor BUT you have to get in line first. What...?! Yes a line inside the bar. It was like the freaking DMV. People were angry and the line did not move. Plus this line basically interrupted the dance floor on the first floor. Talk about an architecture failure.

The DJ that night was great. He played current favorites and throwbacks. The bartender was really nice too and made amazing drinks. Too bad the venue sucked!!!
author: Olivia T.

description:
Fun bar lounge that has an upstairs and downstairs dance floor. 

It is quite spacious on the inside - contrary to the exterior looks of this place. 

Their music is pretty poppy.  It brought me back to the 90s music, mix of hip hop and with a little bit of mainstream tossed in here and there.

Bars are conveniently placed at the entrance, in the back and upstairs!  They are prepared for you to get hammered!

There is a cover after 11, so try to get your way in before then!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Small shitty bar, bad music, shit drinks, god forbid 2 girls go in the bathroom together you'll immediately get kicked out lol save money and go elsewhere
author: Julesa G.

description: Bouncer kicked me out for no reason, pretty unprofessional. A lot of bouncers are cool and will listen to reason when they realize they made a bad call, but these guys were just stubborn about how 'intoxicated' they thought I was. I had a good time otherwise it's too bad I had my night cut short by a guy with an ego who probably wanted to start kicking people out to make his job easier. Once I was out several of my friends left as well so I guess it worked.
author: Don H.

description:
Came here for a close friend's birthday party and a just because. And wow is this place lively. It definitely is geared towards an older 20's early 30's because of the music they play. C'mon now. Who doesn't like to listen to Usher, N'Sync, TLC, Eminem etc. etc. My early childhood/teenage music. 

Anyways I came here on Friday and Saturday. Friday was def less crowded, but still crowded. Saturday.... now that's where the real party is at. Almost every booth is reserved for someone's birthday! And if you're the birthday guy/gal, you'll receive some VIP tickets I heard. If you're going Saturday, make sure to get on the guest list for that day before Friday... once it fills up the link disappears. It's free admission until 11 if you're on guest list, otherwise it's $10. 

Drinks are a decent price. Not too expensive. I mean a glass of beer was $6 and their signature drinks are their mojitos (around $10?). I have to say those mojitos... are too sweet to my liking. But my girlfriends loved them and constantly had one in hand - whether it be a regular mojito or strawberry infused mojito etc. etc. The bartenders are nice and A+ for hearing our orders when wearing ear plugs! 

It can get really crowded even though it's a two story place. Ground floor has two bars - one right when you enter and one all the way in back. And the second floor has one bar. Free coat  check on the second floor. But when it gets packed the security guard limits the amount of people that gets to go upstairs. You may have to fight your way up (; 

Come check the place out! I guarantee you won't be disappointed! And if you didn't drive, don't worry. Taxis pass by the place all the time. If you did, you'll find parking - yea it might not be close, but you'll find a spot.
author: Joan T.

description:
I came here with a group of friends after dinner to grab some drinks. Since we got there super early (around 8:30), we didn't have to pay cover. Not sure if people had to pay cover later in the night. 

Service: The place was empty so it was easy for us to get drinks when we got there. Our bartender was super friendly! 

Music: Pretty much all old school music, like 90s and even earlier! Hip hop, some pop. No EDM which is what I like so that's why this place is just "A-OK" to me. Hearing some of the old music was pretty cool though and brought on a lot of "OOH shiiit I havent heard this song in so long!" moments.

I wouldn't mind coming back again but probably not anytime soon.
author: Sandra N.

description: This place is awesome. My friends and I went here for a birthday celebration. We all had a good time! What's great is that they play 90s music and them throwbacks making the crowd go wild. It can get crowded but what crackin club doesn't. I highly recommend coming here to check out who knows you might love it and my friends and I would definitely go back.
author: Alliver V.

description: Decent size place with good music and people. Had  party there for BFs bday and the general manager, David, was awesome and attentive to our party. He  went above and beyond to accommodate us.  would definitely come back  based on how well we were treated by the staff and of course, for a good time.
author: Thi N.

description:
I take back what I said about Raven!! It was so much fun Friday night!! On Halloween it was dead and only upstairs was open, but second time coming, I didn't know this place was that big!! 

- Friday night - after 11pm, it was $10.  But there's FREE coat check! So make sure to get here before 11 if you don't want to pay cover!
- 2 stories, 3 bars, 2 dance floors!!!
- Old school hip hop songs! How can you NOT like this place?! They also play music videos on a projected screen!
- No dress code 
- Outside patio if it gets too hot or you need to smoke 
- Good crowd, lots of asians though
- Drinks average $9

I think this bar has it all.  Good crowd, music, and pretty spacious for a bar, probably one of the biggest bars in SF. I'll see you again Raven!
author: Raquel Y.

description: A few weeks ago my friends threw me a bachelorette party here w bottle service.. It was a crazy fun time! I wanted to get on here to specifically commend our server Linda for taking such excellent care of the group, continually checking in w me throughout the night to make sure we all were doing ok, replenishing us w water and other beverages. Her hospitality didn't go unnoticed!! The music was awesome, the bouncers and lady working coatcheck were also very kind too. This was my first time here and can't wait to find another excuse to party it up here again! Thank you again Linda for your all of your graciousness!
author: Joyce H.

description:
The Good: The signature cocktails are PERFECT. The classics are executed with style. It's roomy and there are cool tables. Upstairs the throwback music is a time warp. You get to the people you drink at The Raven. This is 100% great. They even have a coat check upstairs!

The Bad: Nothing. 

Overall: Good drinks, good music, good crowd.
author: Meghan E.

description:
Raven Bar is one of the few places in San Francisco that still plays hip hop and hasn't succumbed to the crappy EDM craze. It's a good sized bar with two levels, 3 bars (when all the areas are open), and a couple of small dance floors. There is also a free coat check available upstairs. I've been here on two different nights:

-Saturday: Packed. Make sure you sign up for their guest list early so you can get in for free. Otherwise, you have to arrive before a certain time to avoid cover or pay a discounted cover. Once it hits 11 the line starts getting crazy long though, so coming early is your best bet. They also restrict entry to the second floor when it starts getting too packed, and it gets difficult to find parking.
-Thursday: They play some good old school jams, but it wasn't very crowded at 10pm (the upstairs was dead). However, there is no cover and plenty of parking.

I've heard Raven is also packed on Friday nights, so this is the place to go on the weekends if you're looking to dance to good hip hop music.
author: Amy D.

description:
I've been to Raven a handful of times now and it's been fun every time. The place is definitely not an upscale/Vegas type club with all the bells and whistles. As a matter of fact, its the exact opposite. The dress code is very casual and almost everyone gets in free with guest list if you show up around 10. It's not a very big place but it is two levels, which is nice if you want a change of scenery. 

Every Thursday they have 1990s VS Y2K, playing 90s music upstairs and popular music from the 2000's downstairs. I managed to make it out one Thursday (July 4th weekend, so no work Friday) and it was pretty fun. It brought me back to my college days with the 90s music. Also, it's free all night long on Thursdays.

I love the music they play at Raven. Most clubs nowadays play EDM and there are so few that play hip hop, let alone old school hip hop. I like many just can't really dance to EDM unless I'm completely plastered, so it's nice that Raven sticks to hip hop. 

Another great thing about this place is the tables are free as long as you request them in advance. But they do fill up quickly, so plan ahead! Bottle service is optional, but a pretty decent price. 

The crowd here is fairly mixed in terms of ethnicity and age. I don't think there is one target audience, so that's pretty nice. 

The drinks are decently priced, about $8-10 for a cocktail. They have a wide array of specialty drinks too, but I have yet to try them. 

So if you are looking for a nice casual place to have a few drinks with your friends, dance it off to some hip hop with a mixed crowd, this is the place for you. Don't come here if you are looking for an upscale Vegas like club where all the girls are wearing skin tight dresses and heels. You'd have better luck at The Grand or Origin.
author: Milton F.

description:
Being from out of town my GFs and I decided to party here on Saturday night since the reviews were good. We arrived at around 1130pm with a long line in front. We asked the door guy about bottle service who then brought a gentleman out who told us to wait. Ten minutes pass by and we were still waiting, till Mika came and saved us. We decided we were going to get a bottle but not sure which one yet so she still got us in for free. 
When we entered it was so small, she brought us to our table, which was the first one you see as soon as you walk onto the tiny dance floor. We sat while the dance floor was packed and decided on a bottle of kettle one. It took awhile for the whole process of ordering and bringing out the bottle and chasers, be patient Mika appears to be the only one working the tables.
We encountered a problem, many people came up and asked if we were part of another persons bday party, which we stated no. We didn't understand why three different groups of people kept coming and asking us, it got annoying. Then about an hour into drinking, a whole group of people rushed our table and sat down and crowded us. One guy saying we took their table and we need to leave, it was getting intense. One GF had gone to get management when the guy showed up he explained to the other group that they had abandoned their table for 30 minutes so they assumed that the party was done or had left and gave the table to us. Then finally everyone from the group apologized for getting in our faces. The manager im assuming knew we were upset and came back with 5 more shots for us, on top of the bottle we had. 
So why did I choose to give this place 4 stars instead of something lower? Besides our incident, they provided exceptional service, especially Mika. She would check up on us and take care of us as best she could. Even though the incident could've been prevented it was not their fault for giving an empty table away. And security/doormen, when present were not douche bags. Compared to LA/OC that's always a plus. 
The music is hip hop and late 90s pop (think boy bands). And the bathroom is disgusting. Have fun!
author: Cathy P.

description: The coat check lady was super sweet. We ubered all the way from Berkeley to check this place out because of the 90s music. So we decided to check it out for my sisters birthday. The music was great but the crowd is made up of people from there early to mid 20s. Not the scene I was hoping for considering they were playing 90s music. So me and my sister step out for some air. Security mentions nothing when we step out and when we try to get back in at 12:56 he says we can't enter. I point to the sign on the door that says no entry after 1:15 and told him we had been in earlier and showed him the stamps we each paid 10$ for. He said no entry after 1. I told him it wasn't even 1 yet. He said no we weren't allowed in. That basically ruined out night. We tried to come out and have a good time since this place plans 90s music but they don't play by the rules. So we were literally inside for a hour before we ubered our way back home. A real waste of money.
author: RR H.

description: Place is lit Thursday thr Saturday , they throw great hip hop joints and the drinks are not shy .they gets really busy jammed packed up in here to expect a waiting line outside
author: Jason M.

description:
Not the BEST place to go in sf, but it does the job. I went to Raven for the first time for a friend's bday. At first, I was a little surprised by how much my friend emphasized signing up for the guestlist, getting there by ten so you don't have to pay cover, etc., because by 10:00, the place was still pretty light so I thought "how popular could this be?". However, by the time the clock struck midnight, I knew why she was so paranoid. The line was out the door till at least the end of the block and they weren't letting anybody in because they were filled till capacity. In the end, my other friends who came late and were waiting in said line decided to just go next door.

The Pros:

- Killer house cocktails (a big plus for me)
- old school/throwback music (sometimes, you are in that mood!)
- Nice-looking but casually-dressed crowd

The Cons:

- Lounge areas (while nice) are small and limited unless you have a reservation for the back area
- Dance Floors are small, both of them (I like to dance and for a place that identifies as a "dance club", Raven Bar was really cramped)
- the long lines (it sucked that my friends couldn't get in)
- Cover (I just hate cover, period.)

The cons are enough to knock off a star for me. I realize that some things like the long lines are out of Raven's control but as for the cramped dance floors: if you are going to charge cover, I better enjoy myself and not have to worry about bumping into people and/or feeling trapped when I am dancing. Don't get me wrong, I will probably come back, because I don't know many places in sf that will play throwback songs, but I will definitely need to make sure that 1) I get there early and 2) I will spend most of my night there, two things that I generally do not enjoy.
author: Kunal N.

description: Drinks at this place were on point! There specialty cocktails are definitely something to rave about, happy hour prices are great, bartender Sam was super nice and attentive. Try the ginger drop it will have you buzzed before you even realize what happened. Love this place
author: Diane J.

description:
A FUN NIGHT! although the 2 story bar was pretty packed on the upstairs dance floor 

-loved the DJ's song selection! they even play the music videos in the dance floor area & i remember hearing some old school throw back jams

NOTE: a lot of asians!! take it or leave it
author: Jenny S.

description:
Someone stole my iphone from my purse and from my friend's purse on Friday night at the Drink for a Cause toy drive (hers was unzipped, mine was open).  It's so stuffy and crowded on the second floor, it was not a surprise this type of thing has started since the iphones go for at least $250+ on Craig's list.

I emailed management about our phones and they responded within 24 hours.  I will update if our phones are found (which I doubt, but who knows).  Thief, if you are reading this, please return the phones.  

On the flip side, the bartenders and bouncers are awesome here.  I think they all get along and are friends.  The DJ was really good on Friday, he played great music and the music video is actually the music playing, which is nice since no one watches MTV anymore to catch up.
author: Chris L.

description:
I have been here one too many times haha.  But I always end up having a good time! 

Unless you're on guest list, there's usually a $10 cover.  Free coat check so you ladies don't have to be freezing cold waiting to get inside. Drinks are reasonably priced. So now you're wondering why I rated this 3 instead of 4 or 5. Here's why:

- They only ONE bathroom per gender. Girls will know that this is horrible lol. For some reason we take 10x longer than guys. IDK WHY. Also, their bathrooms are GRIMES. Not that I expect the holy grail when I go to the bathtoom, but everytime I go, there's toilet paper all over the floors (or no TP), it's wet, and you can see remnants of yak. Hence the problem with only one bathroom. 

- It gets stupid packed. I'm all for big, fun crowds, but this place turns into a sauna. They also HOLD the line to go upstairs...since that's the best part. So if you get here around 10 or later on a Fri/Sat, you'll be waiting to go up. Meh. 

- The dance floor upstairs is fun. Really good music, 90's songs for all the 90s babies, but the FOG IS WAY TOO INTENSE.  My group went to the corner to get some breathing room and to dance...and then all of a sudden their fog machines exploded and I couldn't even see the person next to me. No joke. It got SO bad that I felt extremely claustrophobic and had to go back to the bar. Haha, CALM DOWN the fog machines. 

- Okay, last complaint about the bathroom. It's right by the bar.  Expect pushing and shoving. It's going to happen.

Overall, it's become the place to go because it IS fun and the more alcohol you consume, the less you notice these things.  It's one of the few places that plays good music and has reasonable drinks. AND they have dirty dogs outside :D  But it's small, crowded, and hot. But try it!
author: Steph S.

description:
$10 cover if you don't make 11 PM guestlist.  At 11:30 PM, they're not holding up the line because they're tryna make this place seem like it's poppin', it's cause it is actually poppin'!  Like the bouncers explain, it is just way over capacity for this tiny 2 floored establishment, so wait your turn in line.  My girlfriends and I had to wait about an hour before we got to go in, so expect a wait! x___x  They play a lot of 90s music and the crowd appears to be mid 20s to early 30s.  Everyone was pretty friendly and I was surprised at how willing the dudes here were with buying girls drinks.  Dranks on dranks on dranks doe.  

I had a freaken good time here, but because of how crowded this place is, I had to dock it a star. It's like body on body on body.  No space to even bend your arms out.  I seriously got shoved back and forth between the crowd, so every shift in movement kinda had a domino effect on not just me, but everyone around me too.
author: Carena N.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with a birthday group of about 15. If you get on the guest list early, there's no cover! They had also set up a nice reserved booth/table, and we all had an awesome night. There were at least 6 other birthdays going on at the same time, but everyone coexisted peacefully and weren't overlapping. Between the bar area, smoking alley, downstairs lounge and upstairs dance floor, there is plenty of space to have a great time. I hate going to bars that feel like a sweaty mosh pit. 

No dress code was pretty awesome - jeans, flats, and a nice shirt/top seemed to be the go-to outfit, and no one looked trashy. I LOVED that there was a full bar staff (three bartenders), which meant we got drinks pronto and there was no elbow-throwing at the bar. We ordered a couple drinks off the menu (Lychee Bliss & Castaway) and even got a show from our super-awesome bartender. I loved that they didn't seem stressed out and hurried. Drinks were strong, too!

Music was a little weird - all 1990's hits. After a few hours of N*SYNC and Backstreet Boys, even the excessive amounts of fruity vodka weren't enough of a distraction. If the night moved into more of a top-40, that would be spectacular. Doesn't stop me from coming back here, though. There are far worse things than BSB. 

Unexpectedly great bar. I would definitely return!
author: Laura B.

description:
Pros: 
no cover before 10pm, after 10pm only $10!
throwback hip hop and rnb jams
free coat check
bartenders very friendly

Cons:
drinks are pricey
not as many early 2000's jams as hoped
pretty small, not too much room to dance
author: Nina X.

description:
Having been gone from the bay area for almost a year, all I can hear are my friends going to Raven now.

My friend suggested to stop by Raven for HH.  I got there at around 5:30pm on a Thursday and boy I was by myself!  I was kind of iffy at first, but Dzu made me feel very welcomed at the bar.  And that was just the beginning of a great time at Raven!

$1 specialty cocktails during HH.  I tried the herbal remedy, which was very refreshing to the point that I drank it like it was juice.  Then I decided to spice things up by ordering the BItter Love but Dzu said he was able to make an even better drink!  I thoroughly enjoyed their craft cocktails and their creativity that they showed us.  I also got to meet David.  Both of them working together behind the bars was awesome.  They make a great team, making their customers comfortable, being attentive to them, and just making the ambiance very enjoyable! Loved their personalities.

Food can be ordered from next door at Tryptych, which I thought was different.  They deliver it to you at the bar!  We tried the tater tots, mini crab cakes, and nachos.  Tater tots was the win!  There are plenty of bar seats at the front and few booths in the back. 

I now wonder how this place is at night on weekends.. 0_o

Way to go you guys! I definitely will be coming back!
author: Kathy D.

description:
One of the few low-key, unpretentious places in SF that plays great music and serves great drinks.

Everyone is very friendly.

I love how you can order from the entire menu from Tryptich next door.  Sweet potato fries, nachos, sliders... anything your dehydrated drunk heart desires.

Typically at night (including Fri and Sat nights), they play the '90s hip hop and R&B jams.  Awesome...
author: Ray M.

description:
One of the few good club/bar to hang out in downtown SF. Good old school music to dance and to watch the matching music videos. The mix of crowds seems to be having fun and drinks are reasonably priced.

But like everyone says, you better have a large bladder waiting for the restroom...lol
author: My L.

description:
Have you ever met someone who was so passionate about their job that they had the ability to make their work look exciting? The Raven has arguably one of the best bartenders in town. Watching David mix drinks is like watching Magic Johnson in the 1980's thread a pass; he's precise and does it with a smile. I witnessed this guy take five cocktail orders at one time, carefully make them, all while keeping the other patrons at the bar happy by chatting with them. The guy could probably be a pilot.

If you want to see perfection in the art of mixology, then watch David prepare one of his signature Vampire Slayers or a more traditional Old Fashioned. He's fast but never sloppy, and meticulous with peeling the twist and prepping the rim. 

Not only is David good at what he does, but he's incredibly friendly and strives to make sure his patrons are happy; whether it's a simple gesture of greeting people, asking how your cocktail is, or if you're okay with the channel the TV is on. If you own a bar or are thinking of owning a bar, I'd go and observe this guy. More important than his knowledge of spirits is how he treats his customers.

I went on a Thursday for their happy hour. The prices were very reasonable; $8 for specialty cocktails, $4 draft beers, and $4 well drinks. They also have a menu for food from Triptych which they'll bring over from next door. Upstairs at around 9:00, a Video DJ spins and projects music from the 90's, not to be confused with a VeeJay (i.e. Bill Bellamy, Daisy Fuentes, Kennedy, Idalis, etc.)  He mixes music and the accompanying videos. Pretty awesome. I've never seen anything like it.

The bar fills up pretty quickly, which is to be expected with their drink specials and their service. The crowd was also pretty diverse, from tech people to Burning Man attendees who were doing fund raising. Seems like the type of place where you would feel comfortable enough to strike up a conversation with just about anyone.

My one complaint would be the server who didn't ask if we needed change for the food from Triptych. She just assumed it was hers to keep and off she went without even saying thank you.
author: John S.

description:
Apparently this is the go to place in S especially for the Asians.  Mostly 20 somethings but always hard to tell with Asians.  Nice venue, downstairs is more of a bar atmosphere with a few tables along the sides.  Upstairs has a fairly large dance floor for those that want to show off their moves.  Another bar up there as well.  

Music was good playing mostly old school hip hop earlier in the night but then shifted to more modern jams later.

Normal exorbitant drink prices of SF at around $10+.  And alcohol volume depends on bartender so be selective and tip well.

Sounds great right but why the one star?  Well here it is....

It is not a huge space so gets packed by 1030-11 on Saturdays.  You will be bumped where ever you are and have to fight your way through the small dance floor on the ground level to get to the stairs or exit.  I did have an incident with a rather rude employee as I was trying to make my way through. He was clearing space for a wait staff carrying a tray of alcohol.  I stopped and tried to make myself small to let them by but apparently it wasn't enough.  He told me to move and then put his hand on me.  I had no where to move (people and table behind me) so he thought he would shove me.  That caused me to bump into a couple of people behind me at their table.  I had a few choice words for him and he decided he had enough of his power trip for the night and moved on.  Complete dick move by someone who works at the establishment - if this is how you treat patrons then I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Roy L.

description:
Asians. Asians everywhere. 

Pros
- Throwback and current music (think "What's Luv" by Fat Joe ft. Ashanti to "Blurred Lines" by Robin Thicke)
- Sign up for guest list early and get in free before 11pm. Was worried that we wouldn't make it in by 11 since we got there at 10:45 but there was a lady checking our names on the guest list who gave us stamps ahead of time and got in before 11. Although I'm not sure what time she stops going around and giving stamps to those in line...
- Parking wasn't too bad. Drove past the bar and turned left on 7th and found some spots there, only 1.5 blocks away.
- Water stations at every bar which was nice not having to wait to ask a bartender for water.
- Nice they had a designated smoking patio. 

Cons
- Sucks we had to wait in line just to get upstairs where the dance floor was. 
- Bathroom lines are crazy upstairs (don't understand why only have one for each gender).
- It really just wasn't my type of scene since it seemed like the crowd was around the ages of 25-35.

I just probably won't come back here for a while because it wasn't my crowd personally. And note to self: If I do plan on coming back, sign up for guest list so I don't have to pay cover. And maybe call ahead to try to reserve a table/booth.
author: Amanda L.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night. Onlyt the downstairs was open, but it wasn't oo crowded. 90's music videos and good drinks. I felt like a child again, but this time I could legally drink while listening to Skee-Lo. The DJ (VDJ?) was mixing the music videos seamlessly and included all different genres. I wish we had a place like this around me!
author: Andrew Q.

description:
I came here for a birthday celebration. She had the back section by the bar reserved for her party (to keep her reservation, she had to be there by 9PM). Here's the scoop:

Location: Typical area for SOMA bars/clubs. It wasn't too bad finding street parking and walking around the block to the bar.

Cost: Average for SOMA bars/clubs. Free cover before 11PM if you sign up for the guest list (WARNING: It does fill up!)

Drinks: They have a pretty good list of specialty cocktails. Their signature drink list at the very bottom of the menu has some solid choices. The bartenders seem to know what they're doing because they do it well!

Ambiance: Cool, not divey, but not too upscale, either. Girls wear everything from cocktail dresses and heels to jeans and converses (though the latter was definitely an outlier). There's lots of booths lining the dance floor, but all of them were blocked off for tons of birthday parties (at least 5) and a bachelorette party. The music was also interesting. It was old school 90's music, but not all of them were the hits you would immediately remember and want to dance to... Oh well, you make the most of it!

Would I return? Maybe.
author: Leana L.

description: Super fun dance lounge to go with friends. Friday and Saturday night crowds can differ. Great cocktails and music! Can get pretty busy after 11pm which is when the party usually starts.
author: Erin C.

description:
Great place for a good time! 

We were celebrating my bday that night and were trying to figure where to go after cocktails. I'm pretty much open for trying new places, and a friend of mine suggested we try out raven, so we did! Let's start with the wait, the line actually moved pretty quick once we were in it. Don't let the size of it fool you, YOU WILL GET IN TRUST ME. Cover charge was $10 so not too bad, if you don't have cash on you there's an ATM just a block over which is super convenient. Bouncers were very friendly as well. 

Onto drinks! They kick them out fairly quickly, it literally feels like zero wait time. I started with a jack and coke, so good. Moved on to a whiskey soda, then whiskey shots, etc. the list goes on lol I'm not sure about drink pricing since my friends treated me, but they were all perfect. 

Music! They play top 40 old school some new, mostly hip hop. They even threw some spice girls in there haha overall a good mix, really fun to dance to. 

Bottom line, give Raven a try. We'll be back!
author: Evin C.

description:
The old married couple.

Those who are attached by the hip, rarely go out with their friends, and are in bed by 10 pm on the weekends. 

Coitus? Forgetaboutit. The most action they get these days are from vibrators...vibrations from their better half's anal acoustics that is.

Been there, done that for nearly 10 years. Never again.

Last week, the plan was to watch a movie but I was insistent in going out. It was a Friday night after all and Mr. Fernet was calling my name.

A quick Yelp search leads me to Raven. Two visits in 8 days. That's how much I love this low key venue that's part speakeasy, part lounge, and part nightclub.

COVER
Free. Zero. Nada. 

DRESS CODE
None. Whooo hoo, I can wear my granny panties and my frumpy flats!

COAT CHECK
$2 on second level.

BAR/DRINKS
3 bars. Shots were a reasonable $7-$8 a pop. Specialty cocktails are $9-$10. The bartenders are very nice but more are needed upstairs on a Saturday night (there were 2) because drinks took a while. CC's accepted with no minimum.

Happy Hour is Monday - Saturday from 4-7 pm: $1 off specialty cocktails, $4 wells, $4 drafts, and $5 house wine.

CROWD
Friday night was chill with a mix of older tech nerds and the badminton club. Saturday night was cracking with a very mixed late 20s to early 30s crowd. No hipsters unlike Bloodhound next door. No sleazy douchebags. No pretentious Marina princesses. ME LIKEY.

MUSIC
VJ DJ Mark plays Top 40s, Rap, Hip Hop, EDM, Pop, and Old School music videos on the numerous flat screen TVs and huge projection screen TV upstairs. Shake your money maker/hokey pokey/cabbage patch/crunk/fist pump to Florida's "I cry", Swedish House Mafia's "Don't you worry child", Bell Biv DeVoe's "Poison" and MJ's "Billie Jean". Or sing horribly to Jackson 5's "I want you back" and Taylor Swift's "You belong to me"...*ahem ahem* Mr. NSS. =X

AMBIANCE/DECOR
Long, narrow speakeasyish bar downstairs (super crowded) with a back lounge area, a second bar, and a small dance floor. Upstairs is "Club Raven" with a small couch area, a third bar and a dance floor equipped with fluorescent lighting and a smoke machine. The outdoor patio/smoking area is on the first level.

RESTROOMS
I love dancing but not doing the pee pee dance because there's only one stall upstairs. Although I heard there are several stalls downstairs, MORE stalls upstairs please!

PARKING
Easier street parking on the 7th and 8th streets as opposed to Folsom.
