I had a blast at Raven the both times I've been and it was the most action I got in a long, long time. My bad for my anal acoustics ruining the mood. 

Note to self: Mr. Lactaid and Mr. Beano are my bffs and Mr. NSS'. ( ^ _ ~ )
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Didn't know this place existed, but popped in here randomly on Halloween weekend, on our way to an event at Slim's (dressed as Sarah and Jareth from The Labyrinth, lol!), and it was a pleasant experience.

We passed it by at first, since almost nobody was inside and we felt weird being practically alone in there, but the name was "The Raven", and I'm a fan of gothic literature and Edgar Allen Poe (I'm also from the Baltimore area, Poe's home... supposedly he's the inspiration for this bar, but hard to tell since it was Halloween-decorated anyway!), but the vibe seemed right (despite being almost empty -- the night was still early), and they were at least festive (dressed up in costumes, etc.) so we came in and were pleased with the experience. The servers were laid-back, low-key, and friendly, despite being able to concoct some good cocktails. We were just going to get one drink, but decided to stick around for more since the seats were comfy, the people (even though not many) were nice, the cocktails were well-done, and the prices were reasonable (thanks, probably, to happy hour -- which lasts until 8 pm here, including Saturday. Not bad!)

Oh yeah, and the sound system was pretty great; we also liked the mix of music/videos they were playing.

We'll probably stop back in again whenever in the area...
author: Matthew G.

description: Into 90's music? Into cheap drinks? Into young college kid crowds? This is your place! Friendly staff and bouncers. Gets packed on weekends and good times can be had. Only issue- lines to the restroom!! Grrrr....
author: Trisha H.

description:
I discovered Raven about a year ago and found it to be an outstanding venue playing 90's hip/hop and dance music to today's top 40 jams and EDM.

David was very helpful in the process to get a booth reserved for the co-birthday celebration with my friend and I. A couple months before the date I emailed him and he assured me a prime booth spot. He also mentioned emailing me a sign up list a week before the date so all my guests could have free entry into Raven all night. Awesome!

After having a celebratory dinner at Radius down the block, we walked to Raven, waited in line for a bit to check-in, and headed inside. The place was rockin' as usual. I spotted David and he led us to a wonderful booth in the main area. He introduced us to Larry who would be snapping photos all night and we could grab him if we wanted any photos taken of us.

There is bottle service available should you choose. We chose to buy our own drinks instead with 2 bars, front and back, on the main floor and one long bar upstairs. Although the main dance floor with the flashing lights and occasional burst of fog is upstairs, people do get their groove on in the area between the booths on the 1st floor.

It was a wonderful time had by all thanks to David and the crew at Raven. I have been back and will continue to do so.
author: Randy T.

description: I was in the dance floor, but I left for one second to get my friends and all of the sudden the bouncers kicked me out. I'm a dancer by nature, they missed out my excluding me. That's a shame .
author: Danny M.

description:
Shimmy, skip, run, walk or cab... whatever you need to do to get your sexy self over to Raven Bar.

The friendly neighbor of Bloodhound, this SOMA bar-slash-dance club offers original cocktails, killer bartenders, two dance floors, three bars and booty-shaking beats.

Mon-Wed's are pretty low key for those who want to throw back a cold one and enjoy a mellow evening. For party-seekers looking to forget their problems (all 99 of 'em), Thursday's are their new 90's jam night. (not just hip-hop but Nirvana and Ace of Base) Fridays and Saturdays are guaranteed to be packed and good times.

Check out the dance floor upstairs and get lost in the crazy strobe lights!

Cheers to a great establishment and ALWAYS fun times. :)
author: Kat C.

description:
Came here several months ago for an event. It is a cool place, narrow in width, but long in length, and more than one story in height. There are cool little corners you can collect your group, and as I recall, there were 3 bars, 2 on the ground floor, and one on the next floor up. 

TheDJ beats were bumpin and thumpin, just up my ally as far as sounds, but can't say they have a lot of space to cut a rug with your best moves. Some flatscreens here and there with music videos mirroring the beats.  

Lotsa creative drink mixes for the ladies and the dudes that like to experiment. Me, I stick to what I know, thank you. 

This places has a cool vibe, chill and relaxed, SOMA neighborhood. Perfect for those Techsters who grew up with "That's So Raven" on Disney, and even OK for their older siblings. 

Their parents? If they saw the original The Raven movie with Vincent Price, that is too old for this Raven. But if they were Ravin when it first started back in the 80's, they may still like this Raven. But don't bet on it. 

I Caw it like I see it!
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Happy hour from 4-7pm. Nice wide window.

The bartender was a bit slow, like she wasn't able to manage a crowd, despite most people ordering simple well + mixer drinks and beer from the tap.

Quite a chill place. There's an outdoor patio for smokers, about six or so non-mainstream beers on tap (think Lagunitas, Speakeasy, Shocktop, etc... OK, maybe that last one wasn't that ), and they'll make your drinks extra strong if that's what you desire. If you're feeling peckish, you can get decent pubby food from Triptych next door.

They play some hilarious music here. From TLC from the 90's to today's pop hits, it'll be loud, but not so loud that you can't hear what your friends are saying.

Bottom line: Great place for happy hour. Can't speak for the late night crowd, although apparently there is dancing and it gets poppin'.
author: Jade V.

description: New favorite bar in SF. Julian, Clay, Robby are awesome.The music seriously hits the spot and its classy and the herbal remedy drink is amazing. The staff is so friendly and professional and fun, couldn't ask for more out of a place. Shut up and go here!
author: Jo Z.

description: Cute drinks, dance floors, upper and lower decks, old school hip hop and throwback Thursday type of music. Mostly post-college grads looking to chill out from the club scene. Dance if you wanna!
author: Janet T.

description:
I'm appreciative-- but a bit wary-- of all the security and signs mentioning the free coat check. Do they expect/experience a lot of problems with people's behavior or belongings?

We went for a friend's birthday party on Saturday and while it was quiet and easy to get a drink from about 9:30-10, by 10:15 the crowds came in droves. Forget getting a drink- it will either take forever or make you need the restroom (which will also take forever, since they don't seem to have nearly enough for the people they stuff in this club like sardines). 

I am not one to frequent dance clubs, so maybe I'm just the wrong audience, but by 10:30 it was, like... Outside-Lands-trying-to-reach-your-friends-at-Paul-McCartney crowded. Fire codes be damned! 

Raven, perhaps rightly (judging by the lines) prioritized constructing ladies' rooms, but with only one men's-only restroom downstairs, at one point the guys in our group faced a 25-minute wait to get back upstairs. 

We escaped out the fire exit by 11:15 to see a line down the block. 

I do think it was nice that they offer the coat check and guest lists for birthday groups (and I'll give a higher rating than my own experience on the benefit of the doubt for those who did seem to enjoy themselves), but the crowd deterred me from drinking or staying.
author: Krista L.

description: Fun club to be at if you want some oldies. Pretty small bar/club but alway crowded every weekend. They have two floor. And in order to get up stairs usually you would have to get a wristband which comes with bottle service. And they also have a smoking patio on the outside side of the building.
author: Tam D.

description: I mentioned to my friend that I hadn't been clubbing in awhile. And she happened to have friends in town so we decided to make a night out of it. I would also say Raven isn't a club; it's more like a bar with a dance floor. The main dance floor is upstairs but people were dancing downstairs too. We went on a Saturday night. My friend got us on the guest list so if you go in before 11, it's free. They play 90s to current music from boy bands to rap to hip hop and r&b. Basically all the classics and music most 30 year olds know. And they have free coat check too. So no need to freeze from the car the bar. It was one my more positive clubbing experiences. We started low key-ly, on the ground floor. The bar in the back has this awesome (and cute) bartender making specially drinks, with hardly any line/wait (at least early in the evening). I tried the red raven and the sailor's sour. Both were super tasty. I think I preferred the red raven though. Couldn't tell you what was in them though. Prices were average for SF, about $12. Then a shot of tequila and up we went to the second floor for some dancing. The dance floor is not very big at all - my only minor complaint of the night. But we squeezed our way in and found space. I think we danced for a couple hours straight till they kicked us out. There were only a few songs I didn't know. But the DJ was pretty legit and great. It's the best when you know all the words to the song, can sing along and dance your heart out at the same time. I loved the music videos projected on the giant wall. It's something else to look at while dancing. Also if you go to that wall/corner with the music vids, they have AC units blasting cold air on you. Which is super welcome as it can get pretty crowded and hot in there, especially while dancing. Most guys were also super respectful and didn't try to get up all on you without permission. Though there were a lot of large circles formed where one person went in the middle and showed off their dance moves. Not a huge fan of those but some can be fun to watch. Last call was a little before 2. We picked up our coats, and then headed out. Don't forget to pick up the $5 bacon wrapped hot dogs from the street vendor out in front.
author: Alison W.

description:
Great experience! David was very helpful in reserving a table for my group, greeted us and even gave me a tiara for my bday lol. Also added wrist bands for our group to have access upstairs. Security was nice as well! Loved the throwback music and their drinks were tasty. Atmosphere and crowd of people were pretty chill. Def gonna be coming back!

My only problem...one bathroom stall.
author: Rebekah A.

description:
Stiff drinks (that's JAMESON right thurrr, right thurrr) and continuous play of today's top 40, 90s best, and various dance and hip hop classics.  Everyone is relatively friendly, sans a few passive-aggressive single men trying to party with any lady they find standing alone.  All that make for a pretty good, random night in the city.  I'm not much for the dance scene often, but coming here with my best gal pals turned this place into a very inviting and fun venue.

Raven Bar is a two story dance lounge with THREE BARS (one upstairs) and a narrow outdoor patio.  This is NOT A CLUB, so come here easily dressed.  No fuss, no questions.  Bouncer at the door checks IDs real quick and easy, and off you go with NO COVER into the musical hustle and bustle.  There are MUSIC VIDEOS err'where, occasional fog machine blasts upstairs, and constant beats and movement.  Each floor sports two small yet spacious dance floors.  Most seats though are reserved booths, but there are a fair amount of bar stools around for your convenience and comfort.  

Upstairs barmen will reward you if you seem to be having a good time.  My friend was dancing in place while patiently waiting for her umpteenth round of drinks, and they all like "Heeey, yea girl!  You's real cool."  Staff overall is really nice and good looking too if you're searching for some eye candy.  Feel free to give 'em a quick kiss on the cheek for funzies and in gratitude.  Tip well too.

Coat check upstairs will cost $7, just so you know.

And oh yea, you can party like it's 1999 on Thursdays.  That promotional poster made me laugh.  Dance like you ain't worried of Y2K!
author: Allison C.

description: Not a fan of Raven. I came by late on a Saturday night and it was SO crowded that it was hard to move around, let alone dance. It didn't help that the space downstairs is long but narrow, like a hallway. Not worth the $10 cover, in my opinion. Do yourself a favor and check out Bloodhound for drinks, which is next door!
author: Connie Q.

description:
The atmosphere is great, bartender was very attentive and polite. The only down fall, THEY ARE WATERING DOWN THE ALCOHOL. I'm an avid whiskey drinker and Jameson straight up, is my absolute favorite drink, I have had it on the rocks multiple times, so believe me when I say it's way to clear to me when you water it down. I'm not sure the bartender I had was aware of the situation or not, either way. It's happening.


Update: I was replied to by what I presume was the owner; I'm sorry if my review was misleading, but I did in fact order my drink straight. (No ice for those who may not know). And just to make sure I wasn't invalid on my thinking in regards to this, I had TWO others try it ( who also drink whiskey on the regular) and they both agree that it did not taste like right. Like I said before the service and atmosphere was great. Maybe they have a bartender who is over pouring for friends and is trying to cover it up to fool the bed count. I spoke to the bartender in ab it and was poured another drink from a different bottle which tasted very different from the first, but still not like it should.
author: Cody N.

description: I love the music here. It seems small, but there is an upstairs area with better dance floor and big screens playing the videos to the songs. Plus, any place that plays 90's hits is golden in my book!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Raven is poppin' on a Friday night - unexpected fun for sure last weekend...

We headed here just for some drinks and catch up after 10pm on a Friday night with some friends, and it was nice that the lower bar area had ample seating for our group. Drinks are on the pricy side for their signature cocktails, but I think that their concoctions are worth it...my friend destroyed the lychee bliss..nearly chugged it actually because it was so good.

What I didn't realize until later was that there was a video DJ upstairs - basically it's a relatively small dance floor with music videos and a DJ mixing 90's rap w/ EDM w/ top 40 and old school pop. A very eclectic variety, but it was so fun just to goof off on the dancefloor with friends to songs old, new, and plain interesting. That mix PLUS the wall-sized projection of the music videos themselves AND the cool laser lights entertained us for quite a while. It did get pretty crowded and hot toward the end of the night, but again, pretty surprised that Raven turned out to be a really fun night!
author: Brandon Y.

description: Cool place but dont go on a week day its super empty. Great vibes goid drinks and cool music
author: Sharon B.

description: Friday nights was 90's hip hop. Right up my alley!! There's a bunch of 20 somethings but I didn't feel old. Then again, I don't really give a crap. Bartender was cool and kinda cocky, but not too much that I would avoid for the next round. Security let me go in and out although the sign said it wasn't allowed. Then again, I charmed him. Just kidding. Or not.
author: Sharon B.

description:
One of my favorite bar-clubs in SF! I had low expectations for it when I first went here, but I'm delightfully surprised and had an amazing time here! They play great music, from the 80s to pop hits with hip hop and R&B, a lot of my favorites!!! I also really enjoy their cocktails!
(+) Great cocktail and drink selection!
(+) Great music! Mostly old-school, 80s-early 2000s
(+) Asians ... Asians everywhere (plus for me lol)
(+) Happy Hour! 4-7PM!
(+) Love the ambiance and atmosphere!!!
(-) 1 bartender most of the times ... extremely slow to get your drink
(-) Hard to find parking, street parking! but welcome since when can you find good parking in SF?
(/) Come before 11PM for no cover (be sure to put yourself on the guestlist), or else you'll have to pay $10! Also they don't let anyone in after 1AM (so be sure to get in before that!)
author: Xin W.

description:
Hosted a tech meetup for 30 people last night at Raven Bar's upstairs room. From the get go, they were quick to answer my questions and confirm the booking. Leading up to the event, they clarified what we'd need for our presentation (which we had on a laptop). On the night itself, I arrived 40 mins early and was impressed at how organized they were - on hand were staff preparing the bar and an audio-visual pro (Mark), ready to setup the projector and mic.

The upstairs room has a separate entrance from Raven Bar, so the staff prepared a sign for my meetup outside and attendees had no problems finding us. The venue itself has a great AV setup (including DJ booth behind the bar). Being separate from the downstairs area means that you have a bar exclusively for your group - it's a very private space. Everyone at our meetup appreciated the personal service, not to mention, the very attentive staff. They even made sure there was good, upbeat music playing all evening - and at a good noise level, too.

Afterwards, one of our attendees mentioned that he'd be booking his birthday party at Raven Bar - for groups of up to 60 people, I'd say it's a fantastic space.

Overall, I can really recommend Raven Bar for customer events and meetups - they have the model well rehearsed and really made our evening a really memorable one. Thank you so much to David, Jonathan, Mark and the team - we will be back!
author: Rosanne D.

description:
This was a cool place! Came for the first time for a friend's birthday. We had a couple reserved tables, and there were a couple other parties with reserved birthday tables as well. I think that's their "thing." 

I liked that there was a front bar, a back bar, and an upstairs. I also liked that there was a free coat check!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Everybody wants a neighborhood bar the you can just go to on any night, know a couple of people, and be served solid drinks.  That's what Raven has become for me. Every time I go here (usually once, maybe twice a week on a worknight)  I always have a good time.  The staff is incredibly approachable, everyone from Bartenders to barbacks to the DJ! We have gotten to know them  pretty well, but they treat everyone what comes through their doors with the same respect and welcoming attitude.  There was a time when I first walked through those doors... 

Anyways they'll make you what you want or something they recommend if you don't have anything in particular in mind.  Their drinks menu is solid and there drinks are deceptively strong, which to them is the perfect compliment.  

On slow nights, they'll let the patrons play their own music via iPone, iPad, etc.  They also have DJ nights, that spin mostly Deep House.  However, you can ask them to play something more upbeat, or more popular and they will.  One night (on my bday) the DJ went nuts and we had an awesome time!

On weekends and during bigger parties, they open up the top floor and back bar.  Giving it more of an Ultra Lounge feel.  

Its good to have a place where everybody knows your name.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Came here to ring in the new year and had a blast.

I especially like that there are distinct bar areas as well as areas to dance. The bartenders were all really nice and made really tasty drinks. However, after checking in, I found out that there was a Yelp coupon for a drink, which they said that they would honor but it didn't seem to have been reflected on the receipt. W/e, was not about to throw down for 3 dollars on NYE.

Also, the choice of music that night was on point, I really had a blast. I'd be down to come back.
author: Becky M.

description:
Five stars for the music alone! Video DJ Mark Andrus plays all the jams from the 90s to current music. The top floor is always cracking. Yes, it gets damn crowded but all you can say is "the music is too good!" and you can't leave the dance floor. 

Beware that there is a $10 cover on Saturday nights. There's a guest list for free admission before 11:00 p.m. but the place is so popping now that there's usually a line and you might not get in before.
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
To be fair, this isn't really my type of scene or crowd. 

COVER
Free on guestlist before 11 pm, otherwise $10 pp. We came on a Saturday night after a failed attempt to get into Origin. At midnight, there was still a surprisingly long line to get in. Usually lines die out by then, so we thought this place must be good. We waited for about an hour in line.

VENUE // DRINKS
Two stories, but we stayed on the first floor. Dance floor is small, with a few bottle-service tables lined against one wall. One long bar with DIY water tank, so you don't have to bug the bartenders. I got myself a Pineapple Malibu for $9, which is relatively cheap for a bar/club.

MUSIC // CROWD
Hip hop, 90s, pop, pretty old school songs. I will admit when I go clubbing, I just want to dance by myself to EDM. This is not the place to do so. The crowd fits the music genres, and the attire is more casual than dressy.

Raven is a fun bar if you're into that kind of thing. I can't really dance to hip-hop and such, so the only songs I really rocked out to were Britney Spears' "Oops, I Did It Again" and TLC's "No Scrubs". With that said, I probably won't be back.
author: Ivy W.

description:
Im pretty disappointed with the way security handles they duties. While I got there around 1:20 am to meet up with friends and pick up keys from my roommate security personnel refused entrance saying that they do not allow entrance after 1 am. When I asked why did they have this rule I was just told that they are allowed to have rules, that's it. Unfortunately my roommate did not hear her phone and when I politely asked if I can walk in just to find my friend and let her know I was there - I was told that I'm causing to much troubles and have to leave the sidewalk.
On the other hand I saw some girls that got too drunk and were puking right next to the entrance - bar employees got them water and even helped to find a shoe that I'm assuming was lost inside the venue, which is very nice of them.
My point is that I wish security personnel treated people with a little bit more respect. I understand that they have to deal with some drunk people, but if a 5"2 sober blond girl is causing you too much trouble just by standing at the sidewalk I don't think I want to find out what kind of crowd is actually inside the venue.

***Update 

I highly appreciate your response, Jonathan. And yes, getting keys after my friends have to leave your venue was not an issue at all. However, I looked through your website and couldn't find any information about no entrance after 1 am. It would be nice to let your guests know that. Only other Yelp reviewers mention it earlier, no official information from management. It might change someone's mind about going/not going to this venue.
author: Ekaterina F.

description:
Is not bad at all!

So I came here a while ago for a happy hour, and stayed entirely downstairs. Comfy couches, fried food brought in from next door, cheap drinks. Was pretty awesome.

Then I came here for evening fun, and had a great time too! And...realized that this was where Dragon used to be. Wow...I'm so old and out of it. o.O We came because the majority of the group grew up in the 90's, and we were swayed by the 90's theme. Got a little confused downstairs when there was no 90's music...then realized it was upstairs. Oh. Nice!  I think my favorite part of the 90's theme was when you saw young ones (like, early 20's) watching the music videos on the dance floor. Its like it was their first time seeing those!

Crowd here is pretty mixed. Drinks are delicious, and made well. Speaking of well...well drinks $3! SWEET.
author: Lily W.

description: Decent drinks, good music, had a good time with friends, loosening up on the dance floor. Not many places in the bay where one finds a good party, but this was quite nice, the girls in our group felt very comfortable about letting their hair down and simply having some fun.
author: Van X.

description:
Haha my new favorite bar! 

I love the energy, the drinks are strong, and you're not crowded to the point where you just feel uncomfortable. It was great! Go upstairs for a more dance-y area! The same music plays on both floors but the upstairs has a bigger bar and it's where everyone is dancing. Downstairs you'll find a lot of reserved parties.

the MUSIC though is the best part! (: It has hella old school music and it definitely brings you back to high school. Prom anyone? We even got an N'Sync song haha whaaaaat? We also had old Mariah Carey songs, Usher songs, JT, Nelly, etc. And the music changes pretty quickly too so it never gets boring! Plus, the music videos are playing on the walls via projectors so you got the song, the MV, everyone singing along to everything, great energy.

Tip: Put yourself on guest list to get in for free before 11pm!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Good selection of drinks and cocktails, but it doesn't really matter if you can't try them. 

Raven Bar seems like a cool spot, but its strange elongated layout makes it super crowded. You will have a very hard time getting to the bar, and getting the bartenders' attention. Once you do, it might not matter, because the bartender might refuse to mix you the cocktails you were so desperately craving because she is too busy. Well, I guess a beer was quenching enough. 

For some reason they are always hosting a lot of large groups for birthday parties and such.

The best part of the bar is definitely the upstairs dance floor. Dancing to 90's music is nostalgically fun.
author: Augusto T.

description:
I came here a couple of weeks ago with a couple of friends and I had a blast!

For those awkward, wall-huggers they play the music video for you to watch. For everyone else, the music they played on that Friday night was an amazing a blast from the past! 

The drinks weren't overly priced, however it was a bit crowded and it was ridiculous but there was a line to go upstairs. But overall, still had so much fun!
author: Tina K.

description: Most fun I've had on a 'ladies night out' in SF. Great 90s music. Great drinks. A little too crowded on a Friday night both on the dance floor & for the line to get into the club.
author: Tina B.

description:
An Edgar Allen Poe themed bar? Neat! No carding at the door, just walk in. It's a great alternative to Bloodhound next door where you'll have to do some work to get a drink there (more patrons). The atmosphere here is a bit more relaxed. There's a bar when you first walk in, then you'll hit an area with tables to sit, and in the back is a second bar in a private room. When I was here on a Friday night, the room was reserved for a birthday party.

+/- There was only 1 bartender at first making drinks; then finally, a second bartender came around. They're not exactly fast here
+Great drinks! Loved the Lychee Bliss
+Atmosphere
+VDJ playing 90s hip hop/R&B!

Tip: Check in on Foursquare to redeem a 50% Scoutmob deal for any drink up to $10. One drink only though.
author: Katherine S.

description:
I hosted my birthday here this year, and the manager and the staffs were amazing! It was also very sweet for the manager to personally find me and hand me a birthday tiara as well as some VIP passes. I also came back to dance a few months later, t was still super fun and awesome. I was in line after 11pm, and the line moved pretty fast. There's also a $10 cover. Downstair bar area was narrow so it was pretty packed. There's also a bouncer to let people up and down from the dance floor depends on its capacity. Safety first right? 

I LOVE how they play 90s music! The dance floor upstair was small but it was super cool that there's a large screen with music video playing in the background. It's like I'm totally catching up on my music as well as music videos I'd never seen before. The bar staffs were nice, and got drinks pretty quick!
author: Mandy C.

description: Came here for the first time for my birthday & it was so much fun! Bouncers & front-window lady are super all friendly. $10 cover after 10pm but they let me in for free since it was birthday. It was super crowded inside but you'll find more space in the upstairs bar. We just drank patron all night & patron shots are $9. The bartenders & bouncers inside are really nice as well. Got an extra shot & water bottle for free since we told the bartender it was my birthday. Music was a mixture of 90's, 00's & today's hit music. Will definitely visit again!
author: Trisha G.

description: This place was awesome! great house cocktails (average 11-13 each), great music (90s, and top 40), great crowd (90s kids mostly,). It was just a blast. Music videos for every song that was played. there are two floors and 3 bars. gets crowded toward the later night, as expected. would go again. get on the guest list! $10 cover otherwise. and you cant swap out people on guest list, they check ID to match the names.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
3.5/5

I typically don't review bars, but this venue is unique where it played a lot of the 90s music, which I truly enjoy. Not sure if it was a 90s themed night, but came here for a bday celebration. Cute venue. I pretty much situated myself in one area, so I didn't explore much.

There are two bars, by the front and in the back, and there are stairs that lead up to somewhere..not sure where..haha
author: Jen H.

description:
I chose Raven sight unseen for my birthday venue. I wasn't sure how many people to expect (from 20-30) and wanted to scout a location that would be flexible with the number of guests without sacrificing space or experience--and Raven Bar delivered! I got in touch a few weeks in advance and made a (free) reservation for a sizable booth space. David Liu was in frequent contact up to the event and responded to my questions promptly and thoroughly. 

On the night of, my 30 guests had plenty of space to socialize, drink (with access to three bars), and dance to awesome 90s music on the upstairs dancefloor or downstairs by the booth. Raven provided someone to help clean up empty glasses and be available in the case that I wanted to get bottle service (which I opted out of ultimately because my friends all like different drinks). This was probably one of the cleanest bars I've been to in SOMA!

I do recommend utilizing the free coat check because after about 11, the club got more crowded. The only negative aspect of the experience was that the 90s music provided by the DJ gave way to just beats by 1 AM, so I decided to call it a night once I couldn't belt out the words to Backstreet Boys any longer. 

Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience and I highly recommend this venue for birthday parties, alumni reunion events, or just a great night out!
author: Veronica P.

description:
Not sure what this place is trying to be, but whatever, I dig it.

They have a standard bar in the front on the first floor. A cocktail menu, reasonably priced. I think their red bull vodkas are $10, should have just gotten a cocktail. Lounge area in the back on first and second floors. Another bar in the middle of the second floor, with a small dance floor in the front.

Highlight is their AWESOME music. Great classics mixed with newer songs. Play Icona Pop's "I Love It" and I'm all yours, baby. I danced my ass off and I wasn't even drunk. Aw yeah, even got some high fives from some bros. It's a good mix of people, which can be hard to come by in SOMA.
author: Vivian H.

description:
My girlfriends and I came here on a Friday night and had so much fun dancing to oldschool 90's songs (I mean, what gets better than rehashing those middle/school days with Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake and Spice Girls!?!?!) SO glad that this club doesn't just play EDM music all night long - which is what a lot of other clubs have been doing.

I docked a star because the place does get a little cramped. It was so cramped that there was a second line (after the one to get into the club) to go upstairs, which I think is kinda ridiculous. Thankfully we got some VIP wristbands and got to skip the line! :)

TL;DR - love the music, hate how crowded it is...but had the time of our lives here anyway!
author: Sharyl S.

description:
I rarely write 5 star reviews, which pretty much means I'm hardly ever impressed! Lol. However, Raven really earned my business! 
I reserved a table for my party over the weekend. While the website indicated their reservations were full, they were still able to accommodate one more table for me!
Upon arriving, I ordered 2 bottles. Our hostess was sweet and kept on checking on us. The guest list went smoothly for guest despite the long line. I was given a tiara and they accommodated all my late arrivals coming in! Also, can't beat free coat check! 
They music was great: old-school hip hop!  I had a really great time! Would definitely recommend!
author: Angela P.

description:
A couple of my friends love Raven and have dubbed it our "new neighborhood bar."  The awesome bartenders and free drinks probably fuel their love.

What used to be a gay bar, they've revamped and it's pretty sleek and nice instead.  Situated next to Bloodhound, I always overlooked it.  It's dim and cozy inside.  We sat at the bar and now know the bartenders enough to just say, "Please give me a drink!" and they know what we like to make the perfect drink.  For example, the apple pie shots Dave made for us were sweet enough to drink without grimacing but strong enough to have us stumbling in 5 minutes.  Mimosas were an amazing ratio of 10:1 champagne to OJ and Lychee Mojitos weren't overpowering with mint, which I loved since I could taste the lychees more.  They also have a drink called Anchor Whet(?) that is a delicious mix of whiskey and Anchor Steam.  We've also thrown our NYE party and watched the Superbowl here (don't say anything about bad JuJu please) and had an amazing time both times (until the end of the game of course).      

Point of the review...get to know the bartender and every bar will be your favorite!
author: Jane N.

description:
Raven bar is THE place to go if you want to get away from the EDM scene. They play 90's and mainstream hip hop. I had an amazing first time last week cause I could literally sing to all the songs they played! 

I tried to get on the guestlist for tonight (oct 18th) but apparently, their guestlist has been closed since Tuesday... -___- this place is gettin too crackin!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
First time hitting up Raven and it was fairly successful. We came pretty late around  1130 on a Saturday and our group of seven got in fairly quickly seeing to how long the line was. The bouncers were nice especially Gabe. But the highlight of our night aside from the great music was the showmanship and great drinks Dzu was whipping out. We spent the last 40 mins at the bar just trying out all his specialties! 

Thanks Dzu we you! Great place for night out of drinks, dance and fun! Definitely will come back.
author: Allison M.

description:
My friends call it Rasian, not Raven. Before this was raven, this was dragon bar; an Asian gay bar. Why do I know this? Don't ask. I guess something about this building just attracts a lot of Asians. Not complaining, just pointing out the obvious.

SOMA is hands down my favorite neighborhood. We are all guilty of throwing someone into a box in this city. Ie: mission hipster, marina bro, pac heights snob, not-really-in-sf sunset, etc.

I would consider myself a SOMAian; yes, I just made that up.... And I own it.

Raven is up there as a favorite. Notably, its happy hour brings in a mixed crowd of professionals and have a nice drink menu and beer selections. Happy hour is usually limited to the front bar downstairs while occasionally the back bar will be opened, but usually for private parties. Come 9pm, a line forms, a cover is implemented and the crowd gets a tad younger. Downstairs is typically mix up while upstairs is 90s hip hop and pop (see, Brittany Spears, NSYNC, etc.). I didn't like that music when I was in middle school, much less that I'm nearing 30. The crowd isn't very diverse yet more diverse than origin (if you know, then you know) but everyone is friendly enough. Most come and stay in their little cliques and dance in circles while singing along to the video. Also, as others mentioned, it gets pretty steamy upstairs due to the crowd and lack of ventilation. Thank god Asians aren't hairy and musty (kidding?)

The upstairs could use more bartenders at peak hours. At one point, I waited nearly 20 minutes for a drink so I found myself doubling up to avoid coming back for a wait. That said, everyone from bartenders, door guys and management are always super nice and personable. I've chatted with a handful of them over the past few years and have no complaints.


All in all, a solid/fun spot in SOMA (for fellow SOMAians) to come in and reminisce the simpler times when your only worry in the world is feeding your Tamagotchi in time so it doesn't die. It'd be hard pressed for this to be a final destination for me, but it's definitely worth a visit if you're next door at bloodhound or SOMA beer store.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Another great cocktail bar in this neighborhood.

We stopped in on Saturday night, and were actually the only people there. Great service for us, not great financially for the bar owners.

The space is beautiful, the bartender was nice, and the drinks were really well made.
I especially loved how fresh the fruit is. The cocktails here are well thought out, and I enjoyed both I tried.

This place is right next door to Bloodhound, which is one of my favorite places for drinks. I'm guessing they're pretty stiff competition for Raven.

Even though Bloodhound is awesome, stop in for a drink at Raven. They're definitely worth giving a try.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Not sure what happened, but all of a sudden they decided to be more "exclusive" with their guest list and charge a $10 cover. I normally don't have a problem paying if I think it'll be worth it. I used to go every so often since it was just a chill place to just dance and have a drink (or two... or three). I went last week since I signed up on the guest list, or so I thought I did. I signed up on Thursday night, so I thought I was good for the next night. When the woman couldn't find me on the on guest list, she asked if I had an email to show her that I was actually on the list; surely enough, it was for the next week. Who closes a guest list on a Wednesday? Since we were already there, we decided to suck it up and just pay the $10 cover. 

This place filled up REALLY quickly. Apparently, there's a line to get upstairs now and they had someone guarding that stairway, which used to be a come and go as you please deal. My friends and I were observing these poor schmucks really waiting over 2 hours just to go upstairs. It is NOT Disneyland.  

The only thing that really saved the night was that the music was cool and they were playing all the 90's/early 2000's hip-hop, which is my personal preference. They even slipped in some Britney Spears & Backstreet Boys.

I can't guarantee I'll be back, but if I do, I better decide a week beforehand just to get on that guest list. Hah.
author: Kathy L.

description:
FINALLY!!! A PLACE THAT DOESNT JUST PLAY TRANCE/RAVE MUSIC. I've been hearing great things about this place BUT the music is what made my heart melt. Don't get me wrong - love the trance and rave music not so much the ones i hear on the radio but i just MISS the music i grew up with listening to before the trance. Being here made me feel like i was back at a high school dance - loved it. okay so yeah i think we get it that i love the music here haha moving on

APPARENTLY there's TWO floors... and bars on both main and top floor. Very convenient. There's a bigger? dance floor upstairs and i say that with a question mark because downstairs is kinda hectic when everyone is tryna line up to go upstairs...doesnt really leave much room for dancing.

The service here really is spectacular.. my not so little bbg celebrated her old ass here and had a table reserved for her peeps- nice! and there was a banner that said Happy Birthday - and two signs that said Reserved for the birthday girl. i thought that was really cute. OH and she got a birthday card? from the owners? not sure but from raven bar and A BIRTHDAY TIARA!  i mean yeah it's plastic but what better way to get shitfaced that a sign on your dam head sayin "it's your birthday - time to fck shit up" 

I came early so i wasn't aware of this "line" that forms outside after 10. So good thing for that because it was a cold ass night in sf and although i was mostly covered - i was not at all warm walkin to the bar. SO YES GET THERE EARLY! Before guestlist and you'll find parking and no line but an open door for you to march right through!
author: Kristina L.

description: Came here on a Friday night for my "big night out" while visiting SF...and I have to say it did not disappoint!! BEST 90s MUSIC PLAYLIST, including old hiphop that I had forgotten about or never heard! (Aka not just the mainstream stuff) I had the best time dancing upstairs with my friend~ super chill vibe, but then again it IS SF.
author: Sukhmani G.

description:
The atmosphere in here is unmatched. It smelled incredible (like candles and fresh fruit), it was airy and cool when all the other bars were dank, and the lighting was key. 

Why three stars? Expensive and painfully weak cocktails. Granted, I didn't spend $11 on one of their signature drinks, but after spending $7 on weak-ass well, I wasn't too motivated to spend more.
author: Julia D.

description: I hosted my birthday party at Raven and it was even better than I could have imagined. Great service, such friendly staff, amazing cocktails, and the music was on point for a Wednesday. It was one of the best birthdays I've ever had!
author: Shannon C.

description:
Been here a couple of times and pretty impressed so far.  

Only other disclaimer is that its predominantly Asian on some nights, not all.  I don't mind personally since I myself am asian.  So if your group might get weirded out by this, another bar might be a safer bet. 

Pros:
-Top 40 
-Hip Hop
-Absent of EDM (awesome place if you want a break from the big room club scene)
-Decent Drinks
-Multiple Bars
-Dance Floor

Cons:
-Gets packed way too early
-Cover (10-15$)
-Do not go here if you have a group.  The place is pretty small. You'll just get frustrated.
author: Geo D.

description:
Play that hip hop and 90s! YES! Favorite club music. 

Tired of this edm everywhere else.


Only 1 stall in bathroom. Means long line and antsy girls [and guys!] crowding around the bathroom door. That is where you usually bump into someone you know too, as theyre passing by.. and youre awkwardly waiting to pee. hahahah

Coat check avaialble

Cover is $10
Great bartenders= Good drinks not like watered down at some other places
author: Veranna N.

description: I love this place really cool people. The bartenders could be better but music is great and the people aren't that bad location and vibe sweet.
author: Travis R.

description:
Taking it back to the old school! For REALS! Came here Saturday night during my visit to SF.  Paid the $10 cover (reasonable) and walked in and up the stairs to the 2nd floor.  Typical bar and dancefloor.  It was a bit crowded but what isn't in SF?  The music was hip hop and pop... A wide selection from Top 40 hits now and from 1999.  It was a random mix but I had fun nonetheless.  The scene is fun and being in my mid-twenties, it was fun dancing and signing to to songs from when I was in middle school.  Songs from BSB, Britney Spears, Jagged Edge. It puts a smile to my face now as I am typing this because these songs are so old but once you hear the first note, you start singing along as if you heard it the day before.  Drinks are average, the bartenders are pretty quick and attentive.  Didn't have to wait too long to get a bartender's attention. Restrooms can get crowded.  Doesn't matter if you try the ones upstairs or downstairs, you will still probably have to wait.

There are A/C units around the dancefloor.  Try to find where the air is being blasted.  Nothing better than a little refreshing cool air to keep you for burning up (literally). You are probably burning up the dancefloor, which you should do.  I appreciate my friend for suggesting this place.  Had a great time and will not complain if she suggest to go back the next time I'm in SF.
author: Kevin L.

description: I have been popping by Raven occasionally after work.  I obviously am there before the dancing and the crowds that most people cite in their reviews.  So I give it 5 stars for early Happy Hour.  Good tunes, great drinks - though I am stuck on the Ginger Drop-Kick, friendly bartenders and an amusing and bright mix of local characters.  It's a great place to chill, fraternize or party.
author: Jeff J.

description:
This place is too small for my liking, and it felt like a college bar scene. Yes, they play 90's hiphop (the best era of music ever!),  but the overall vibe just read "small town bar." Not only was it overly crowded, there were hoes and bros who just didn't know how to handle their liquor (ie. messy dancing, a guy who yakked on the floor while next to me, and shoving galore)... AND what's up with making people wait to go upstairs right after having to wait to go in? 

OH. and that $10 admission fee to get into a joint like this? MEH. Next.
author: Diana K.

description:
My friends and I love the vibe of this place. It's a happy medium between a club and a lounge/bar. Guest list always fills up by Tuesday or Wednesday so I would recommend signing up early if you're trying to make guest list. 

Last night we went to parlor first then hopped on over to raven at around 11:30pm. There was still a line and it took about 15 mins to get in. I had to use the bathroom so I asked the bouncer if I could run in while my friends waited in line and he was nice enough to let me in, but he held onto my ID for collateral. Fair enough. 

It was pretty crowded from what I remember, there was a line to get upstairs to the larger dance floor. Upstairs is usually packed with people. The dance floor is off to the side at the end of the bar. It's pretty small but there's always a good amount of people dancing. The music is great to dance to, mostly 90's hip hop. I'm so glad it's not all EDM. I don't believe there's a DJ but they play music videos on the wall next to the dance floor. Pretty cool, although it doesn't always match up with the song lol. 

They have a few tables downstairs and one section upstairs to book. Although it's a fun place to wander around and meet new people. They have an outdoors smoking section which is a great place to get some fresh air when it gets crowded inside. The smoking section is pretty well ventilated so it doesn't reek of smoke either. 

Dress code is pretty casual. But you won't stick out if you decide to wear a dress and heels. They have coat check upstairs and bathrooms upstairs and downstairs. My friends and I will probably be back in the near future (:
author: Klm S.

description:
Came here on a weekend night around 11 and the place was packed. Free entry before 10pm, or $10 after. With guestlist it is free before 11pm. Also, free coat check, yay. They play a mix of mostly 80s and 90s hiphop/pop music. There are some top 40 too. The music isnt really dance music. just a whole bunch or popular music from the past years. The DJ isnt the best. But I liked the music for nostalgic reasons. 

This place is two floors, with a bar on each floor. Drinks average $10 each. The bottom floor is mostly for people with bottle service and reservations for booths. There is also a small outdoor hallway you can hang out on the first floor. The second floor is the main dance floor. One thing I did not like was that there is a line with a bouncer to get to the second floor. So you have to wait several minutes to get into Raven, and if you wanna go to the dance floor you have to wait again. 

Crowd is mostly 20s. Most girls were in dresses and skirts (any kind, not just club wear) and most guys were in some type of collared shirt but on the more casual side.
author: Cecile S.

description: I had my expensive jacket and scarf stolen from here, but I still come almost every weekend. How can you not love songs that EVERY single person in the club is singing and dancing along to? From Nelly, to Spice Girls, to Shaggy, you are getting the best of 90s hip-hop and pop. Just remember, when you go, to use the free coat check upstairs.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I stopped by here for a private party associated with the SF Asian American Film Festival.  Given how often I'm in this area I was surprised that I wasn't familiar with this establishment.  Then I found out it had opened just month prior and the grand opening party is scheduled to occur this coming weekend.

My friends and I tried out a few of their signature cocktails made with fresh fruit juices and their beers on tap.  They have three full bars, a DJ with dancing upstairs and plenty of space for hanging out.   I really liked the music they played - not too loud and created just the right vibe for a fun time, but then again I was here during the day when the space wasn't too crowded.  The drinks are very reasonably priced ($5 for draught beers) and they carry a good variety of wines, beers and liquor. 

A huge plus are the super nice bartenders.  Not only did they remember the crazy complicated request from one friend but they were fast, efficient, funny and down to earth,  No attitudes to be found here.  A great place to hang out and relax with friends.  I cannot wait to make a return visit!
author: Melissa L.

description:
A friend and I had a joint bday celebration here last night (Saturday) and had an AMAZING time. We were searching to get bottle service at various clubs/lounges in SF and so glad we ended up going with Raven. Their prices are relatively reasonable as bottle service goes, and the email correspondence for reserving a table was very clear and detailed. I wanted our friends to get in for free, and I think almost everyone that came, was able to get in without cover.. If you have a party over 20+ the key is to have EVERYONE sign up for the guestlist by the Tuesday before the event.

Although we had a table, we still had to wait in line because the woman at the window had our guestlist - that was kinda lame, considering we had already made arrangements for bottle service. Either way, we arrived around 10:15, and the line moved quickly so it wasn't a big deal. 

Music was SO BOMB. I'm def a hip hop & R&B fan, and I literally did not stop dancing the entire night - in fact, we ended up closing out the club. I can't remember the last time that I stayed at a club til lights on! Although I do like EDM, it's so refreshing to go to a club that doesn't play EDM. Dance floor was crowded, but not crowded to the point where you can't get your groove on. Who wants to dance at an empty club anyway?! 

Didn't buy drinks at the bar, so can't comment on that. But I definitely can't wait to come back to Raven. It was my first time, and ooh wee, I am SOLD!
author: Angela L.

description:
Yes, I can update my review after having a decent time on New Years Eve and I was able to actually experience Raven on a regular night....AND I LOVED IT!!!! I tried signing up for guestlist for free entrance before 11pm on Saturday but when I tried on a Tuesday or Wednesday, guest list was already closed. So my advice is that if you know you are gonna go to Raven, you should guestlist asap haha. That night I had to pay $10 regardless so we strolled on by at 11:15pm and there was a huge line out the door. After 11pm, they really do hold up the line and at first I thought it was to make the place look poppin but there is a capacity limit since the place is pretty small. It is a bar/lounge/dance club with a small dance floor on top so you cant fit as many people as the Grand. I guess that is what gives it its charm and why I like this place so much. I finally got in around midnight and was ready to dance the night away.

MUSIC
There was actually a line to go upstairs to the dance floor and it was quite annoying to stand in two lines to get to dance but it was totallyyy worth it. The floor was packed but I made my way and omgosh the MUSIC!!! They had Nsync, Backstreet Boys, Britney Spears, Beyonce, Kesha and ALLL THE GOODIES. I WAS IN MUSIC DANCING HEAVEENN. They have the music video playing in the background as well. This is seriously the best music I have ever heard because it has the good late 90's and early '00s music, some of the older dancable music, and some modern hip stuff. I dont think I have ever given a dance club, especially one in SF, 5 stars but it totally deserves it. I will definitely be celebrating my birthday here! I went to request my two fave dance songs and numba one is Return of the Mack but I should have known that this DJ already played it. I was disappointed but I realized this guy is good. The DJ plays every weekend it seems like so I am feeling that. My second song is Too Close by Next and thank goodness he didnt play it yet. Usually you have to wait a bit for the DJ to play your requested song but he played it two songs later and I totally gave him a high five.I complimented a guy in a suit behind the bar and asked if he was the manager. He was and at first he thought I was complaining but I just wanted to show my appreciation. I complimented the place and he gave me 4 passes for free entrance and skip the line privileges. Score one for me! I hope you are reading this, but thank you!

ATTIRE
The attire here is pretty chill and you def do not have to go all out with the Grand status clothes. I saw girls in jeans and guys looking casual but some people dressing up as well. I would feel inappropriate wearing like a tight dress and heels so if anything, I would wear a shirt and skirt with flats. The whole point is to feel comfortable and dance the night away :)

CROWD
Yes, it is true that this place is mostly Asians in their mid late twenties and early thirties. It is a good looking crowd compared to other hip hop, top 40, pop dance clubs. I got there after midnight so I noticed all the guys had already prowled on the crowd so I guess if you are there to meet people, get in on guestlist and before 11pm so you can venture and not have to wait in that long line. I like that the guys here are not creeps as well and do not just stand at the dance floor staring at the girls dancing. 

PARKING
Parking is quite difficult so good luck finding! I cant really give you advice here.

I have never been so satisfied with a club ever. Music and people cant get better than this! If only this place was bigger but allll goood.


**TIPS**
1) Guestlist days before because most like the sign up will be filled, especially on Saturday and if you do the day of. Free before 11pm! Afterwards, they hold up the line and you wont get in until midnight.
2) If you love the older pop music and r&b but also the new hip top 40s, THIS IS TOTALLY YOUR PLACE. I am sold like no other.
3) You dont have to dress that much to impress but you can still look cute for the crowd.
4) Enjoy :))))))
author: Amy H.

description:
Stumbled in here before Cat Club yesterday and was so glad I did.
The bartenders greeted us like regulars and immediately made us delicious cocktails.
He got The Don Draper, a rye cocktail and I told the bartender what I was in the mood for, something light but not overly sweet, and he whipped me up a treat.
He called it "The Palisades" and it was gin based with something pink, and honey. So delicious and exactly what I wanted.
The bar tender said he had found the recipe from a vintage cocktail book he owned. Hear that? They study cocktails there and perfect them!
Minus two stars because it was pricey but ultimately this is a classy joint with a lovely staff.
author: Molly S.

description: As a venue, it's great. 2 stories means more places to hang out. It had a great chill and dim vibe and the music was pumpin'. If only I enjoyed the music more, it's a little too old school for me. But overall the venue seemed like a great place to chill or to get your groove on.
author: Amanda T.

description: A small spot with two floors to dance on with a bar. They also have a back bar for table service that is less packed than the ones on the dance floor. Also want to give a shoutout to the amazing bar tending service that Chris, in the back bar provides! Super nice guy with awesome skills that makes pouring a shot pretty! I also like the free table service Raven provides for the back of the first floor because I booked twice with them for birthdays events and they have responded quite quickly. I also hope they get their phone number fixed because everytime I call to try to book the tables, the line doesn't work but email works. Music is always good too - 90s music leading up to today's hip-hop, r&b, and rap!
author: Amanda C.

description:
My first time going here was for my cousin's birthday. I enjoyed the music (old school 90's/hip-hop) and we all had a great time. I decided to celebrate my birthday here as well, did my research, checked out their website, etc. I got intouch with the General Manager David, who explained the details of hosting an event here. Since this was my first experience having a table at Raven's Bar, I assumed in order to reserve a table you would need to purchase a bottle which you didn't, unlike most places! I ended up purchasing a bottle anyways, since I thought it would be well worth it. I love how they didn't try to rob you for your money when throwing a party here. They offer free coat check all night which is amazing! 

Ok, now that you know Raven does not try to rob you for your money, I want to share my overall experience last Friday night for my birthday. A group of my friends and I arrive a little before 10pm, no lines no list yet, which was quick and easy. (I suggest getting there early to hold your table). I get to my table and they had a "Happy Birthday" sign in my area and signs saying "reserved for Gracielle's party" (totally VIP) we got our wrist bands to get upstairs. The bartenders were super nice and I must say the whole staff was too!!! Ok, not only did they make my party VIP exclusive, and special. David also gave me extra VIP cards for next time and a Happy Birthday card/Thank you note for celebrating with them! Wait, there's more, David also gave me a "Birthday Girl" tiara! Which I thought was so sweet and super cute! 

I honestly, have never been in such an epic bar/lounge like this one! This place is awesome! The only thing I could possibly wish for is more restrooms and for them to renovate to a bigger bar. Because it can get really hot and extremely crowded inside. Other than that, the service is great, ambience is great, music is great, and of course the alcohol is great! ;)
author: Maria Gracielle Y.

description:
Pros: it's two stories tall with good music that differs from the "typical" club music you hear (e.g. When I went they were playing 90s pop, rap, and r&b - as a child who grew up during this time, I definitely appreciated that). 

Cons: there isn't much space to move around (as in, the quarters are pretty narrow) and there are a TON of "Asian bros" - some of whom can be pretty aggressive (which may not necessarily be Raven's fault, nor is it specific to just one ethnic/racial group - I mention this though as this club did, in fact, have a predominant amount of Asian men there). 

Because of that experience, I do not think ill be going back there again. It's not for everyone. However, the music is awesome, and anyone who likes clubbing and music from "back in the day" should try this place out.
author: Angelica R.

description:
It's bittersweet writing a review for this place; I love it so much that I wish I didn't have to share, but such greatness deserves its spotlight.

The highlight of this venue would definitely be the music. Who doesn't like spending a night on an intimate dance floor with your friends while jammin to throwbacks?! So much feels. 

I also enjoy their specialty cocktails and the creative hands that crafts them! The bartenders are patient and are attentive to what you want. I've asked for suggestions multiple times I've been here and I've always been happy with their choices. If you're looking for a night out with your girls, try their basil gimlets. It's delicious. 

Or...if you're looking for a wild night, just knock down some shots. Their full bar is all yours. 

Great people. Great vibe. Hence, long lines. Try coming a bit earlier to avoid the crowds.
author: Regina C.

description:
Nothing tells you more about a bar than how happy the staff is! 

I had a chance to check out Raven Bar last night for the first time. Clay was behind the bar and he served up a slew of different cocktails for me and my friends throughout the night. Some of the other ladies thought he was a little rude but he was pretty chill when we interacted.

I had a chance to interact with the other staff and it seemed like Raven Bar is a great place to work.
author: Jared W.

description:
I had a blast here on a Friday night for a celebratory dance fest. My friend finished her master's, and Raven actually put up a Congrats banner and personalized congrats signs. Well done, Raven. Well done, indeed.

We made a reservation for the booth upstairs, which was a good move. The dance floor got a little packed, so it was nice to be able to sneak out and sit for a few. 

My two complaints:

The music was intermittently good. Other times, it was downright bad.

The security guards: I liked that they were present, but I did not like how they would just appear behind me sometimes. Spooky.

The good: good energy, we had a great time.
The bad: see above, yo.
author: Amanda B.

description:
The kind of place that you'd have a really fun time at if all your friends were there or if you rented it out for a private event.

I came with a bunch of my younger law school friends... and we were definitely the youngest people there.  There were a lot of 50 year old creeps lurking and trying to dance with my friends... following them around, etc.  And these guys aren't the "sugar daddy" type.  Just straight up weirdos who come to Raven Bar alone.

Downstairs was nicer.  I liked the side / outdoorish patio they have for smoking.  Not a smoker myself, but it's nice for people who smoke to have a place to sit outside, rather than lurk around dirty SOMA at night.

If I come back, it will probably only be because I'm at Bloodhound, next door.

One perk is that they play some booty rap / music that's played on 106.1 KMEL, in addition to whatever is on top 40.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've been here 4 or 5 times over the past few years. Never a bad time, reasonable prices, and the below average bathroom waiting experience.
author: Steven C.

description:
This is my rave on Raven. First off, I want to say that Raven is probably one of the more considerate dance bars I've been to in SF.

Number 1: FREE coat check. No more freezing in the cold while waiting in line! SF winds don't play.
Number 2: It was raining this past weekend and they were nice enough to have people line up in the alley where there were canopies so that people won't get wet.
Number 3: If you were single during Valentine's Day weekend, you got a pink bracelet to let others know that you are ready to mingle! (Why don't more bars do this? It would greatly reduce the amount of guys getting shot down with "Sorry, I have a boyfriend.")

Alright onto the...VENUE
Raven is two floors, both have a dance area. I like the downstairs area better because it has two bars, instead of one, so it's much faster to get a drink. Also, I love that they play all my favorite jamz from the 80s and 90s. I also can guarantee that you will hear a BSB and/or NYSNC song at least one throughout the night (I heard both and sang my heart out.) Like most places with a dance area, it gets sweaty, but they do try to pump up the AC every now and then (again, they're so considerate!)

DRINKS
They have a specialty cocktail menu, with drinks starting around ~$10. I tried "The Raven", which was ok, but I also went to Local Edition the night before and their drinks were much tastier. They also have some fresh beers on tap, which they serve in mason jars. Nice touch.

ATTIRE
Dressy casual. Raven is great if you feel like dressing up, or not. They don't have a super strict dress code. I like that.

Overall, would come back.
author: Vicki C.

description: This is my best friend's favorite bar in San Francisco.  We have the exact same taste in everything, so I said sure let's give it a go!  I can see that he comes here not only for the fun atmosphere (they were playing Cypress Hill and Garbage lol) but because the bartender David is amazing!  He seriously knows his stuff..I was just sitting in the corner, amused watching him pour his drinks..seriously an expert at his craft.  If you're here definitely ask about any new drinks he's been crafting lately..you won't be disappointed.  One of the most original bars I've been to in a while!
author: Sasha L.

description:
If you're into 90's and 2000's pop music - this is your spot. A little small, casual environment, sign up on GL/get in early otherwise you'll have to wait in line.

Something about hanging out in the club while watching Nelly's "Hot in Herre" brings me back to my elementary/middle school days.
author: Anthony L.

description: My daughter had her 21st birthday celebration at Raven's last night and I just have to say that the management/staff at the club are absolutely gracious and hospitable.  The 90's music was throw back fun.  Garret, our bar tender was fantastic and he took great care of us.  I would say that the people there were classy, nice and fun.  The club's decor is modern and clean when we arrived.  It was packed wall to wall with a waiting line outside. We had a reserved area in the back and the rsvp count wasn't maximized but this is where I think management really shined.  They made our daughter feel very special with a tiara, birthday decor, a card and goodies.  Simply gracious and professional people.   I wish  them much success and that good things come their way.
author: Dawn R.

description:
This review is for their "night club."

A friend was hosting her birthday here and had a table. We got there around 10:40 ish because let's be real, no one is ever at the club before 11.We were waiting in the cold, and inhaling the yummy bacon wrapped hot dogs next to us. We stood in line for an hour and didn't get in till close to 12.  It's not because they want too seem popular like other clubs by holding up the line; it's because it's a super TINY venue and they were at max capacity. The only way the line is going to move is when people leave. By tiny,I mean about 50 people max downstairs. When it came time for us to get in, we had to pay cover! $10. Blasphemy! Girls usually get in for free. I thought their "drive thru" cashier style was incredibly tacky. The place is okay but decorated with cheesy, and cheap "happy birthday" banners over each table. EKKKS! It's not a kids party. 2 star because the bartenders were friendly and quick. And plus one for music because it wasn't all EDM or house. There was a plethora of 90s flashback hip-hop and pop music. I distinctly remember singing along to some Nsync tunes. If she don't know who Nsync is, then she's too young for you bro!
author: Lisa L.

description:
I came here specifically to celebrate my birthday on Friday and it was a blast! Thank you, David, for making it a truly special night.

I love me some EDM, but sometimes you just want some good throwbacks, and Raven definitely knows how to do it right by putting on Backstreet Boys at the right moment.

BIRTHDAY SHENANIGANS
Table reservations were seamless and David was very responsive. They even give you a private guest list for 30 friends (no cover all night).

When we got to Raven, they even decorated my birthday table / booth and David came over to personally give me a birthday card with some VIP passes for next time, AND a dedicated server for our table. Can you say A+ for service?

PROS:
-Fun music (Fridays are 90's-Millennial throwbacks)
-Easy (and FREE) to book a table
-Free coat check (WHAAAT?!)
-Funny bartenders (Thanks for the drinks, Zhu!)
-Full bar with specialty cocktails
-Drinks are reasonably priced (~$10) and it doesn't take forever to get a drink

CONS:
-Tiny bathrooms (only 1 stall?!) but they were pretty clean for a lounge/club
-No re-entry (what's the point of stamping our wrists?)

Like everyone else said, the crowd is mainly Asian, but that's not a bad thing. We know how to have a good time!

Overall, great vibe and a fun time. I'd definitely come back in the future!

PS: Sign up for the guest list to get free entry before 11pm! Otherwise, there's a $10 cover.
author: Krystie M.

description:
The place opens to a bar feel with booths and places to sit and drink. If you go upstairs, 90's to current hip hop is playing. Very fun to dance to although the dance floor isn't too large. There is typically free coat check upstairs. And free entrance before 10pm and 10 dollars afterwards. 
I loved the place and the music. But it was the guests that brought the stars down to 4 rather than 5.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
I like the music; 90's hip-hop and old school top 40's pop mash ups (the dj rocks),  hate the cigarette smell that clouds the entire first floor,  and how packed it can get around 11-12pm.   I really despise the elbow-to-elbow environment.  Reminds me of Infusion Lounge. GAHHHHH!  Better crowd/capacity control is much needed.  

Oh,  and what is the point of getting stamped on our wrists when there is a sign that says "There are no In's and Out's"?  It's really dumb bc I actually think having in's and out's will help create space a little bit.
author: Wendy T.

description:
If I could, I'd give this place a big fat zero for ZERO SERVICE.

Why do I say this? It's all thanks to the pretentious prick who calls himself a "bartender." I came here last Friday (1/17) to grab some drinks and catch up with friends. We were in the back bar area on the first floor, when I came up to the "bartender" to order a round of drinks for my group. He immediately made eye contact and nodded his acknowledgement of me. I courteously waited my turn, and when he was ready, I made my request. I got my drinks right away and showed my appreciation with a 25% tip.

When I found out that I had ordered the wrong drink for a friend, I came back to the bar.  The "bartender" acknowledged me, and I requested the correct drink. I was ready to pay for my own mistake, as I was standing around, holding my credit card. I saw him making 2 drinks, took a drink request from the group of girls that arrived AFTER me, saw him making drinks for them, and another drink or two for someone else. I tried to make eye contact, but he avoided me like the plague. My bf checked up on me to see why I was still waiting so long at the bar. Finally, I politely informed the "bartender" that I've been waiting for my drinks for quite a while. His reaction took me by surprise because I was being polite the entire time.

He hissed at me that he's in the services industry, and people in the services industry tend to forget. On top of that, he told me to find another bartender to make me my drinks!

Well, if you're in the services industry, and you see a customer lingering around trying to make eye contact with you, shouldn't you follow up with your customer to ensure that he/she's been taken care of? That's what I would do, as I was in the services industry myself. Nor would you ever stoop so low as to react in such an immature and unprofessional fashion, especially to a customer who was generous to you.

Being a bartender means servicing each and every customer with consistency and with the highest level of professionalism, not making fancy drinks to whomever you please and being a snot while you're at it. Perhaps you should learn what servicing is about before you call yourself a bartender.
author: Kellie C.

description:
I went here for an event, so I guess it wasn't exactly a typical night? 

It was a nice enough space, pretty dingy in the back room, and I didn't make it upstairs. Watching 90s music videos on the multiple TV screens was fun. Lots of drunk women dancing interestingly... Drinks were good and bartenders were all pleasant. 

The good state of the restroom is probably the main reason I'm a fan. Too many bars are ruined by their nightmarish bathrooms; this, as far as I saw, isn't one of them.
author: Kira G.

description: Two floors of lounge chairs, bars, and dancefloor. Decent crowd. No in/out priviledges and cover on Fridays.
author: Jude N.

description:
Came here last night for a couple birthday celebrations and overall, I had an absolute blast!! 

The music is what makes this places. The DJ is awesome! And finally, a place that doesn't play all EDM music. I love me some EDM but a girl wants to dance, dance!:) I mean, N'SYNC, Britney, Destinys Child and TLC dance party?! Count me in!

The security (sorry for my language) but are straight up a-holes. Like rude and on their high horses. Especially the ones that were checking id's last night. I had to take my sister home and was coming back. Given a stamp and having a reserved table, I thought gave me the privilege of going straight back in. But apparently not. The guy told me they were at full capacity. Okay...well technically I am already included in that capacity because I have a reserved table and am counted in on that. He told me I had to wait back in line. I asked to grab my jacket inside so I didn't freeze while waiting in line.  because I was in a skirt and crop top. Yeah, you get the picture. His tone was just disrespectful, completely. 

I just hate being talked down too, who doesn't? 

Other than that, it was a good time!
author: Chelsey S.

description:
I go to bars for 1 of 3 reasons, 

1. Try and forget about my problems
2. Pretend to hit on my girlfriend as if she were a stranger
3. Dance the night away

Raven offers 2 of the 3, which is good enough to get 5 stars. The drinks are pricey though, but they don't play EDM, which makes up for the high priced drinks.
author: Ben Z.

description:
WTF did I pay a $10 cover for? The d-bags working the door should've been enough for me to walk away, but I couldn't because I had friends who, unfortunately for them, had already paid their cover earlier. 

This "club" is straight up ratchet. The term "ratchet" has been loosely thrown around recently, but I can't think of a more suitable adjective to describe Raven. 

Look, I didn't have a terrible time at this place (that's not to say it wasn't bad, because it was). I was there with my friends, I bought a few drinks at reasonable prices, and I even waited on line to get upstairs to challenge myself to make the most of their 30-something square foot "dance floor." Maybe "dance floor" is pushing it because that sounds like a large room, so let's say "small designated space for dancing" to be more accurate.

The music sucked and had no flow to it -- it was a horrible attempt at DJing/VJing/whatever-you-want-to-call-it, the floor was disgustingly sticky as if they were trying to glue your shoes down, and the entire staff just needs to be retrained or replaced. There is absolutely no reason for anyone to waste their time or money at Raven Bar.
author: Brian C.

description: It may just be my timing, which is always early evening/pre-dinner, but this place is always kind of empty. Especially when you compare it to the always bustling Bloodhound next door. That's really a shame, because the bartenders are friendly, efficient, and they know how to mix a good cocktail. Everytime I've been I've enjoyed myself. If you are in SOMA looking for someplace to kick back with an adult beverage, give Raven Bar a try. It's a really gorgeous space, and again, they have some great things to imbibe.
author: Nicole M.

description:
This review is from my experience at Raven last night. 

Please be aware of your bag/clutch/wallet and CELL PHONE!!

My iPhone 5S and debit card was stolen out of a zipped compartment in my cross-body bag. The same debit card was also used at Raven. I notified management immediately and learned that there has been a pattern of iPhone thefts at Raven. So girls, CHECK FOR YOUR PHONE even if your bag is zipped, unzipped, on your body or set down.

Although it was an unfortunate incident, I felt comforted by the staff and security's swift response.
author: Janelle S.

description: Can we just talk about how dope this bar is?? I'm hitting my thirties, so we don't go out much....but when we do, my friends and I love a good bar with a really good DJ who can bump only the best 90s hip hop and r&b.. ALL NIGHT. This place was hard to leave in the end; only left the place feeling so alive & full of energy. Thankful I found this spot while scoping Yelp one last time during dinner. So glad we decided to go against our original plans & head over to Raven Bar instead. BEST decision ever. It was the highlight of my friend's bachelorette weekend! Couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was. Crowd was good, no bad vibes, just fun from the moment we stepped foot into the place. We knew it was going to be a good night when the DJ played Brandy's Sitting Up In My Room about three songs in. There are two floors; the top having the most open space for dancing. No cover before 10pm I believe. Anyhooooots, don't miss out on this gem y'all.. I'm still replaying that night in my head & all I got are smiles & the greatest memories.
author: Aubrey J.

description:
I happened to be here on a night when some house DJs were playing in the DJ booth in the back of the bar. I liked their music!

The space is really nice. The red lighting gives it a lounge-y feel in the back, though the front of the bar has more of a sports bar vibe. 

The two bartenders were friendly and attentive.
author: Jess L.

description:
My GF decided she wanted to celebrate her birthday here a few weekends back. 

She was able to reserve a table without any hassle. No bottle service fee, no minimum amount of guests, no minimum amount of drinks to get! Music to our ears, haha. But wait, I'm not done, it gets better! With a table reservation you have your own guest list, and everyone you add to your guest list gets in for free ($10 cover).
