There are two levels in this place, the upstairs seeming to be the much more crowded area. Our table was downstairs where the dance floor was much more open. There are 2 bars downstairs so that was great. I think there is only 1 bar upstairs.

90's, 90's, 90's!! This place really takes you back with all the 90s music. They play music videos downstairs and I remember seeing Criss Cross, 2 Pac, Salt n Pepper, and Digital Underground (oh yeah, Humpty Hump, you know what it is).

We eventually went upstairs to dance because it had more people and a DJ. The music upstairs was a mix between old school and new stuff, we liked it. They go a little crazy with the fog machine IMO.

Due to all the perks you get when reserving a table I would highly recommend this place!
author: Stephen R.

description: Wow better places in the hood.  The staff was pompous and very rude would never think of coming back.  Better places to spend your hard earned dollars.  Asked for the manager and got him way later.  Wish we would have not asked for him.  Ciao!
author: Juan L.

description:
I came here for a private party, so I can't really speak to what this place is like on the "regular."  It's solid though.  Room for getting all hot 'n' sweaty.  (so let's take off all our clothes... it's gettin... so hot in heeeeerrrrreeee......I wanna take my clothes off.. )

Don't worry.  It's not that kind of bar.  People kept their clothes on.... and then congregated by the window to get some fresh air.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Unfortunately we arrived 5 minutes after 10 and had to pay the $10 cover. However we only waited in line for 5 mins which was pretty good for a Saturday night. The actual lounge/bar is small (2 floors) but despite the crowd I didn't feel overheated. I could tell it got super packed towards 11pm, and when we left at 12:30 there was still a crowd outside.

NOW THE MUSIC. The best! I hate clubs that only play EDM so this was an awesome change of scenery. I'm not huge on the boy band songs but I loooove older hip hop, and of course MJ.  Really the music (and the fact that the music videos play on the walls) is what won me over. I'd definitely come back to sing my heart out.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Sometimes you can judge how ratchet or crazy your night will be based on the TYPE of cup your drink comes served in. At raven, you get most of your mixed drinks in a plastic clear cup. 

Details:

The Venue (3/5): Two story venue with two dance floors and bars. If you're signing yourself up for lung cancer, there's even a smoking patio outside connected to the club, so you don't have to go through the bouncers again.  I came at 11pm on a Friday and there was no cover and no line. When we left around 12:30am to go to another bar there was a line. At 11pm, the club was already poppin' on the inside. You'll find your pushing and shoving yourself to the bar or to finding yourself a place to boogie down on the dance floor or to wall flower.  Bathrooms both on the first and 2nd floor near the staircase. 

I would recommend being careful in the staircases if you're a girl. A narrow, very dimly lit, crowded staircase with spilled drinks in heels isn't safe at all! The front staircase outside has lights lighting the steps, but not the back one. Another thing that I didn't particularly like about the venue is that drinks were getting spilled everywhere and the floor was wet and often gross and I didn't spot too many staff around cleaning things up and keeping things from just getting SLOPPY. 

The crowd (2/5) : You see a lot of younger faces here - everybody looked like they had a newly minted fake or just crossed the line of 21. This isn't the financial district or marina crowd. There are a lot of RUDE people dancing like they don't care throwing arms everywhere, people who wouldn't let you through the crowd and a bunch of awkward asians taking selfies. 

The music (4.5/5) : The DJ's do a good job of hitting a lot of hip hop/pop jams... but at the same time i'm in my mid 20's and i could barely recognize some of the oldies they played. Still good to whippin my hair back and forth though.  If you're looking for an EDM type vibe, it wasn't there. They had music videos playing on the walls on the second floor. 

Bartenders (5/5) : One guy I swear looks like Ryan Gosling. They deserve an extra star for this.  The bartenders themselves are great. They make drinks quickly, don't ignore you, aren't snotty and serve the pretty people first. Only downside --- they bartenders pour just a little too much over the rim and most drinks just end up spilled everywhere. Well drinks and shots $7, pretty standard. 

Verdict: The overall vibe at this place is one that could be summed up as: Divey, chic-ratchet, dancing on the line of  trashy and classy, yet a SOLIDLY fun night. Good bartenders, 2 dance floors, poppin' music will ensure you a fun night. Just remember to not accidentally fall on your butt, laugh at the awkward kids taking selfies, and whip your hair back n forth!
author: Christine B.

description:
AWESOME TIME!

I give Raven 5 stars because of their awesome bartenders! Came here this past Saturday night for a bachelorette party. This place can get pretty packed! There was a short line when we got there around 10pm, but luckily we were on the guestlist so we didn't have to wait long at all. 

The music was definitely on point - top 40s and 90s! We danced for awhile upstairs, but it eventually got too crowded and stuffy up there, so we made our way downstairs. We ended up hanging out in the corner of the downstairs bar near the front door. This is where the real fun began!

Our bartenders were the best! They were super attentive and made amazing shots. They definitely gave VIP treatment to our bride-to-be! It was a very entertaining night and all the girls had a great time! 

We will for sure come back again when we're up in the bay area!
author: Tracey W.

description:
I researched bars in San Fran before I came and visited and this came up with 4 stars. So I put my name on the "list". It maybe got me free cover inside but my cab to and from cost more since we left without going in. We waited in line for 20 min (10:50) and didn't move. There were at least 30 people in front of us. So we left.  The music was loud and not great. However the bouncer was nice and... Apologetic? 

Won't recommend :(
author: Kate G.

description:
Okay yea I did not really like this bar :\

It was pretty poppin though! It kind of reminds me of the Loft in Downtown san jose.

The crowd was not really my scene and they were playing throwback music. I love throwback songs, just not at bars/ clubs. 

These kind of bars confuse me. Is it a bar? or a club? because the space is so small that theres no room for people that lounge and stand about and the people that want to dance. So then the "dance floor" gets all awkward because theres like the 3 drunk guys and girls that are just whipping their hurr back and forth...... into other people that are completely not on that level. hahaha. 

Anyways yes so these bar/lounge/dance places are not the type of place for me. I used to enjoy these when I was younger but I have since moved on.
author: Rachel C.

description:
this is how we do it, it's friday night!

i LOVE 90's hip hop!  (music videos are projected on a large screen by the upstairs dance floor as well)

got in with no cover  and bouncers are extremely friendly

the room gets steamy as more people crowded onto the dance floor

this place truly caters to the 80's babies.  if you enjoy 90's music or looking to get away from the usual house and edm thats playing everywhere these days then this is the spot to be!
author: Tina A.

description:
Came here about a week ago and I must say, it was pretty fun! 

There are two floors: didn't expect that. 

The music is a mix of hip hop and edm. The crowd is mostly Asian and there are three bars with a outdoor smoking area. 

It gets pretty crowded second level when the night goes on and harder to move around especially the narrow area from the bar to the dance floor. 

Overall, I like this bar alot and had many descent priced drinks. I will definitely be back!
author: Adam J.

description:
I am giving Raven 2-Stars for many reasons....
I have been to Raven several times, my friends and I have hosted our Birthday Parties here twice, and I have loved all of it every single time.

My most recent time was a disaster. Two friends of mine, including myself, reserved a large section for our birthday this week. It was a great time for most of the time. We had nearly 50 friends join us, and every single person bought several drinks from the bar. When the final set of our friends arrived, we venture upstairs to dance the night away. Several songs in, a friend of mine, who was visiting from France, pulled up a song on her phone, and showed it to the DJ (Mark Andrus). People had been requesting songs all night long, so we figured, no problem, he will definitely play this top 10 dance track. He grabbed her phone and swung over to his laptop, we thought it was in. He motioned for my friend to join him at the side door where the DJ enters and exits the booth. 

We followed her over, and he said, word for word.. "I will never play this F***ing song, if you want to hear a song by someone who has a F****ing voice, then come talk to me, but I will never play this.."

It caught us all by surprise.. We were annoyed, but we figured, what ever, we'll just continue dancing to his flop dance tracks that he mixed in with every top dance song from the early 2000's.. No problem, we'll continue having our party...

About 1 min later, we watched him motion for security, and he told security my friend needed to leave. There was no reason for him to do this. I asked security why she had to leave and he said "I don't know man, the DJ just said she needed to go, I'm just security.." -- A pretty lame answer. So we all left, every last person from my party walked out of the bar, and I watched the bar empty out quickly. 

Once outside, I asked to speak to the manager.. I wanted to speak to him on the situation, and also because the VIP bar still had my credit card and a lot of our belongings in our reserved section. After a lot of begging and pleading, they called the manager out, and he spoke with me and let me retrieve all of our belongings. He basically said "Oh well" about the DJ situation, which is the main reason I am so annoyed. There are hundreds of better DJ's in the Bay Area that would gladly take the job of this a-hole, and would perform which a much high finesse and sense of professionalism. 

I won't be returning here, nor will any of my friends, and I will be sure to let anyone thinking about coming to this bar know about this very unprofessional experience.
author: Nic A.

description: Door security beware. I've been coming here casually for many years for the awesome late 90s early 2000s hip hop, friendly bartenders, servers and management. I can't say the same for the front door this particular night.  As someone referred to this security guy as the "bull dog", he treated my guest list(happy birthday list) like crap. We had bottle service and the list of names was to ensure they get in smoothly. Not the case. Friend approaches the front and tells security he is with our table but is still told he has to wait in the long line. I come out and tell the bouncer he is with our bottle service guest list.  He tells me he has to wait in line. It wasn't until I get the manager that the guy eases up, even then he was still rude. "Well then go get him.."-security. As I come back with my friend he condescending says "have a nice day".   What's the point of your establishment paying for bottle service and having the guests wait in line? The "bull dog" needs to find a solution to help guests not be an impediment to an establishment's good will clients.  Management is always great but bouncers need work. I would suggest the bouncer needs more training.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Never been to a place like this in SF before! The music is refreshingly different from other clubs. They don't really play EDM. Instead, they seem to do this throw back theme at the beginning- and yes I still love the occasional backstreet boys and old school britney-  and progress to 2014 as the evening approaches the end.

Tip: THE dance floor is on the second floor. You'll want to get there earlier to get upstairs without a problem. They limit the amount of people and the line gets crazy by 11. Coat check is also on the second floor. There are two bathrooms on the second floor- a ladies room and a unisex.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Planning on just a dinner date with my girls, I felt under-dressed for the SF nightlife last Friday night. To my surprise, the venue welcomed folks of all attire, from the skimpy dresses to the hoodies and sneakers. Yay under-dressed me (skinny jeans, boots, and a cardigan)! 

Music was amaze-balls! 90's hits and flat screens in every view of the actual music videos! When the men weren't appealing enough my eyes were focused on those videos. Plus the crowd was great -- everyone was into the music and dancing. It's really a great atmosphere to just have fun with your friends, drink, dance, chat. 

The cons... the inability to move at a reasonable speed between the upper and lower levels. Traffic jams were so bad it took us 10 minutes, including the line at the stairs, just to move between the levels. They need to find a better strategy to get people moving. Also, there were so many people upstairs that in some sections I thought I was going to have a panic attack from feeling claustrophobic! 

I am not sure why the lower level is so unpopular... I actually thought it had a nice loungey feel. 

I'd definitely come back with my friends to hang out -- but not to shop for eye candy!
author: Krystal A.

description:
This lounge has a really great atmosphere. If you want to avoid the younger, drink to get faded crowd, come here and enjoy a few well prepared cocktails. The decor inside is nice and welcoming, in the back they have booths, good for parties. 

The only thing I found obnoxious was a few comments heard from the bartenders. A group of us came on a Tuesday to have some beer. It was Tuesday so it wasn't very busy inside, and only the front section was open. We were not aware but they close at 10pm, we came in around 9:50pm...the comment from one bartender to another "I guess we're staying open later..."
A little while later (past 10pm) another group of people came in. When they went to order the bartender says "hey you know we close at 10....but if you hurry I can make you something."

It's not the customers fault for assuming you're open when the door is unlocked and there are people inside! The bartender's comments should be directed to their managers, they have the ability to stop people at the door and let them know politely that last call had already happened.
author: Hayden C.

description:
Seriously if the chick that actually works there is trying to regulate on the men's bathroom so women can use it then she needs to be fired. Club night at 12:15 and she's trying to tell me I'm messed up for not letting a lady use the men's bathroom when  there is a line for the women's she's tripping and needs to learn about customer service when there is a line for the men's room.
She was dressed as wonder women and tried to threaten me with the fact that she worked here not knowing that I was sober.
author: Blake R.

description: If I wanted to go out and dance, I usually prefer EDM over top 40's or hip hop, but I keep coming back to Raven because of their MUSIC VIDEOS. The first time I came here I probably sat at the table for 30 minutes watching the VJ throw on some hip hop classics like Will Smith - Gettin Jiggy With It and Warren G - Regulate. I couldn't turn away. I mean how could you? It was like I was young again watching TRL with Carson Daly. I've never gone upstairs because it gets way too hot and crowded. The downstairs area usually has a good amount of dancing area and if you don't feel like dancing, I usually don't have a problem finding a place to sit in the back bar area or some of the tables on the side (if they aren't reserved).
author: Cindy A.

description:
Cover starts at 10pm if you didn't sign up on the guest list! Otherwise, guest list closes at 11pm. Came here on a Saturday night relatively early. They were playing 90s hip hop and it was really slow. Music videos are played on the tvs and projectors. Around 11, it started to pick up. The music got better and it all of a sudden became extremely crowded. The dance floor upstairs was packed that they closed the staircase to go upstairs. A few of my friends couldn't get upstairs so my bf talked to the security and he let them up. 

Overall, the bar was decent. I probably wouldn't want to go back if they are going to restrict people going up and down the staircase.
author: Cathie N.

description: Back in the summer of 2013 I frequented this place A LOT!!! It was my favorite place to go because the music and crowd were great! They played 90s music. It's always a mixed crowd. Nowadays I dread coming here because it's so crowded and no room to dance. On Fridays and Saturdays they play top 40, and occasionally edm. Don't get me wrong, I have fun every time I go here. But it's turning into like any other bar/club in the city.
author: Majileen C.

description: Love love love Raven. I love this bar so much, I actually came here twice on my birthday weekend. Usually I come on Thursdays- no cover, free coat check, 90s/early 00s music all night long. The vibe here is just super chill. Plus, they have music videos playing on the big screen which is pretty cool. Highly recommended!
author: J K.

description:
Good music and good vibe. The place is a little small, but there's an upstairs area to help with that. 
Make sure to arrive before 11pm, as the line gets pretty long. Also, there's a line for the upstairs area that may not be worth it.
To top it off, the girlies also showed some strong talent too ;)

$10 cover
author: Andrew M.

description:
I've only gone there one time, and as chill as this place was I just don't think it's for me- thus the three stars. 

I'd give it four if I wasn't taking into account the kind of bar I prefer. The only true downer was the music- I love 90s music and all but it would've been nice to have some other stuff thrown in or better transitions or may be some remixes of the music.

Also- people weren't as friendly with me there as at most places and it just made me feel really left out, which I never feel at bars or clubs. It wouldve been fine if the people had been more friendly... 

The bar tenders are awesome and the drinks rocked.
author: Apryl S.

description:
My main issue with this place: Their signature cocktail, The Raven, just tastes bad!  The ingredients include light rum, tea, fig, and lime, and all I can say is that the drink could've been saved if they had used a more earthy and creamier spirit, perhaps bourbon, in place of the light rum, and if they had been a little less heavy-handed with the lime juice.  Instead it seemed like the flavors were fighting instead of harmonizing with each other.  Moreover, my drink was pretty weak.  $9 for a bad tasting, not even strong cocktail from a place that prides itself on being a cocktail bar?  No thanks.

My friend's drink was not bad but nothing special.  Made with Bulleit bourbon, Campari, and Cocchi Americano, it was a $9 glorified Negroni.  Unimpressed, we left Raven and ended the evening at City Beer Store down the block.

Yes, it's a nice space with an upstairs.  Yes, our bartenders were friendly.  But there is no excuse for subpar $9 cocktails.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Four stars for:
*90s to 00s hip hop, r&b, and pop on Friday and Saturday nights. No EDM/House. Thumbs up.
*None of that strict "for the grown and sexy" dress code so I don't have to worry about what to wear. I can just wear jeans and flats (or sneakers). People still dress up anyway, but you won't feel left out if you're not. Just don't wear shorts and flip flops.
*Even though it was crowded, we didn't have to wait too long to get drinks. Bartenders were efficient, and not rude. (Drinks still expensive, but that's expected in this area.)
*Free coat check

Things to note:
-Predominantly mid 20s-30s Asian crowd. Thought it was because I went during Lunar New Year and all the Asians were out celebrating, but the second time I went, it was still pretty much the same crowd. More of a mixed crowd earlier in the night though.
-Small, sticky dance floor. Dance floor gets crowded, people get drunk, drunk people spill drinks on you. Hence, why I don't like dressing up to go out. I'd say this is a bar/lounge with a dance floor. It is not primarily a dance club.
-Although my friend got in free at 9:59, they made the rest of us pay $10 cover when the clock struck 10! No mercy. Be on time, or be on the guest list. At least the bouncers were nice.

Would I come back? Sure. But only if I don't have to pay cover. ;)
author: Zell C.

description: Attended a birthday party - love the 90's old skool music.  Crowd was good too.  Drinks were good and the service was quick.  Love that this place has two dance floors - enough room to dance!
author: Lyn D.

description: Very nice atmosphere when we stopped by for a drink during Christmas, would defiantly recommend it =)
author: Cecilia L.

description:
90's music?! I. LOVE. IT. Okay, so yeah they play the songs to completion. I'm not sure if they have a DJ, but still! I had a good time. It was like a flashback to the past with all of those older Usher songs. They even played a lot of music videos on the TV screens! 

By the way, I just love dancing to hip hop in general so this place won me over on that one alone! It was just a plus that it was 90s hip hop. 

The place itself was somewhat small and it felt really crowded. There are two floors with 3 separate bars. There was one part that was closed for a private party downstairs. The main dance floor area was on the second floor so we mostly stayed up there. 

The bartenders were great too! They work fast and got us our drinks. The prices are pretty standard. 

I would definitely come back again!
author: Connie Y.

description:
I've only been to this bar once but I loved it. The drinks were reasonably priced, not to mention the shot glasses were huge. Loved the music, they played a lot of 90's which is my favorite era. I will definitely go back to this place. It's not too large, it's more on the small and intimate side. 

There are two levels and full stocked bars with tv screens all over the place. Oh I forgot to mention the Ryan Gosling look a-like bartender. (grinning from ear to ear as I recall this night) LOL
author: Alex U.

description:
Great bar with a good vibe, nice range of drinks and goldfish at the end of the night (which I apologise for throwing handfuls of at my "friend" in a drunken rage). Staff were friendly and I had an awesome time dancing to some classic hip hop/pop tunes.

Free wifi was an added bonus!
author: Guida B.

description: Found out about this place on Yelp. My friend and I decided to each reserve a booth and order bottle service. Not worth the cost! The server barely came to the tables to see if anyone needed anything or to order drinks. We went to the bars ourselves. The place is just too small! The dance floor has people just standing around and the whole set up is ridiculous. There should be a way for people to walk to the other side without having to walk through the dance floor that is already packed with people "trying" to dance and people who are just standing there smh. DJ was just ok. Playlist could be better.
author: Lilian L.

description:
That's so Raven - it's totally Fresh! Yes, on Thursday nights, the Raven Bar has 90s Night. And I came here on a Thursday night!

Sadly, foolishly, I stayed downstairs, supping on a five-dollar OJ. I don't know much about US bar prices, but that seemed a little on the steep side to me...

Anyway, to business. It was about 7pm when a clutch of Yelpfolk about 12 strong descended upon the Raven Bar to enthuse and amuse. The bar staff were really cool about the sudden influx and there was plenty of space at the bar for us to sit occupy. I actually sat on a bar stool and talked to strangers, which was awesome. I love America.

The bar itself is really nice - the bottles at the back are nicely lit and arranged, and it was good fun to watch cocktails being prepared skilfully. The bar stool was extremely comfortable - I was there for a good couple of hours without fidgeting, which is quite something for me, and the back room, which I didn't really enter, seemed at once spacious and cosy - quite an achievement. I do wish I'd seen upstairs as the photos on the website look wonderful.

The toilets leave a little to be desired - a bit poky and rickety - but overall this is a really nice bar that I hope to return to next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Cressida F.

description:
HOT Bartender. Looked like Ryan Gosling.

Good drinks. Old music videos. 

Really enjoyed it. Must go back.
author: Nina Y.

description: Hannah is provided exactly what she promised. Some bouncers were about to kick out a prospectively drunk birthday girl while simultaneously dealing with rude females who had ordered drinks and Hannah dealed with this in a swift and decisive manner delivering exactly what she had promised which was to deliver a good time to a birthday party  while maintaining the integrity of a reservation and I hugely appreciate her for her hospitality and truthfulness
author: JP E.

description: This club is an absolute joke. There is a complete lack of respect from personnel AND the manager and they make assumptions about you and your life without even knowing you. They treat their guests like shit and feel like they are above them. Putting your coat away is like waiting at the post office, you literally have to get a waiting number and wait for 45 minutes. Closes at 1, they hold up the line for no reason, and don't let you back in after you go outside for even 1 min (even if it's your birthday because "it's a lot of people's birthday" nor if your coat and all your friends are still inside). Do yourself a favor and DONT EVER GO TO THIS RIDICULOUS PLACE.
author: Rens V.

description:
Raven Bar... what can I say... two words. AWESOME BARTENDERS!!! Ever so attentive, fun and friendly... I feel like they just take ONE look at you and know EXACTLY what you want...go look for JULIEN, the bartender extraordinaire!  He will make you laugh, bail you out of situations, but best of all, make you super happily buzzed with his amazing concoctions!

Ok lots more words than just two... my friend introduce me to this place and have been back a couple times.  One of which I remember, the other not so much... BUT what do remember every time is that I have a BLAST.  Very cute unique bar/lounge/club that's not ghetto and the crowd is just right.  Best of all, the drinks are unique and amazing (the ones I remember at least).  Very chill on the weekdays, and fun dancing on the weekends.  Even though I DO like the edm scene, its nice to bring it back to the hip hop days where everyone can actually sing along to some of the songs.  Upstairs is where most of the dancing is and if i remember correctly there are two big screens with videos!! 

I'd definitely come back again! Oh and did I say.. AWESOME bartenders? run, don't walk, to this bar if you are looking for a fun night out!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
My boyfriend and I went there with a group of friends. The place didn't seem bad initially. There are two rooms and two bars downstairs and a dance floor and third bar upstairs. The bartenders were all attentive and good at mixing. There's even a free coat check upstairs. 

Throughout the night, my boyfriend and I would go downstairs to smoke on the patio or use the bathroom, and then head back up. However, the last time we went down, we were headed to the stairs and a bouncer was blocking the way, saying we couldn't go back up. I tried reasoning with him, telling him we've been up there all night, our friends are there, we had a tab open upstairs, and our coats were up there too-- I even showed him the coat check slip. His answer: "No wristband, no dancing." I don't even know what wristbands he was referring too, since no one else was wearing one and we were up there for hours and never offered one. Throughout the whole conversation, he was incredibly rude and completely unreasonable. He told me I should have planned better and stayed upstairs "cause there's no way you're getting back up." 

At that point, my bf and I decided we wanted to leave, so I told the bouncer that we needed to go up to get our coats. He wasn't even going to let us up for that. First, he said that he would get them so that I don't go upstairs. I said no to that--I didn't want him touching my things. So then he said that only I could go upstairs, even though my boyfriend also had his own coat check receipt. After arguing for a bit, I realized it was a losing battle, so I left bf and went up to get the coats. I also noticed another bouncer following me, presumably to make sure I wasn't infiltrating anywhere. When I got back downstairs, I realized I forgot to close the tab upstairs (oops!), so I had to go back and negotiate again with d-bag to go back upstairs for my credit card. He (again) didn't want to let me go upstairs and started to radio someone with his earpiece. Although at that point I think he was also completely over me wrecking his day cause he just stopped radioing, sighed, and stepped aside to let me go up for the last time. lol

Terrible experience and I will never go back.
author: S. C.

description:
I was at this place last night, and is great! The bartender was great, the music was awesome, and they have a patio!!! Yay! I will be back again for sure!:)
Reading the review about stolen items, I recall seeing signs all around promoting free coat/cell phone Check, I love to go bar hopping every weekend around the city and it happens in almost all of them, and some not even have a coat check or security staff ;)
I was at a wine bar in Hayes valley last month and this weird looking lady was distracting the staff while her boyfriend was stealing purses :( so...is all over the city, keep your stuff safe!!! Is your responsibility not others.
Anyway, I can't believe this place has being there over 5 years and I just found it yesterday, the food next door is ...ok but I wasn't there for food, drinks and ambiance was cool.
author: Betty A.

description:
They play mostly 90's music but they also throw in some top 20 here and there. So, it's a good mix of music. They have a unique drink list and can tailor your drink the way you like it. Bartenders here put a lot of effort into your cocktail, it's not a typical well- drink-make your drink in 5 seconds- type of place. I agree with another reviewer that one of the bartenders looks like Ryan Gosling! 

If you sign up for the guest list, it's free before 11pm. It is two stories. It's a place you can hang out by the bar casually or go to the dance floor. So ladies can dress however they want to get in (casual or dressed up!).
author: Ann P.

description:
This place is great. 

Spacey enough, good drinks, good bartenders, good MUSIC. Love the 90's feel and that big projector up stairs. Bathrooms aren't an issue here too. There are like 3 restrooms (one public and two private). I would def recommend this joint to anyone.
author: Thi N.

description:
If you haven't already heard of or danced at Raven Bar (though I always call it Raven Lounge because it just has that great sort of atmosphere), then you should hop to it! 

I absolutely love the service, drinks, and music here! I first discovered Raven for my birthday back in February, and getting a response to reserve a table was fast and helpful. David was really flexible and helpful in suggesting the type of space to reserve (booths versus tables) based on the range in guests I was expecting. Jeff and Cherine were the awesome bartenders that night, and mixed up some great cocktails.

Fast forward a couple of months to May, and I was able to call in a few hours beforehand and reserve a table for my graduation celebration (they were able to fit us in earlier in the night before another reservation kicked in). 

I've taken mixed groups of all personalities (pretty reserved to party animals) and ages (college peers to folks in their 30s), and everyone has found something for them. I think it helped that we went on friday nights, when they have their 90s - present music video hits playing, which provides a variety that anyone can shake their groove thang to.
author: Jess K.

description:
Club Raven is one of the hottest bar/clubs in the Bay Area.. with the friendliest staff!

I threw a Birthday Party for my Coworker Jesica last month and i was pretty stressed about the situation because it was soo last minute!

Lisah was so helpful and put my mind at ease about the table booking. she set me up with a table and informed me about the different bottle services they offer. this took a load off my shoulders! i told her what i wanted to plan and she got right to it. convenience!!I LALALALA--OOOOVEEEE IITT! 

the night we got there for Jesica's birthday party there was a nice banner set up saying "Happy Birthday" across the back wall where we sat. I was surprised! i didn't expect them to go the extra mile and help me get decorations too! 

the waitress was super nice although at the moment i couldn't really catch her name because of the awesome music in the background. she came back multiple times to make sure we were doing fine which, through experience at other bars/clubs, we don't usually get.

i highly recommend Raven for your weekend nights out! It's the new Hype in SF! 

Don't miss out. You would probably regret it!!!!
author: Crystal L.

description: I had a heart to give this bar a chance again (after the unfair misunderstanding they had with my bf a long time ago AND after a staff member spilled a drink on me and I got kicked out right after). I got there literally at 1:02 a.m.. And the bouncer said they don't let people in after 1am. Which is understandable..but you're really going to make a little girl with an ankle wrap stand outside by herself?! All my friends were in there and I was late because I was at a family party. So much for closing at 2am! They were allowing ppl with stamps to go back in..all except my boyfriend who came out to check on me. In my opinion, they don't really have an organized system going on outside the bar. I tried to give Raven another chance, but I guess not. If you're sober and trying to enter the bar after 1am, don't! You'll start to notice all the unfair systems they got going on outside the bar... disappointing
author: Bel O.

description:
This place is a gem!

Two stories, no cover till 11pm, 90's hip hop and old school blaring, cute bartenders, good crowd of people. I love it here! I'll be coming back here more often : )
author: Coco T.

description:
Coooooocktaaaaaaaiiiiilsssss!

I love cocktails. I would start every morning and end every night with a fruity concoction; I would hook up an IV of St. Germain to my veins 24/7 and I would hire mixologists for every party I threw if it weren't so expensive and unhealthy and likely to kill me. I believe you can find nirvana at the bottom of a martini glass, so for me, a cocktail bar is church.

Raven Bar is an above-average church with a charismatic pastor. And by that I mean the bartender we had was fast, attentive, generous, talented and extremely friendly. The drinks are ambitious but not quite in that Tier 1 of Cocktails I have for mindblowingly original, unique creations.

Between the two of us, my friend and I tried the Melissa's Peachy Lychee, Max's Herbal Remedy and The Raven. Max's was definitely my favorite. It featured fresh basil (sprigs of the herb were literally right in front of me) mixed with sour and sweetness for a heavenly aroma that fills your senses. It was so good, my friend ordered it again. The Peachy Lychee was very fruity and very sweet, but missing that extra kick. I think it might have been because the lychees came from a can and anyone who's eaten lots of fresh lychees can taste the difference The namesake cocktail had a really interesting combination of ingredients, but unfortunately, most of it was lost to the overwhelming flavor of the rum (particularly the cinnamon zest).

I agree with other reviewers' complaints about the space. Raven Bar has a long, narrow layout so it feels suffocating no matter where you are. Personally, I'd recommend sitting at the bar unless you really need privacy. That said, the interior is quite dark and romantic, with strategically-placed lighting creating a delicious medley of shadows into which you can disappear if you should so choose. I'd definitely recommend it as a post-dinner destination, particularly if you're on a date.
author: Josephine L.

description:
This review is long overdue...been to Raven more times in the last month than I care to admit, haha.  Love it here on a Friday night - no cover.  Saturday there's a cover of $10, so if you know you're gonna hit up this spot get yourself on the guest list.  Music is always fun without excessive EDM, and my friends and I always have a blast dancing here.

I'll echo the sentiments of other reviewers - the bartenders are awesome here.  I've become a sucker for craft cocktails and they do it right.  Even on really busy nights they keep their focus and are attentive.  And it's true...they aren't bad to look at either ;).
author: Pam S.

description:
Alright, not going to lie... this review is a little bias. Not because I know the owner or anyone that works here, but because service got a little personal. 

It was a bachelorette party with a group of 10 girls. Our host sat us upstairs in the back couches and right next to the bar. Our waitress brought us our 2 bottles, we made a couple of drinks, and headed to the dance floor. They started with 90s hip hop and R&B, which was perfect because that's what we grew up listening to. Once the music changed, we went back to our seats. But that's when the party really started. Want to know? This lady is keeping hush hush. 

All the bartenders were REALLY attentive. Probably also because it was a bachelorette party, there were 10 of us, and we were all wearing extremely short skirts with really high heels. Special shout out to Julian for the love and making this group of ladies feel special. Also, special thanks to David for helping us organize the event, treating us with such great hospitality, and especially for the special treat.
author: Lily C.

description:
I'm a little undecided on how I feel about Raven.
On one note, they are not really a club but on another note, they are not really just a bar.

There are two dance floors, upstairs and downstairs.
Downstairs has a couple of booths for the people purchasing bottle service, there is also a back area, which can be reserved for parties  and the upstairs is all dance floor, a bar and coat check.

Music is good enough. They do cater to people in their mid-late twenties' (Kris Kross, Salt n Pepa, etc.), also a selection of top 40's. People are dressed relatively casually in normal bar clothes but the vibe is a little club-ish.

Ordering drinks: I was at the front bar and my drinks came out perfect, nice and strong. At the back bar, my mai tai came out yellow... It also tasted disgusting.

Mm, I wouldn't say no if my friends wanted to go but I'm not in any particular rush to get back to it.
author: Winè C.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night for my boyfriend's company event, so I have to say that I didn't have to pay for anything and can't speak on the value of the drinks, BUT I thought the offerings at the bar were all really unique concoctions you probably can't find anywhere else!

My favorite drinks were the Lychee Bliss and the Apple Poe. Even while they were making the Apple Poe, I couldn't wait to try the drink because I could smell the cinnamon in the air. It's so tasty! I also drank the Lychee Bliss prettyyyy quickly because it was so good and fruity. 

Another thing I really love about the place is the music downstairs (where we had an area sectioned off). I feel like a lot of bars these days play electronic or house music but it's so much more fun to dance to Top 40 or hip hop/R&B (as cliche as that may be). Raven played a good mix of all the above and I had a great time! 

When we left, it was already after 11pm (we already drank during dinner so we didn't stay too long at the bar) but the line was already really long outside! I would advise coming early because when we left the bar, it was already pretty crowded inside as well.
author: Jenny M.

description:
I feel like this is the second coming of the old Sloane, when it was good.  90's throwback mix of pop and rap make this joint a place to check out on Saturday.  Despite waiting in line for about 20 minutes, I still had fun.  It's really dark in there and the place was packed, probably against fire regulation (lol) but hey they want their money.  The drinks are relatively priced for a club ($7).
2 floors but all the action is upstairs unless you're tryin to chill.  The place however does lack bathrooms and you're bound to wait in a line.  Other than that, I wouldn't mind coming back here.  Please don't get played out!

P.S.: This place is Asia central.
author: Alex G.

description: Wasn't really impressed. Expected more from the ratings. The music was great but the workers was a different story. The big white guy bouncer was totally rude. And the bartender in the back was as well. Kinda small as well expected a little more.
author: Alexis S.

description:
Celebrated my birthday there this past weekend and as much fun as I had, there are a few reasons why I wouldn't give this place 5 stars:

1. No in and out privileges. Not entirely sure why but I couldn't even put my gifts in the car which was parked 10 feet away. A friend of mine just went outside to make a phone call and she couldn't come back in, even though she was standing at the door and had a stamp.
2. Luckily I got there early enough to not pay a cover or wait in line but my party got stuck in line and even though I was promised a certain amount of my guests would get in for free but security wouldn't let them in. Apparently the line outside didn't even move and not sure why they weren't letting anymore guests in. Didn't feel as if the place was at capacity.
3. Only one bathroom stall downstairs for the ladies even though the men has two! No need to say more, I'm sure you can imagine the line and wait.

The music was nice and we had fun but it could have been better if my entire party was allowed to celebrate with me.

Oh, and if you want reservations, please do it at least a week in advance!
author: Eilynn H.

description:
Saturday night. 10pm.  Parking can be challenging but we're in San Francisco so that's expected.  (Do be careful of where you park there and not leave valuables in the car as my friend got her car broken into that night.  Just a warning.)

There's a front bar, then a middle room with tables and bottle service and a dance floor.  You can reserve a table for free but make sure you reserve ahead of time cuz I wasn't able to get one =(  Anyways, there's a small back bar and then stairs to go upstairs where there's another bar and a dance floor.  There was 1 bottle service area up there too.

The music is the same both upstairs and downstairs.  They show the music videos on flat screens.  The music was 90's...it brought me back!! Not bad.  The dance floor smelled like B.O. though so I hung around the bar.  The bartenders are all suuuuuper nice!  I think a shot of patron is $10.  

There's a single bathroom upstairs and downstairs. 
No cover.
Coat check $2.
There wasn't a line at the door when I came in.
Gets a little crowded but not uncomfortable...I wasn't sweating.
Cool crowd...good vibes.
author: Angelica T.

description: One of my favorites! I went there for my friend's birthday and for mines too. Security guards and bartenders are super friendly. I love the environment, a lot of people my age (early 20s). I highly recommend this place (:
author: Maritza S.

description: A little overrated or maybe because it's been too hyped up.  Came here on a Saturday night and had to wait in line for about 5 minutes.  the line moved pretty quick, but most of the people are upstairs which means another line.  Downstairs, there are 2 bars and tables, but not much else going on.  Once you get upstairs after about a 5-10 minute wait, there is a small dance floor with another bar.  This is a cool spot if it is not to crowded, but it has recently been the go to spot on weekends.  Not worth the hassle if you're just trying to have a chill worry-free night.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I really enjoyed this little joint.  We are big fans of the place next door, but hadn't made it in to Raven Bar until this past Friday night.  A friend was in town and having a small event here.  

First of all, props on the soundtrack.  I really was brought right up out of my quarter-life crisis by the sweet tunes of my youth with music videos to match.  Remember when Mariah Carey's video for "Honey" was like, the biggest deal ever and lived at #1 on TRL for weeks.  Me, too.  So does Raven Bar. 

Second, the cocktails are delicious.  We sipped mostly on the Raven (a rum based drink with lots of bitters and fresh grated cinnamon) and the Anchors Away (a beer cocktail built on Anchor Steam).  The bartenders were quick and friendly, even when it got packed later in the evening.  

I like the distinct feel of each of the areas of the venue, with the three different bars each having their own vibe.  There were plenty of places to take a seat, but a pretty disappointing lack of restrooms, so ladies beware. 

Bottom line: I think I'll be putting Raven Bar in my regular lineup.
author: Kellie T.

description:
This bar is a must hit for Friday night fun. Caught somewhere between bar and club, you have as much of a change of dancing the night away as catching a good convo in the couches downstairs. 
Each time I've been the music has been 90s to current hip hop which almost seems to go over the heads of the barely 21 attendees. 
Go before 11 and skip the door price.
author: Natalia V.

description:
Was here this past Saturday night.

Getting in was effortless, there are two entrances at the front and you can either enter to the first floor or make your way over directly to the second floor. There are also stairs inside the building by the back bar that lead you from the first floor to the second. 

The bartenders were all PHENOMENAL. Great service and super friendly. They even offered us water when they figured we needed some. It's great to see bartenders take care of their patrons, it's in everyone's best interest really. 

The music was PERFECT. Hip hop/top 40s. There is a dance floor on the second floor that was the perfect size. 

The people were chill and everyone seemed to be on the same page: grab a drink, dance, enjoy the night. 

The only not so great thing is that I only saw one bathroom upstairs, not sure if downstairs has one and its unisex. Which means everyone piles up if there's a long wait. 

Next time I'd love to try some of their signature drinks.
author: xochi i.

description: I was just here last night for my birthday celebration and it was the BOMB. They played 90's music up until today's music and it was so fun. My friends and I got there before 10pm so we got in for free. After 10pm, it's a $10 which is not bad at all. The bartenders are super nice and I'm assuming that downstairs is where the reserved area is and the upstairs is basically just the dance floor and the bar. There is a bar downstairs too. There is only one restroom for the ladies but it wasn't that bad of a wait. The only problem I had with it is that I guess after a certain time you would have to pay to get to the upstairs area...? I'm not sure what that was about. I stayed upstairs the whole time but my friends went downstairs to explore and were not allowed back up unless they paid. But anyway. THE MUSIC WAS AWESOME AND I AM TOTALLY GOING BACK.
author: Mai C.

description:
Came to Raven last Saturday for a friend's birthday and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I was pretty hesitant to come cause I was sick and bars/clubs really aren't my scene in the first place, but a friend convinced me to go even if it was only for an hour since there was no cover.

We got there about 11pm and surprisingly there was no line so we were able to walk straight upstairs. You would think that them not having a line at a peak hour shows that they're not that great but how wrong you would be. We were able to walk straight upstairs and got to the bar right away. The bartenders upstairs were really cool, super friendly and they move quick.

What really endeared me to this place though was the music. Instead of playing the typical top 40s, they would play a bunch of music from the 90s and 2000s with a few more recent hits in there. Also the fact that they had the music videos for all the songs playing on a bunch of tvs and even projected on the wall of one of the sides of the upstairs dance floor.

They also had a small area setup on the first floor where my friend was able to do the whole birthday cake and song thing. Only downfall is that it's right in the middle of the 1st floor where everyone needs to walk past if they wanna go beyond the 1st bar, so I felt like we were in the way of so many people. 

They also have a large smoking patio which was cool as I was able to sit outside and catch up with a friend I hadn't seen in years but because it was so large I wasn't surrounding in 2nd hand smoke with was great for me as a nonsmoker. One thing that did suck though was the fact that the upstairs only had 1 bathroom so there was a line for the men's and woman's. I saw a few people watching all the music videos while waiting and getting distracted so they didn't notice the previous person walk out so a few times people would just swoop and cut in there before they noticed.

Overall I definitely wouldn't mind coming here again if my friends wanna go out in the city. Parking wasn't terrible to find, only parked about 2 blocks away.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Wouldn't let two of our 40 friends in our party in because they were wearing 90s themed jerseys. First of all it's a 90s bar, nowhere on the dress code does it say no jersey... In fact the only thing it does specify (which is not in the website) is no hats and no white t's. Not only that but they have something that say "club attire preferred" not required.. Needless to say it was really uncool of them especially seeing as quite a few men inside were wearing T-shirts! Yes maybe they were a nice brand and v-neck but no collar. Seemed like a power trip. Won't be back b
author: Sammie W.

description:
Pros:

HOT bouncer! Looked mixed, curly hair, dimples.....and barely legal but he was the cutest thing I've seen in ages. 

HOT bartender. Also looked mixed, less ethnic, more Ryan Gosling-ish. So, sooo fine! 

Music and music videos were more of a pro than a con. 


Cons:

Crowd. Tacky, gross and annoying. That alone is enough for me to cut my losses and never return. Maybe cause it was a Friday night? Idk. I'd have to check it out on a slower night and update. 


Overall just meh.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Great cocktails, awesome music selection, two spaces for dancing; Raven is an awesome place for a chill night out on the town!

Go early though, cover after 11p.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
They have super cool laser lights upstairs at their Club Raven! It looks like a laser maze and it's very mesmerizing. @__@

The music plays the same whether you're upstairs at the club or downstairs at the bar. Only difference is that they have a dance floor upstairs. The night I went, the DJ was playing a lot of old school hip hop along with its music videos. It sure brought back some memories.

Drinks/Shots are decently priced at about $7 depending what kind of liquor you're getting. And of course, the high-end brands will be a tad more.

I went on a Friday night and you can say it was DEAD if our group wasn't there. You can look on the brighter side in which you don't have to wait a long time to flag down a bartender to order drinks, and it is very spacious for you to get your groove on!
author: Nancy N.

description:
This was the dancing stop on my friend's 21st birthday.  From the website, we were thinking it would be more speakeasy than it actually was.  

The place has multiple floors and more dancing on the second floor than the first.  I liked that they had a coat check, because being in SF, you're going to need a coat at some point, but it was way too hot in there for one.  The music was great.  The bartenders were so cool and friendly.  Towards the end of the night, one of them came over and danced with us.

It was kind of funny, because my friends were some of the only non-Asians in that entire place.  But we were having so much fun that by the end of the night, we didn't even care.  And maybe it was only that night, I don't know.  Just an observation.

With that said, one of the funnest dance clubs.  If I were in this part of SF again, I'll definitely go here to dance!
author: Liliana P.

description:
Love 90s night at Raven Bar! Came on a Saturday night for a birthday when it was 90s night. The music totally made me miss that decade! Drinks were yummy and came at a good price with good service - friendly and fast. The bartender made us his specialty drink on the house. It was a citrus drink with mint or possibly basil in it. Bartenders were pretty cute, too. ;) I tried another cocktail, the Castaway, I think, and liked that, too.

The venue has two floors. Downstairs: The bar is in the front and there's an open space for dancing/lounging in the back by the staircase. Upstairs: You'll find the dance floor, which gets quite crowded, in the front and the bar in the back. If you need to get some air, step outside to the side patio (on the first floor).

Come by 10:30 PM on Saturday night if any parties are going on; otherwise, prepare to wait. There were 5 parties the night I was there and friends said that 70 people were in line. Yikes. I'm not sure what the Friday night line situation is. I hear 90's night on Thursday rarely has a line, though, so you could always get your 90s fix then!
author: Carol L.

description: Super fun place to get your drink and dance on. I suggest getting there relatively early so you can get upstairs because once it gets crowded, they block it off and once you leave, you have to wait in line to get back in. No thanks! The only reason to go downstairs, though, would be the much talked about Ryan Gosling look-alike bartender. Super nice, would've been fun to chat by the bar and get some drinks. Next time!
author: Kathy L.

description:
Another stop on the happy hour tour, Raven's cocktail menu skewed on the sweet side of things for my tastes, but the drinks we sampled weren't bad. The Vampire Slayer with Bulleit Rye, citrus, bitters and "cherry-orange flavors" was heavy on the last ingredient, but not totally out of balance. Similarly, the Anchors Away had a bit too much cherry flavor for more than one, but $1 off the signature cocktails was enough for us to look something else to try. 

Unfortunately, the bartender got wrapped up in a conversation with another patron, so despite having 25 minutes before needing to leave for dinner (and despite indicating we were interested in another round), we had to eventually just ask for the tab and go. I'd hate to see what happens to service when the place gets more than 3 customers in it.
author: Emily G.

description: I had a birthday party here on Saturday. The manager Daniel really took care of me. They gave me a crown and put up a happy birthday banner. The waitresses were attentive and not to mention they played the best music. Highly recommend
author: Stephanie Q.

description:
This place is AWESOME! Many clubs is in the city is usually a non friendly environment and expensive for cover. Cover here is only $10!! That's half of temple, grand and even city nights!! Drinks  are about $2 cheaper than other bars!! Friendly fast past staff who's constantly smiling. The venue is very chill. They have a huge monitor upstairs on the dance floor. Although, the dance floor may be a little small but hey, a dance floor is a dance floor right?! 
Back to the cover charge. They have a guest list option and when you get there b4 11 and is waiting in line tip 11:30 they will still let you in under guest list entry w/ no charge. Many clubs will close the guest list regardless if your arrival is upon 11. Not here! Not Raven!! And what makes it a super bonus is the Drop dead Hot friendly Window girl who works the guestlist. Many times, you assume or encounter stuck up females at the window.. But not here! That's alone is an automatic 5 stars!
author: Martin L.

description:
Apparently this is the new hot spot. 

There are two small dance floors upstairs and downstairs. One bigger bar upstairs and two medium size bars downstairs. Music is usually Top 40's, some EDM, but don't depend on it. I don't think it is a live DJ because I don't see him/her. Mostly music videos. Very casual, no cover on a friday night. I would come here in jeans and enjoy a couple drinks with some friends. 

Crowd really depends, I came here for two birthdays. Since it was a fairly small bar, most of my friends occupied the whole bottom floor. 

Bartenders here are extremely good looking :)
author: Phuong V.

description:
Really enjoyed this place!  We got there early maybe 9:35 on a Saturday, so we missed the line and missed the $10 cover.  

The bartenders were very nice, i asked if they could make a mojito, since it was still super chill at the lower bar.  Then around 10:30 it started to get really busy, we moved upstairs and it was like packed sardines, barely able to move. But super fun with the 90's music! I did like the music, its a nice change from EDM music.  

Drinks aren't too expensive, and there always seemed to be a path to the bar (upstairs).  I think their popular bartender (looks like Ryan Gosseling from the side) was downstairs, it was way too hard to get a drink downstairs.  

Super fun! Glad we decided to come to this bar.
author: Kristin I.

description:
Pricing: Good. Standard $10 cover for this area of SF.
Quality: Good-Excellent. Fit for someone from the 90s~ Ample space over two floors.
Turnaround: Good-Excellent. No line!
Service: N/A. Unless you count the security greeting us.

I usually try to get on the guest list so that I do not need to pay cover, but this was a spur of the moment thing so I came unannounced, but for $10, no biggie. The place is two stories with a bar on both levels and tables places throughout with actual rooms in the back. Not high-class, but not the dive-bar kind of feel either. The front is actually made to feel a little classier in my opinion. They were playing 90s music the Friday night I went so the nostalgia I felt probably made me like this place even more. Not to mention, given the space spread over two floors, I had ample room to dance without bumping into people or others spilling their drinks on me. Unfortunately, the area around the bar is narrow and always crowded so moving THROUGH the club poses a problem. When we came, there was no line and we were admitted in practically no time at all. Drinks were also made quickly with no delay so overall I definitely had a fun time here.
author: Jenny W.

description: I celebrated my birthday last weekend, and we had such an amazing time. This was our third time there, and this time we reserved a table to celebrate with my group. I absolutely love Raven because they have delicious drinks, the best mix of music, and great staff that provided such helpful and prompt communication to plan my event. Their website and guest list are easier to navigate than any place I've seen before. Their team showed great hospitality! I had a wonderful birthday. One of the best in a while and all the attention to detail that they gave to me and my guests and others celebrating parties really added to my experience!
author: Mariana C.

description:
I was responsible for putting together a holiday party for the office and decided to go with Raven Bar.  Working with David was awesome!  He responded to all my emails very promptly and went above and beyond to ensure everything ran smoothly!  We reserved the back bar for our party with David as our designated bartender for the night.  He also put up signs with our company logo without me even having to ask! 

Our company had the greatest time and they all were so happy with the venue and the helpfulness of the staff at Raven Bar.  Everyone said they loved our holiday party this year much better than our last one.  Whew!  Thanks David!  Vince and Jonathan were also a great help as well.  Thanks to both of you also.

Good things to know about Raven Bar:

-Bottle service and bar limits not required for booking tables, etc.
-Staff is super friendly and cater to your needs and requests
-Food can be ordered from Triptych (the restaurant next door)
-Weds-Thurs nights - house music, Fri-Sat nights - hip hop 
-Great specialty drinks - Switchblade is my go to - cilantro, lime, honey and jalapeno with tequila!  They always make it extra spicy for me!
-Bar in the front and back on the main floor, bar and dance floor upstairs

Thanks again to David, Vince, Jonathan and all the staff at Raven Bar.  Your bar is a hidden gem and I'm glad I found you.  

This is my new go to spot for happy hour and dancing!  :)
author: Ratany L.

description:
Venue:- easy to find, accessible from market & 8th st.
Staff:- professional, diligent and friendly
Music:- super...go DJ! Couldn't stop shaking my sexybody.
Drinks:- alright, bartenders are awesome and charming. But c'mon $9 for a shot of jagger WTH. Be realistic!
Restroom:- way better than many filthy ones in this city.
Crowd:- BIG PROBLEM :( hence the 2stars. No diversity whatsoever, just one specific race. Might as well make it their club.

Try and make it diverse by attracting all races.
author: DeesQue N.

description:
I had a great night at Raven's Bar! Really cool place. Things that sold me about this place:
         -Easy street parking
         -Free cover before 11p
         -Hip-hop Friday nights
         -DANCING
         -3 Bars for drinking
         -2 Floors for dancing
         -Not your everyday, EDM, obnoxiously over crowded club

Went here on a Friday night. Online you can sign up on their guest list and there's no cover if you get in before 11pm. 

The night started out when I touched down at SFO around 10pm. Clay picked me up from the airport and we took the 15min drive over to Raven's Bar. The area isn't filled with a bunch of clubs and is very low key, which was nice - it made parking extremely easy and we only had to walk 2 short blocks to the bar. The outside isn't much, small and quaint. Inside is small and tight at first but it opens up as you walk further in. I believe I counted a total of 3 bars. One when you first walk in, one in the back and one upstairs. This place is like a dive-lounge, it's an interesting feel. There looked like there was a small dance space downstairs, but we wanted to check out upstairs more. There's a long bar and then a small dance floor to the side covered by large tv's. They were playing music video's that matched up with the rad Hip-Hop that was bumpin' all night (totally fun & cool). The DJ was great! Good mix of old school and new school Hip-Hop, great dancin' music!

Bartenders were great! I was always able to grab a drink. All cocktails were about $10-11 a piece. All my drinks were strong and doing everything they were supposed to. The dance floor became really crowded, but it was an awesome crowd. I danced the whole night away with my man! And loved every minute of it! They had great music, lights and smoke at our feet. Which if you're going to fog the room, I like it at your feet vs.up in your air. 

This may be my new favorite dancing spot in the city. It's fun, but low key at the same time. It makes it easy to disappear and go out dancing for the night without it becoming too big a deal. I would definitely recommend the Raven to anyone looking for a fun night out.
author: Jordan G.

description:
I was here last night and, yes, you did miss your chance to rub up against me ...

(I just felt a great disturbance in the force; as if millions of women just sighed in relief and were suddenly elated. I fear something terrible has happened to my mojo).

A rather large group of us commandeered the entire back bar for a friend's B-Day Bash and that was pretty awesome. We were so thick back there that others attempting to use the bar really had to work for it.

The whole place was packed. The dance floors upstairs and down were really jumping; but they are a bit on the small side (which is why my awkward white butt stayed off it... Think "Elaine" from Seinfeld, but more spastically jerky, less rhythm, and none of her classy moves).

The two bartenders at OUR bar were really hustling and I was impressed with how fast they were shaking/pouring because there really were a lot of us and they kept up pretty well under the pressure. The prices were really reasonable and the tab at the end was much better than expected; so that just made the night even better.

The music was a pretty decent mix (which should tell you nothing because I can't dance, so what the hell do I know, right?) with a range of house and 80's on up. And, this will seem really weird, but it seemed as though the music got better and better as we drank more and more; I think the drinks might be magic...

... come to think of it, everyone got better and better looking at the same rate - OMG, the drinks ARE magic! ...

I recommend - Go check 'em out.
author: Christopher J.

description:
If it wasn't for my host, Dzu, I would not have put 4 stars.

The bar has a nice, low-key atmosphere and the crowd is friendly and laid-back.

There are no in-and-out privileges. It doesn't make sense to reserve a table and order bottle service ($350/bottle) but your guests can't come in because the line is being held to make it seem like it's poppin' (it wasn't).

If it wasn't for my host who was extremely attentive and helpful, I would not recommend this bar for parties/bottle service unless your party is already with you.
author: Pepe Le P.

description:
Eh, they're supposed to play "90's/old school hip hop" here but I felt like it was more 2000's/music from my high school dances.

The dance floor is a bit small and when I went, not too many people were dancing. The crowd was also very homogenous :\. The music videos projected on the screens were always fun to watch, as is the sign, "Raven loves you so much, so there's free Coat Check" plastered everywhere the bar.

Drinks were ok, nothing too spectacular.
author: Christina C.

description: Long lines galore (for entrance, bathroom, drinks, 2nd floor), small space, uptight staff,
author: Chris E.

description: DJ played a good mix of music. Cover charge is about $10. Not a lot of seating as it is more of a dance bar.
author: Mia X.

description:
I just threw a party here and the people at Raven Bar were amazing. Everyone was easy-going, nice, and super accommodating.  Everything from the get-go was perfect.  They even put up cute Happy Bday signage for the party.

The upstairs area is the perfect place to host a private party.  The bartenders were cool and Raven provided me with my own Video DJ.  That's right I said video DJ.  I sent Raven a list of songs for my party -- they played everything on my list and improvised perfectly within the same genre.  My friends had a blast and we all danced our asses off.  Thank you Raven Bar for being AWESOME.

Special love to Vince, Jonathan, and our awesome video DJ Mark.  Thanks for making my birthday party one to remember!
author: Tina T.

description:
I love this bar- the drinks, the laid-back but classier vibe, and of course- the bartenders!  

Usually, I visit on more low key weeknights because I just want a neighborhood bar where I can kick back with my friends and enjoy tasty drinks and banter with the bartenders (who are individually awesome people).  I also celebrated NYE here with a big gang of friends and enjoyed the dancefloor upstairs.  It was a blast!

I think I must have tried nearly every cocktail on the menu by now, but generally, I just let the awesome bartenders mix up whatever drink they can think up for me or are experimenting with.  

Overall, this place is for keeps!!!  Def recommend this bar for anyone looking for a place to hang out with friends in a chill, non-douchey atmosphere.  If you want to reserve a space for an event, this is also a great place - they don't charge a reservation fee!
author: Shmemerald N.

description:
A co-worker told me about this bar and we decided to host our holiday party here - it was great!  The drinks are insanely tasty, and David made sure that planning the party was a breeze.  He accommodated all our wishes, and then some.  

Josh, our designated bartender for the night, was awesome.  Working the second floor bar alone, he was a friendly efficient drink-making machine.  The prices were completely reasonable, and to have the whole second floor to ourselves (with our own bathrooms, bar, music-control, and dance floor) was fabulous.

Got our food from the next-door restaurant, Triptych, which worked out quite nicely.  A great pairing!
author: Danielle C.

description:
Awesome under the radar place! Great drinks, fabulous music! You can reserve a booth free!! Water jugs at the end of the bar! 
Did I mention 90s hip hop? Oh ya
author: Jen b.

description:
I was here with friends on their once-a-month gay night. My girls and I got to dance freely without any contact from creepers (aside from a pair of sweaty drunk boys that I didn't realize were not gay).. but a lot of the guys on the dance floor got some action going on. You don't need details regarding that, but it was liberating to have our own space! 

Love the layout of the bar, downstairs is lounge with two bar areas and some dance floor space, while upstairs is another dance floor with it's own bar. The music downstairs is a combo of top 40 + 90's (perfect!). The upstairs is more house music, but it's a lot more spacious for dancing. I spent most of my time upstairs until it got extremely hot  and the condensation fogged up the windows-- then I went downstairs and requested a song.. and the DJ played it 3x IN A ROW (prob to kill me). Gangnam style danced for 10+ minutes. 

TRY THESE DRINKS: Fruity drink lovers, get the Liquid Marijuana (don't think it's on menu but seriously delish), the Apple poe (stronger on the alc), or Lychee Bliss.

Note: Not a fan of the Herbal Remedy drink.. it's taste is of Chinese herbal teas + basil. Quite bitter.

Overall, I really like this place-  lots of space for hanging out or dancing with your friends. Plus, very unique & creative drink menu and no minimum requirement for table reservations.
author: K. N.

description:
This place is fun, with great drinks (expensive, but it's a club, so, SHOCKER!), a fun dance floor, and friendly bartenders.  I'm pushing 30 so often the crowd is amusingly young to me, but when my fellow "old" friends and I want to just dance around like silly people to 90s music with delicious, caloric cocktails in hand, this place is our go-to. 

I know there's no EDM (a term I just learned because I am an OLD), but I love that it's pop and that they have their 90s nights because it's just FUN.  If you're not looking to impress anyone and just want to have a good time, head to Raven.  Only drawback is that it is expensive and sometimes you have to pay cover which is sort of silly given the lack of real DJs, but whatever, for the occasional night out it's fun.
author: Jackie O.

description:
I've been to Raven a few times now. First time for a birthday celebration, and more recently just to go out. This place is suitable for birthdays, as you can reserve a table in their lounge and get free admission. It has a little something for everyone. Bars in the front, back and upstairs. Lounge in the middle, and dance floor upstairs. Fun mix of music from 80s-now with music videos to match.

Downsides are the few bathrooms this place has... One M & one F bathroom downstairs, and 2 unisex bathrooms upstairs. The last time I came here we were hanging out upstairs, saw a long line for the bathrooms, so decided to try downstairs. When we got to the bottom of the stairs there was a line to go back upstairs. Had they told us at the top that if we go down we would have to wait in line to come up again, that would have been ok. But there was no notification. Thus we were stuck downstairs for the rest of the night.

By 10:30 on a Sat night the place is already pretty crowded with birthday groups. By 11:30pm this last time I went, this place was overcrowded. I expect when I pay cover for somewhere not to be stuck in a room like a sardine. Free entry, no problem. But this place charges $10 if you're not on the guest list, which is not listed on their event page (price or guest list). Thus this place is just OK.
author: Jenn D.

description: I had my birthday here and everything was perfect! The set up and the drinks were good. David and Mika made it happen for me! Thank you guys!!!!!! I will come here for any event.
author: Cc M.

description:
RAVEN .... BAR! RAVEN .... CAW CAW CAW

Man this place is too sick. Nice group of bartenders and pretty stuff drinks. I MEAN STIFF LIKE MY PEN....CIL?

anyways, nice lounge areas where you can actually chill and hang out and they have this sick upstairs with a mini dance floor and a good DJ that spins almost anything

Dress code? not really. just look good to gawk at females
author: Kenny L.

description:
Went here on a former co-worker's farewell / bday party.  I enjoyed the music selection that night where they played throwback 90's - early 2000's Hip / Hop, R&B jams.  Seeing the music videos added the nostalgic feeling.  I don't know it was me but the Friday was there was an all Asian night.  Interesting though. Besides that it was great getting to the club after 10pm where they didn't have a cover charge.  Big plus where you don't feel herded into the club and waiting in line for overprice drinks.  Drinks were definitely stiff as you get bang for the buck.   

It's nice having 3 different bar and a separate enclosed smoking lounge.  It's a little bit everything no matter what you taste is.  Will definitely return again.  Plenty of street parking.  Always good driving your low keyed car as parking can always be tough in the city.
author: Rodney A.

description:
Got in contact with Vince (the manager?) a week in advance about table reservations. And guess what? It's FREE (rare treat in SF)!! No bar minimum nor bottle service required. He was really quick with email and I highly recommend this bar for your next celebration :) I reserved a table for ~15 people at 9:30-10pm on a Saturday night for my boyfriend's birthday. We came in a little late (10:15pm) and was glad to see that the table was still there, with a "Happy Birthday" sign hung on the wall - nice touch.

When we got there, the vibe was more chill. It wasn't packed and no one was dancing, though it was quite loud in there. The music was throwback 90s, which was great! Everybody seemed to enjoy themselves. We left around 11:00pm to stop by another bar in the area (WISH Lounge), but wasn't feeling it too much. Therefore, we made our way back to Raven about an hour later. At this point, people were starting to dance, though still not packed. Actually, I think it was only my group of friends who were dancing and singing to Gangnam Style (my friend requested it). We had a blast! Stayed here until 2am, and was sad that it was over :(

Would definitely come by again. See you soon, Raven! :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Drinks: I'm a cognac drinker, so it was $11 per henny shot and $14 for vsop privilege. It's a bit steep, but oh well. 

AMBIANCE: Awesome place to get your groove on. The place is packed and requires a $10 charge if you're not on the guest list. They have two floors and play music from the 90's. If you want EDM, this is NOT your place. My party was singing along to every song and you know that's always a blast. 

SERVICE: Okay, first of all - Julian is the best bartender hands down. Cognac is typically not in any mixed drinks (for obvious reasons), but he made a special drink for my girl - which actually tasted great. I ordered drinks from ONLY him, because his customer service was one of the best I've seen at any club or bar. Management needs to promote this guy or give him a raise. 

PARKING: It's quite tough, but go checkout the alleyways. 

Overall: Awesome place. The bouncers are nice, even though some male employee attempted to kick us out for no reason. The bouncers listened to our side and allowed us to stay, as they mentioned "it's all about good times." Honestly, employees who power trip ruin the fun. That particular employee didn't say a single word to us and pointed us out. He was the reason for this 4 star review, thank Julian for making it up.
author: Austin N.

description:
Came here for an event, but I didn't think it was the right venue for it. I'm not sure about the downstairs, but the second floor was narrow and cramped.

I dug the vibe though, and the bartenders are nice. They gave great recommendations and seem to really take care in making the cocktails. Speaking of cocktails, the drink menu has some interesting concoctions.

I want to come check out their Thursday 90s music night!
author: J J.

description:
Amazing staff that wants to take care of you and a very nice venue! 

Came here to celebrate my birthday on a Saturday. I read online that they do free table reservations but of course being a procrastinator, by the time I planned everything they were booked out. I was exchanging emails with the person in charge of table reservations, and he was very polite, responsive and attentive. David put me on the wait list for a table in case of a cancellation or a no show. 

Got to the place around 10 pm, no line at the door and if you get on the guest list, entrance if free before 11 pm. Even the guest list girl was super nice. My boyfriend was on the guest list twice so we thought we could put someone else's name instead of his once we got there. The girl said she couldn't do that, but instead she offered my second +1 a discount. How accommodating of her (as opposed to just shutting me down.) 

Security was everywhere and they were all really nice. David eventually was able to accommodate me and my group with a table as one party left early! He was around all night and made sure everyone was having a good time! Props to that. 
I must admit, that I feel that I got better service here, than at a place where I actually paid a lot of money for bottle service....

Music was amazing (a mix of old school and new stuff) and the bartenders poured really good drinks for reasonable prices! Overall I had a great time and me and my group really enjoyed ourselves.
