Big shout out to David for taking very good care of me and my party! Will definitely be coming back!
author: Marina O.

description:
I am utterly shocked by the high ratings this place has received. I would not consider myself to be a "bar person" but I think I know an average one when I am in it. This is an average one.  There are a number of reviews that have properly pointed out the problems with this bar. First, the most positive thing about the place is the nice friendly bouncer who stands outside. Unfortunately, it is all downhill after him. 

I shall be succinct: The drinks are weak. From time to time filthy transients made their way in to requests water or something while scratching as if they had pockets full of ants and we were all on alert to watch our personal belongings. The bartenders were only moderately friendly. In fact, they could not wait to go home, evidenced by the fact that at exactly 1:59 am they ordered us to put our drinks on the table and they stopped the music mid-song.  The DJ was pathetic. He refused requests and played the same house music beat over and over. At one point I offered the bartender our IPod so we could hear a decent song and he actually acquiesced! 

If t weren't for the relatively nice appearance, you would think this was a dive bar. I would stay away. Again, I cannot believe the great reviews this place has received.
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
"Let's go to Raven!" is one of those statements that carries equal amounts of excitement and anxiety  :)

This is a fun place, and one I love going to - but be sure that the following day is going to be rough!  It's a lounge/bar with dancing upstairs.

The staff is awesomely friendly, there's a front bar, a back bar (that can be reserved for special occasions), an upstairs bar with dancing (hella fun), and even a little smoking patio tucked away in the alley, where you can bring your drinks.

They make great cocktails (try the switch blade), serve food from nearby Triptych (bacon wrapped dates!),  and have a decent beer selection.

Ultimately a great place that gets a fair amount of attention from those of us that work in the area in particular.
author: David N.

description:
I guess the secret is out because Raven sometimes get ridiculously crowded. Yet I still love this place. And I've been a little ashamed to say I've been here numerous times in the last few months. So often that my friends are commenting on my photos "again???". Yes. Again. Don't judge me. And just come drink with me. 

There's something about the semi-divey feel of Raven, the casual attire, the random mix of music videos and songs, no cover, and lightning fast bartenders that gets me every time. No overpriced drinks, no pretentious people, no slutty dresses, and no painful stilettos. 

Even though it's a bar, capacity reaches its limit so arrive early to avoid a wait.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Considering my work schedule, i barely have time to unwind with a few cocktails at a bar in the evening nowadays. Well, the other night was different for me. I just finished having dinner with childhood friends at Basil Thai (restaurant next door) and was meeting a friend for a drink after dinner. We were initially supposed to hang out at Bloodhound, but the lounge was pretty full and way too loud. We would have to scream at each other over drinks in order to communicate. I was totally not diggin that...lol

So we decided to check out Raven's Bar instead and the ambience was pretty cool. It has a narrow layout with more floor space towards the back of the bar. At first, it seemed like the place was slightly crowded, but it was not overbearing. We ordered our drinks, which the bartender served right away. It's always a plus when bartenders serve drinks immediatley with minimal wait! And the pinot gris on the wine menu was definitely refreshing, just like our bartender recommended! Now that i look back on that night, i think he was the only bartender working. I'm pretty impressed the wait was not long to get a drink! 

The music was pretty cool too. It was upbeat songs that were up to date, yet not to trashy or trancy or hippity hoppity (i think i just made up some words there...) To keep it simple, they were a mixture of songs you can hear on K-Fog, Alice and 94.9 strategically blended together with a smooth transition so each song doesn't clash and interrupt my intimate conversation with my friend! 

Overall, it was a great night. Well deserved for me since i barely go out to bars nowadays. My friend and i had a great time (and we could actually hear ourselves talking) while we were well aware that everyone else at the bar enjoyed their party's company. 

I wouldn't mind checking Raven's Bar again and doubt i would get sick of this place anytime soon. 

Funny thing...i just found out it used to be a gay bar. But based on the environment from my first experience there, i would have never guessed it was a gay bar before!
author: Karla M.

description:
Thanks to Raven, I had a great birthday celebration last night!

A very nice bar. I like how you can reserve table for private party for free. Originally we agreed to do bottle service, but because of the bad weather a lot of friends couldn't make it out so we have to cancel the bottle at the last minute. I feel bad so I told David (i believe he's one of the owner) that i will still pay the gratuity. He agreed and bought us a few drinks. Not long later he came back to me and said since i didn't do the bottle service he should not charge me anything so he said i could use my paid gratuity at the bar. He wanted to make sure i enjoyed my birthday there~ That was very nice of him!

It's funny how they decorated the wall with hello kitty "happy birthday" sign =P I had a great time at Raven. Thank you!
author: Louisa L.

description:
Hosted a birthday party for a couple friends here and could not have been more pleased with the entire process. Had been to Raven once before and really enjoyed myself, so I reached out through their website to host a party. Was contacted by management same day, and they set my group up with a fantastic table and an ample sized guest list. Everything went extremely smoothly day of, and we'll definitely be back.

My only complaint would be how hot it gets on the upstairs dance floor on both occasions I've been there. The place is always packed, which is surely one cause, but if they could open up some of the windows that would be a huge improvement. Still a great place to spend your night!
author: Tamiz A.

description:
I came here for Club Vogue on a Friday night and had a such a fun time! The downstairs music was all those great 90's pop hits you know and love and upstairs was current alternative dance music (like Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Goldfrapp, etc.).  It was the best of both worlds!

There were 3 bars (2 smaller bars downstairs and 1 larger bar upstairs that opens later when the top floor opens for dancing) and quite a few places to sit if you wanted to take a break from the dancing.  I arrived a little after 9 and missed happy hour (dang), but there was no cover (yay).  They had quite a few cocktails on the menu that were Raven specialties, but I didn't have any and can't comment on them except price (average was around $8, which is pretty standard for a club).  I can say that the bartender was really sweet and I got a club soda for free (nice touch). 

I definitely want to come back and try out happy hour sometime since the bar is located near several restaurants that I like (Citizen's Band, Radius, Basil, and Triptych) and then return later if it's a Friday when Club Vogue is there again! 

Oh, I should also comment that the remodel is beautiful.  I was here once before when it was another bar/club and it wasn't anything special, but it's so much nicer now.  Very clean and modern look.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Yelp brought me to this bar during an Elite event and Yelp gets all the credit!

Where else can you find a bar so big, with two floors, with different music playing in each one, with a smoking patio, with an awesome vibe, yet keeping it romantic and mysterious? Where?! This bar reminded me so much of "The Crow." 

The beer selection was awesome. The cocktails were strong, good tasting, fantastic. At one point I got so buzzed I started walking around like it were the Winchester Mystery House. If you lose track, you might end up in some stairwell leading to a closet!

My other memory from this night was the music. They were playing Michael Jackson (Jackson 5 days), old old songs, dance stuff...everyone knew these songs. It was inevitable dancing.

I really love it here.
author: Alexia R.

description:
I will never go back to this place.  First off the good side.  The bartenders were competent and quick and don't deserve this rating.  The rest of the staff I should get ZERO stars.  The bouncers pulled out weapons on me for no reason!
  
I was at Raven for a birthday party on a Friday night.  It was a 90's night and the music was so-so for the 90's.  We had two of the big booths reserved for our party which totaled around 20 or so.  Other than the people that were with us the bar was pretty dead.  At one point there were maybe 10-15 people also there not from our party.  Overall pretty lame night.

One of my friends arrived late and had too much to drink before arrival.  He was not aggressive just a little sleepy.  A bouncer asked him to leave, which I have no problem with as he was in no shape to be hanging out any more.  I went to check on him on the street and he explained that a bouncer called him a racial slur.  Now I don't know if this is true as my friend was drunk but I have not known him to lie like this in the past.  None the less I waited outside with him till the rest of our party could leave.  While standing on the sidewalk near the edge of their building I was startled by one of the bouncers at the door who had his STUN GUN out and was pointing it in our direction and had it turned on. There were no other people around, we were not yelling or making aggressive behavior, and I was babysitting my friend.  

THERE IS NO REASON TO PULL OUT A WEAPON!!  

20 min later asked us to move down the road and I explained that I had called a Cab and we were leaving as soon as it arrived.  The bouncer with the stun gun was still very aggressive and pissed at us, for almost no reason at all.  I would think that being a bouncer you would have some sort of professionalism in your job instead of waving weapons around.

 At the same time as this was going on outside another bouncer approached my wife and two friends who were having a conversation and told them they needed to leave as you could not sleep in the bar.  None of them were sleeping!  They basically harassed the only customers they had on a Friday night.  

Avoid this bar at all costs!
author: Matt M.

description:
Port in the storm from the hellhole across the street.  

Young man running the bar was funny and kind to my group.  The place is well kept and clean, looks more like a place to get mixed drinks and dress up as the sun goes down.

I'll be heading over another time with a group of single ladies rather than single dudes next time :)
author: Janine S.

description: Last night was my 1st time here. Cover was really reasonable at $10. Upstairs was really crowded and crazy fun with lots of drinking and popping music. Only complaint really is the restrooms...Only 1 toilet upstairs for the ladies! Can't recall, but I think downstairs only has 1, as well, so plan accordingly!
author: Moxi D.

description: I really like this place because of the music they spin.  The people here are in their early 20's and the place get packed on the weekend like crazy.  The drinks are yummy and strong.  Take the cab when you want to go here. Parking is almost impossible to find.
author: Aylee G.

description:
Hosted my girlfriend's 30th birthday here. I contacted the bar 4 days in advance and got lucky, they had a cancelation in their VIP section and they were able to fit us in. The staff was awesome- with the VIP room comes guest list of 10+ with no one paying a cover fee, private seating area upstairs with boots, and access to the dance floor without waiting in lines. The best part about all of this-- it was all done FREE. absolutely NO FEE to make large group reservations here. 

We went on a Friday night because they have hip-hop DJs and we all love to dance. They played 90s hip hop music videos and we all had an awesome time. 

The drinks were delicious and reasonably priced. Though, the BEST thing about this bar is that my girlfriend lost her phone that night---we called them the next day as a last ditch resort and to our shock and surprise THEY HAD HER PHONE! They worked with us and coordinated for us to pick up her phone the next afternoon. 

I cannot say enough good things about the staff here and how great of a time we had. They respond to emails in a timely manner, are professional, fun to deal with, and honest and respectful when it comes to your personal items. 

We'll definitely be back. Best place to dance on a Friday night- by far. Thank you!!!
author: Lacy R.

description:
I worked with David to organize a company event here. It was so easy to organize, and they have a great room we were able to reserve, with a private bar and great bartenders.

The event was great, the music was fun, we had access to some fresh air from back there, and the bartenders really took care of the team.  They made awesome, delicious drinks, and they had a great attitude despite all the work they had to do!

I will consider them for our next event fore sure. It was a great time, they have a great crowd, I look forward to going back!
author: Tania Z.

description:
The doorman/bouncer was nice..

I really like how they use fresh citrus juices to make their cocktails, this results in very
tasty margaritas. The "switchblade" is also an interesting margarita/tequila cocktail; fresh lemon and grapefruit juice with a cilantro jalapeno simple syrup.

I just really wish their "speciality" cocktails were included in the happy hour, they are not and are like 9 to $10. Only well drinks and beer/wine. What if I want to get a margarita with a decent tequila? Well tequila?...*dies*

I hadn't been here before they remodeled but nice, 3 bars and 2 dj booths with a small dancefloor upstairs. Has potential for future parties..

There was no DJ playing when I went, had music video mix going on that was mostly a mix of modern what i call "hipster rock" with once ina while a classic soul/funk tune thrown in, and once in a while a smashing pumpkins or depeche mode etc
author: Belito L.

description:
I guess I have been spoiled by fresh ingredients and better drinks, but all I can say is that I have been here on more than one occasion and kept hoping one of these time I would like it. 
First off, I dislike the layout of this place. It boxes you in no matter which room you are in. I wish it could be more of an open space. Then, the music is always lame here which shouldn't be overlooked considering they are competing with an awesome bar (Bloodhound) right next door. 
My last complaint, which is the most important because it's a bar...the drinks were not worth the price you pay for them. 
I ordered the spicy margarita because the bar down the street makes a mean one (Azucar Lounge) I thought I'd try it here. BAD idea, it was weak, not properly shaken to distribute flavors, and just not good overall.I couldn't finish it...oh well..now I know better.
author: lylia g.

description:
What a great discovery!

Raven is a beautiful cocktail bar that serves drinks made with fresh ingredients. Honestly, I was tempted to grab the fruit from their bar! The ambiance is chill and the crowd (at least last night) were full of FiDi/SoMa startup folks. Good music and the space is much larger than anticipated. I'll definitely come back!
author: Hannah N.

description: Came for 90's night on Thursday. Drinks are a little on the expensive side. Good music, much nostalgia. Nice and diverse group of people in there.
author: Gary W.

description:
This place is so freaken tiny. I've been here 3 times and the music, crowd, drinks.. have always been the same. I know this place is supposed to be a "bar", but apparently on saturdays it becomes raven CLUB. 

I had fun the few times I've been here, but that's probably because I had a good amount to drink. I really don't like the dj's that have been playing here though. They DON'T take song requests and they play the WHOLE damn 3 minutes of a song. It's really annoying, even for someone who isn't sober. 

There are two floors; downstairs for you to chill, and upstairs for you to dance. Primarily Asian spot, but there are still others who aren't. $10 cover after 11. If you're not claustrophobic, I'd say you can give this place a try.
author: Annie T.

description:
Yes, go here, drink lots, you won't regret the bill. I five-star-love this place. The atmosphere is wonderfully loungy with a cigar-bar kinda feel, there is a dance club upstairs for you to get your boogie on, they've got a smoking alley, wi-fi, happy hour and clean bathrooms. 

But it's the drinks that make this place so utterly amazing. I'm convinced Dave the bartender can make any liquor (rum, whiskey, etc) taste great with his secret recipes and mad mixing skills.  just ask him - he'll whip you up a 'uh, well, i kinda want something with whiskey that's not too sweet that's kinda like this other drink' and a few shakes later *bam* - best drink of your life.
author: Loralyn S.

description: Had an amazing time here!! The staff was great, especially out bartender, Jeff. He definitely got our night started off right and kept the libations flowing.  The drinks were delish and the DJ played awesome music!!  I especially love the videos!!  It's a great place to get your drink on AND your groove on!!  Can't wait to come back!
author: Theresa P.

description:
Novina was the bartender that catered to my group. She is pretty amazing at what she does. Makes GREAT drinks! Not a single disappointment. Also very friendly and chatted with us. 

Raven bar has 3 sections - a front bar area - more like a long aisle, an inside cozy area - more suited for an intimate setting and an upstairs where its mostly a dance floor. This worked out really well for us because we mostly chatted over drinks in the back room and then in between our drinks, went upstairs to burn all those calories off - yeah I am only saying that now because I am sober! haha :P

Parking can be an issue but again where in SF do you not have parking issues!? right?
author: Kinjal S.

description: If you dislike EDM as much as my friends and I do, then this is the spot for you!!!  We were at The Grand earlier the other night and were there for about an hour when we just couldn't stand the music anymore...  Luckily Raven Bar was quite close and was another option for us that night.  We arrived at around 11:30 and there was a small crowd outside the entrance.  There was no line, and we paid a $10 entrance fee to get in.  As soon as I walked in, I heard Backstreet Boys and i knew this was the spot.  There was a good amount of people downstairs but towards the back there was a stairway that lead upstairs to a main dance floor.  We waited a couple minutes as security in front said upstairs was at maximum capacity.  After a short wait we went up and HOLY CRAP it was paaaacked.  But, it was a great little dance floor.   (Also there is FREE coat-check upstairs.  Whaaaaat?)  They played all the old hip-hop/r&b/pop jams and had a good mix of new popular songs too.  I also liked that they played the music videos.  FINALLY a good spot for non-EDM fans.  Temple nightclub also has a section for hip-hop/r&b but its extremely hot and stuffy down there.  Raven got pretty warm from all the people but was nothing compared to temple.  Will be back!!!
author: Angel L.

description: Had a great time here with my girlfriend. This was our first time here and the vibe, music and the staff were great overall. No attitudes here, everyone is friendly.  Thanks to David who was able to give my girlfriend who was returning to Germany,  a cool bon voyage card and a complimentary drink ticket.That was a great surprize and so without a doubt we will be back.
author: Tony M.

description: I have been here like four times and never had a problem. Until this last time I was here for a birthday party and asked the bar manager if I had to wait in line or if I could just go in since we reserved a table and he was suuuuuch a jerk.  Unnecessarily rude and snappy.  Learn how to speak to people in a respectable manner If you expect for people to take your establishment seriously.  Needless to say my five star experience slid down to a two star experience based on the customer service. Not everyone is drunk and not understanding.  He could've just said nicely that I had to wait in line.  Whatever.
author: Michael B.

description:
An low-key lounge but full of fun.  Super nice bartenders.  Great and strong cocktails.  Reasonable prices.  Good music.  They even have the dance floor at the second floor!  

Definitely a great place to chill with friends and your date :-)
author: Liza T.

description: I have been going here since before it became Raven. I will always be a dedicated customer here as long as Jonathan and Vince remain the owners. I love those two and love what they have created in Raven! It is a beautiful loungey environment downstairs and upstairs is perfect for dancing. The mixologists here make AMAZING cocktails that far surpass anywhere else I have been. I love a good cocktail and detest mixed drinks. The owners went above and beyond making sure their bartenders are cocktail-capable. It's impressive watching them whip up a fresh cocktail. Their music is not the typical top 40 crap either. They mix it up and have 80's and 90's nights. It's a fun and chill vibe and the only bar/lounge/club I am comfortable going to.
author: Unicorn U.

description: This place used to be a fun, vibrant gay club. Now it's another boring place for boring marina type straight people to go and look pretty.  How sad, sad, sad. Soon there won't be any gay bars left in this city, except for a few that look just like Raven - blackbird, churchhill.. this trend needs to stop.
author: Mark S.

description:
Swanky speakeasy feel to the place, fabulous (and interesting) cocktails, bartenders who are not only attractive, but know how to banter....yeah this is pretty much the only bar I will go to in SOMA.

Speaking of...I really need to go back....
author: Rylan S.

description:
As a lover of spicy tequila cocktails, I'm diggin the Switchblade at Raven Bar. A little bit sweet with a little bit of heat.. this drink is delicious!

Came here for HH on a Monday and there were a few people at the bar. There's an additional bar in the back and another floor upstairs for dancing on the weekends. A lot more spacious that it appears from the front.
author: Chrissy L.

description: Like the place.  The female bartender that served tonight was very attentive. Appriciated that she a knowledged me among all the really tall people in front of me. Thank you!
author: Franks S.

description: Really cool vibe for a dive bar with extremely good looking bartenders! They're all dressed up in dress shirts and vests looking quite dapper. The crowd is a mix of young 20s up to mid-late 30s and the music is a good mix of 90s chart toppers. Im not sure what the DJ was like later in the evening because we were only here to 11 when we decided to switch over to a more club-like venue. Theres no cover charge before 11 if you sign-up on the GL on their website, and its $10 if not. I really loved how friendly Christopher the bartender upstairs was and he engaged in great conversation with my friend and I before things got busier in the bar. The drink he made me was one of the best I've had in a while so that was a major plus! Once the crowd started picking up things got packed quick and we started noticing that it wasn't very diverse.. It was about 95% Asian with a few other races mixed in. I personally prefer to party with an extremely diverse crowd and thats the only reason we left. I would still come here as an early night starting point though!
author: Alysia W.

description: Great chill atmosphere.  Don't have to get dressed up to meet a fun group of people willing to drink and get down.  DJ spins alot of hiphop, so its pretty fun.  It can be cramped because it is a rather small venue.  Definitely leaning towards the lounge feel more than a full out club feel.  Great for a night where you just need to take it easy and don't want the pounding EDM in your head.
author: David C.

description: i've always been a big fan of 1984 at cat club and I still am, BUT i love the 90s with the music video at Raven!! Its so much fun.
author: Wakako U.

description:
It's hard to find a bar these days that doesn't play top 40 and that call me maybe shit...I mean who doesn't love to get drunk with friends and sing along to the songs we listened to on the radio as kids but didn't understand the inappropriateness of until 5+ years later?

Raven = Stiff drinks, cheap shots, friendly bartenders & late 90s/early 2000s music. 

go with a fun group of friends that doesn't mind being slightly crowded and you'll have a great night...and don't forget to grab a dirty dog across the street before you go home :)
author: Jen D.

description: I totally knew I would like this place as I heard Britney Spears blasting on the speakers as I came in! Shout out to this place, for it has all your throw back 90s pop/hip hop music! There ware two floors to hang out and grab drinks and a tiny dance floor upstairs playing music videos! Drinks are pretty pricey, but I guess that's the city for you... $11 for my FLAT mint mojito. I'll pass on that next time... Overall, chill place to hang out, good dancey 90's music, and if you're wondering what TLC's definition of scrub is or what drives Britney crazy -  come to this place to find out :)
author: Sophia Y.

description:
I got here a little early for a friend's birthday celebration, so I hung out at the bar for a little bit chatting with the bartenders. If the bar's not too busy (and it will get busy!) they'll take the time to chat about the drink menu, what alcohol they have available, and what they recommend based on your drinking habits. 

I had the vampire slayer, which is a whiskey cocktail - sweet and citrusy but with enough alcohol so that you feel the burn. The bartender definitely gave me a little extra alcohol for this one. And she complimented what I was wearing.. needless to say, she went home with a hefty tip!

Next I tried the switchblade. A spicy cocktail, with a hint of sweetness, and a Tequila base. Very interesting blend, and something that I would recommend.

Also tried tastes of what my friends were having, but don't really remember the drinks' names. Regardless of what you order, you can rest assured that they won't skimp on the alcohol!

The DJ was killing it, a good mix of 90s/00s Billboard hits, as well as some current Top-40 songs. There's a dance floor upstairs, but we never made it up because we had a booth with too many bags/coats/etc to watch over. The first floor was still popping though, I was having a blast.

Definitely going to be back here if I'm up in SF.
author: Dae K.

description: Good drinks, great service, 80's/90's hip hop & R&B music + Ninja Warrior on TV? Two thumbs up.
author: Krystine D.

description:
Wow...what a great find! I was looking for a chill spot to celebrate my birthday while catching up over a few drinks, good music and not compete with the crowd or loud music. Since I wasn't sure how many of my friends were coming, I didn't want to pay for too much for bottle service and/or reservation fees either. Thanks to yelp, I found this gem of a spot. I emailed for details and Vince was super quick to respond and great to talk to.  The best part?  Reservations were free and they even surprised me with balloons and a "happy birthday" banner!

Raven is pretty detached from the typical bar and club hopping places so parking isn't so tough. Obviously the atmosphere varies, but when we went it was very chill and relaxed. Not to mention, the bartenders were amazing! You know that feeling when you really want a good drink or shot but can't decide what to get? Trust these guys, they'll give you exactly what you're looking for. 

Overall a great experience, thanks Raven!
author: Lea F.

description: It was my first time going to this bar/club and I was very disappointed. Tonight I ordered 2 drinks and after I started drinking my margarita I looked started  to chew my ice and I pull out something out of my cup that looks like a strange shaped piece of ice but in fact it's GLASS. Someone at my table also saw a glass brake earlier and it somehow got mixed in with the ice or fell in or they didint use the proper cup, frankly.. It was scary that I might have drank shards of glass. Anyways, I complained to my friends and they said I should tell the bar tender and ask for a free drink so I do.. A lady goes back to her friend that made my drink (asian male) and tells him what he did, she comes back to me and says I can have the free drink but the glass found is not from them so they say they don't know how it got there. I say to her.. So you think I'm lying??? And she says I don't know but that's what he told me. I was very upset that they pulled that card on me and said that they don't know where the glass came from. Obviously a glass broke and there was a mixup and it was placed in my cup somehow with the ice.  It's nice and all they gave me a drink but the asian guy should have acknowledged his mistake. For real. That pisses me off.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This proved to be a fantastic happy hour spot. The bar tender was friendly and accommodating. He had good knowledge of the house wines and their flavor notes. The house pinot grigio was far above average for a happy hour wine and a great deal. I enjoyed the music and overall friendly vibe. I would definitely come here again for happy hour.
author: Sara P.

description:
Love, love, love this place! Upstairs is fun on Friday nights, and 'Beat Repeat' on Thursdays is super chill! 

Side note: 90's Diva Tribute Night was a HUGE let down. Why call it "90's Night" if you're only going to play a small handful of songs from that decade. Kinda of a joke when you've got divas (i.e. Mariah, Janet) on the flier and you don't even play songs from those divas.
author: Billy R.

description: Really nothing special about this place in my opinion. And it smelled funny. That's all there is to say.
author: Victoria G.

description: Wow, I found this joint on Thrillist.  So I had to check it out one night with a couple of folks after work.  It's a dark but hip bar.  The drinks have interesting names.  I had the Malbec wine then I moved over to the Cab.  They have nice wines, the bartender was awesome and very friendly.  I'm checking this joint out again.  Loved it, and I love Edgar Allen Poe, one of my favorite poet and writers.
author: Liz D.

description:
Loved this place! It's in a weird area but had a fabulous time! It was my friend's wedding weekend and we decided to reserve the back area with a private bartender for free! for some pre-wedding festivities. The owner started the night off bartending and was very polite and met all of our needs, then the night shift started and the other bartenders were just as nice. There were a bunch of Russians in there so we definitely drank a lot of their booze and they didn't seem to mind our rowdiness which is a star itself.
Beforehand they provded us with some caterers we can order from but another option was to bring our own food as well and no charge! So we got costco pizzas and a bunch of apps which turned out to be awesome. 
I definitely recommend this place, especially for a private party. The owner and staff were friendly and their music was off the hook! 
Thank you Raven Bar for treating the Russians with absolute fantastic customer service!
author: Lana K.

description: Order food at triptych and get it delivered. Need to do that next time.
author: Anjelica C.

description: heard so much about this place was excited to try this place on the Green Light Party night.  it's a pretty small venue in SOMA if you get there early it's easy to find street parking nearby and you get in without a cover charge if you sign up on the guest list.  The music is really good and progressed from the 90s to top 40s, I enjoy the big video screens.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Hands down the worst service I may have ever experienced in SF, on a birthday no less. 

I was in touch with the GM (David Luu) in regards to a birthday party. We were promised seating to buy a bottle. When we arrived he was nowhere to be found, even though we were told we "had" to check in with him for seating. When we asked various staff where he could be found we were scoffed at and told to wait. When David was finally located (in the apparent vast enormity of Raven Bar), we were told there was no seating available. We got 2 drink tickets for a group of 4 which just seemed like an embarrassingly charitable pat on the back. 
At one point David came back and told us a table had just cleared up and that we would finally be able to buy a bottle (seriously? all I want is to GIVE you my money, can it really be this hard?). But surprise! By the time David had made his rounds and spoken to every single one of his friends on our way to "our" table it had already been taken. What's more? You cannot purchase a bottle when you do not have a table. 

I'm never going back. This place is a joke.
author: Marie-Claude R.

description: I came strolling in here along with my friends a few weeks ago and we all had a great time. A huge shout-out to the bouncer who allowed my friends in even though they weren't "dressed up". He suggested for them to coat check some jackets, etc. Unlike other places, they actually want you IN THE BUILDING! They played mostly your late 90's and early 2000's hip-hop music and this place gets crowded. I would suggest for you to show up around 10PM so, you wouldn't have to wait in line just to go to the upper level which was craccccckinnnnn'. This place is small as other reviewers had mentioned, but it isn't tiny. You have enough room to chit chat with your groups of friends while you shake your bootay. I'm glad I gave this place a try. Parking wasn't too bad either and there is a $10 cover. If you don't want to deal with any bullshitting bouncers, come here!
author: Charisma C.

description: I am tempted to give them a 5! ok 4.5 for you! Thanks Yelp for introducing me to this place. I told my friend about the fun time I had and she decided to have her birthday there last night. The DJ again amazing with old 90s hits! Dance floor full of fog, not over crowded but not empty, enough windows and fans goings so wasn't dying of heat stroke...Today back ache and hangover= Damn good night from what I remember at least. I'm old.
author: Karen T.

description: Very Chill place, we walked in grab some drinks such as the Vampire Slayer, Anchor Away, and the Lychee Bliss. My favorite thing about this bar is the fact that it's not crowded and the service is great. The main bartender seems to be the guy who makes up new drinks and names it based on who can give it a good name. Highly recommend this place.
author: Mia L.

description:
I had a great time here. Good music, great vibe, excellent drinks, fun crowd.

I was here for Club Vogue, the 90s music night and it was really grooving. Downstairs was more Pop and Hip Hop, which was fun, but I spent most of the night dancing to the Alternative and Techno music upstairs.
author: Jim A.

description:
New joint in SoMa. Looks loungy and low-key from the outside. A little too loud and clubby on the inside. Except without the space to dance. Though they haven't had their grand opening yet, so perhaps at that point they will have more of a dance floor (there will be two levels, or so I read).

They have reasonably priced signature cocktails (all under $10) and my vodka tonic was made with Skyy without even my asking. (And I think it was only $5!) So plusses for that.

Another plus: my Polish-American roommate and her friend (also Polish-American) were gushing about how this place served one very Polish vodka (not Belvedere, you ignorami! Zubrowka, which is some buffalo grass-infused vodka you don't see very often in American bars). So, if you're into lesser-known, foreign booze, try them out I guess!

Just turn the music down, please.
author: Matthew B.

description: It's a fun place to go to if you're youth was spent in the 90's and early 00's. They play both newer music and throwback hits and the DJ is pretty good with keeping the flow.  The drinks are kind of pricey like your would find at a lounge but they are very well made and unique.  Get in there early to avoid paying a cover fee for when it gets crowded at night.  Bottle service is first come first serve but honestly, unless it's a big party, forgo the bottle and spend the money trying a variety of different drinks.
author: Vicky C.

description: Fun place, good music, attentive bartenders.  I come here in the evening pretty often and its one of my favorite bars in SOMA.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but when you go in it is awesome and has two floors!
author: Dan C.

description: I reserved a booth here a few weeks ago, and the service was amazing! The manager was very helpful and responded to questions very quickly. They let you reserve a booth without buying a bottle or having a minimum tab, which is unheard of anywhere else! They're also very organized, give clear instructions about how to add people to your guestlist, and really accommodating! Not to mention, their music is always great! Come early because the line can get pretty long!
author: Audrey M.

description:
Nice digs...the bar is pretty spacious considering the entrance is fairly narrow. The lounge area has solid seating and the smoking area aka dog run has benches and is covered for moderate protection against the cold. 

The bartenders get a little overwhelmed on a weekend so don't get too thirsty..the wait is a bitch for drinks. Alas...what are you going to do? Oh, I know...order two at once. Save the trip back. 

DJ booth sits low and personal on the floor. The back bar area is great too with easy access to the smokers/dog run. Chill for happy hour...not so chill once the night settles in.
author: Jay H.

description:
+5 stars for great music and bartenders. (Seriously, they played Missy Elliot... 12 year old me finally gets to live out her dream of going clubbing in the late 90s)

-1 star for EXTREME crowdedness. I know it's a sign that this place is happening, but can you imagine a place so crowded that your face is bound to be firmly pressed up against some douchebag's back cleavage? 

I would go back though... Overall it's a very down-to-earth atmosphere and the crowd is casual and positive. You don't get preyed on with the same creepiness as you would at a place like The Grand. Also, the music makes me dance and takes me back to a time when I didn't dance, which is kind of a delightful paradox.
author: Huan L.

description:
Great bar for a group of friends to chill and talk. There's a bunch of good group seating options and it's not too loud to overpower a conversation (although I will disagree with their choice of music).

My only complaint is that the bartenders are the slowest I've encountered in my life (at least the ones working that night). Most bars I've been to, the bartender always seems like they're in a hurry and you're just short of wasting their time. The Raven bartenders have a more laid back attitude at the Raven which is good but it will take 15-20 minutes to get your drink (from the moment you order to getting the drink and your credit card back).
author: Jason C.

description: I've heard about this place and went here recently two consecutive weekends in a row.  I love how Raven Bar does play mostly 90s music accompanied by their music respective videos but the second weekend I went they were playing 95% of the exact, same songs.  Guest-list fills up early but if you make it before 10 am you can avoid the $10 cover.  I enjoyed the upstairs scenery/dance floor more than the lower floor but after 11 pm it gets so crowded everywhere.  I wish the mixed drinks were stronger but I would definitely come back again.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Okay, first time here. It was a friend's birthday and from the moment we entered the bar, they were super friendly and greeted us all! Sat at the bar, they greeted and said goodbye to every person. Our bartender was Jeff he's super friendly and I loved my winter kiss (I was feeling the holiday spirit). He made these strawberry shots....omgggg delicious! 

The vibe is great. Dancing upstairs or just some casual intimate booth seating-best of both worlds! This place is awesome. Love it. Will come back SOON.
author: Kristina L.

description: First time on a Saturday, had the upstairs area reserved. Extremely crowded,3 bars the 2nd bar downstairs was the most laid back area. Bartender gal with the fro is on point (didnt catch her name) outside area, very narrow. ...however, music was slappin rap,hip hop and a bit of the 90's old school. Definitely would go back only if i have bottle service/ vip reservation due to the limited space.
author: Jane M.

description: Secruity guys are dicks.  I don't see why I will order bottles and reserve at this establishment ever again.  My friend and vip got left out for 20 minutes. The stupid security dude with the red scarf wouldn't cooperate with anyone was being difficult.   Hannah is awesome and she knows her shit.
author: Leo F.

description:
Bitter love.

Surreal scene to walk into. Unexpectedly goth night. Not exactly the uplifting EDM vibe this crew is used to surrounding themselves with.

Fortunately a well made cocktail can alleviate any bout of awkwardness.

Drink menu took some time to review. Everything sounded superb. And inspired by Edgar Allen Poe.

Ordered a Bitter Love. Made from Bulleit Rye, Campari and Cocchi Americano. Just sounded right for a goth evening.

Confident bartender went to work. Impressively. Ingredients, mixing tools and glasses were all over the place. Furious activity that led to a subtle and captivating final pour.

One sip and I was sold. No bitterness at all. Just love.

Bar is the focal point upon entry. There are places to sit. Mingle. Converse. Imbibe. Towards the back you can do a little dance.

You'll just want to have a cocktail or three first. Especially on goth night.
author: Jason B.

description: This place is pretty fun, but it gets sooo crowded. I came on a Friday night for my friend's birthday event and it was really hard to move around anywhere without brushing against people. Besides that though, I have no complaints about this place. The bartenders are super efficient and attentive compared to other bars despite the crazy amount of people inside. That is so rare for any bar. I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes to get a drink! It was also nice that there were 3 different bars inside (2 downstairs, 1 upstairs) with self-serve water stations. As for music, they play mostly hip hop and there's a dance floor upstairs, but they closed it off due to maximum capacity a couple of times. I had a good time here and wouldn't mind coming back on another night!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
This place was awesome.  Dave, the bartender, found us staring at the menu for too long so he chose a couple drinks to make for us based on what alcohol we liked and they were great!  We stayed the rest of the night going through the rest of the menu of cocktails and even trying a few 'experimental' drinks he said he was still working on.  

The place is pretty nice.  It looked like there was a second bar in the back, and I'm pretty sure someone mentioned an upstairs, but it was a weeknight, so I don't think anyone was up there.  The drinks are priced great at just $9 a cocktail (and I think $1 off during their 5-7pm happy hour) and they're all pretty tasty too.  Pretty much all the drinks I had were tasty without being overly sweet and still had enough alcohol that the taste wasn't drowned out by the mixers.

I will absolutely be coming back to this bar quite often.
author: Keith C.

description:
I have to give these guys some love.  

Nice place, good variety of bars, decent music.

I left my card there and they only charged me what I drank (vs. some bars which will nail you).

Thank you Raven.
author: Kyle P.

description: Hours posted are lies. It says closes at 2am but they do not let anyone in after 1am. We dropped by here at 1:10am but security would not let anyone in at all, regardless of others leaving the bar already.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Now this is the story all about how My life got flipped, turned upside down 
And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there ...I'll tell you how

Yes those were the first two lyrics of the Fresh Prince of Bel Air, however there is more of these awesome plays at Raven not to mention some taste-bud melting drinks. 

Call me crazy but when someone says, Mint, Basil and Spice infused in an ice glass with alcohol...I'm totally game.
author: Lannette G.

description:
Not a bad place.  I came here last Friday when they were playing 90's Vogue music.  It was a fun throwback.  They had a mini dance floor and tables to sit around.  Our table ordered a bunch of beers so I didn't try their cocktails.  The service was fast and efficient. 

This place is a little far from the the civic center bart station. We had to walk a total of 4-5 blocks from the bart station. Our party was coming from downtown SF.  So bring your walking shoes if your not from this neighborhood.
author: R C.

description:
This is one of the best new craft cocktail bars in SOMA. They squeeze juices fresh daily for their awesome cocktail menu. I highly recommend their signature cocktail called The Raven. It's sweet, flavorful and has complex layer of flavor. I am also a big fan of The Basil of Death, Apple Poe, and the Caiprinha Noir. They have cheap well drinks and good beers on tap. It's a nice place to go for happy hour with $5 dollar wine, $4 wells and $4 draft beers. They have awesome, knowledgeable bartenders who are very friendly and who make you feel like you are the only one in the bar when you order a drink. They show care and attention to every cocktail they make. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! Great for groups and partying on a Thursday, Friday, or Saturday Night. It's also great for a quiet cocktail throughout the week. 

Pros: Beautiful remodeled bar. Great for parties. Very good bartenders. Awesome cocktails. Cheap drinks. Smoking patio where you can bring drinks. Sweet bar and dance floor upstairs. 

Cons: couldn't think of any.
author: David L.

description: One of the bartenders totally looks like Ryan Gosling
author: Bianca D.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday back in February. Would not suggest coming here for a big party. Once this bar is packed, you gotta stay waiting outside until someone leaves before you can come in. We had bottle service and boy, it took FOREVER for us to get our bottle. On top of that, when I was trying to get a drink at the bar (in the back), the bartender never looked my way. I got fed up after standing there for 30 minutes and went to the bar in the front and was immediately served. (Whoever you were bartender in the back, pay attention to your RIGHT and LEFT 'cause you're losing tips for the night). Besides that, I say a good place to lounge around with a few drinks with good old school R&B and hip hop (A good change from that EDM/DUBSTEP/HOUSE music).
author: Betty P.

description: All I kno is that if we end up at Raven then it's a wild night because the shots are fat and the music is bumpin and we won't be turnin down for nothin!!
author: Joe N.

description: Raven is a great lounge-y bar. Very warm and beautifully decorated--fantastic lighting. Comfortable and intimate seating. Yummy cocktails made with the freshest ingredients. The place is new so I will definitely be back to see how it develops.
author: Melissa b.

description: I wood have given this place a five but the music was just wrong and sui loud that you have to tell just to talk to the person next to you. The specialty cocktails here are a must! Each is unique in its item way and the flavor profile is amazing.
author: David Y.

description:
I can not say enough about how great everyone here is. We had our second b-day party here last Sat night & the bartenders, manager, & all the staff were so gracious (& patient) to our group. There were a lot of parties & everyone had such an incredible time. The DJ created a really fun playful vibe & just makes you want to play & dance. I lost my phone & was most sad about losing my pics of the night. Just checked their FB page & they had pics ! They did check everywhere for me & were so kind about helping me, just want to say...

Thank you again Raven Bar.... we will be back,soon.
author: colleen b.

description: cool soma digs...long and narrow, but spacious...bar running long aside left wall...no cover at entrance...filling up fast past ten pm, saturday...music and plenty of floor space...mostly standing, drinking and talking...bartenders efficient in servicing the drinks...working the crowds and orders....finding cocktails sweet for taste...no interest in creative names...switching to beers for the night...beer and talk...good music background...upstairs and bathrooms...another large bar...more casual fun vibes and dancing at top...contrast from downstairs area for more mingling, lounging and conversations....
author: Hen A.

description: Crazy hot! In the worst possible way. Terrible BO smell all night. Asian Central stay away unless that's your thing.
author: Patrick J.

description: Party of 10 celebrated a friend's birthday.  We had a booth reserved downstairs.  When we got there around 9pm, the place was still kinda sleepy.  We decided to order some drinks from the bar.  My husband and I ordered Rusty Nails and Lychee Bliss ($18), White Russian ($11), and Martini ($13).  We really don't go clubbing or drinking in the city so I don't know whether those prices were expensive or reasonable.  At least the drinks were strong.  We left our reserved booth for about an hour to go dancing on the second floor.  Some in our party just left their coats in the booth.  Happy to report that they weren't stolen or anything.  Security roamed the area periodically.  Music was mostly 90's hiphop.  Our group considered leaving at around 11pm to transfer to a more exciting place, but when we went down to get our stuff, the area downstairs was already pretty lively so we decided to just stay.  Good thing nobody else tried to use our reserved booth while we were upstairs.  The booth was a heaven-sent especially since one of us was infanticipating...(having a place to sit that is close to the restroom is a major plus!).   We did have a better  time dancing and crowd-watching as the night wore on.
author: Janice T.

description: I hosted a birthday get-together here this past Saturday night. I booked the last table two weeks in advance, something you want to keep in mind when making a reservation. There was no table minimum and no required bottle service. I got bottle service anyway. Josephine was our servicewoman, and she was very attentive and helpful. The music was throwback 90s-2000s hip-hop/r&b, which got a lot of compliments from my group who found it easy to get into and dance to. The bartenders were quick to respond and make drinks. Overall, had a really good time and would definitely come back for another birthday/special occasion!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Place was so much fun... they didnt play the "cliche" 90's music all night and played some of the songs you wouldnt hear again UNLESS you came to this spot.... GREAT Videos dance floor and set up is just BANG... As GOOD as it Gets.. YEs!!!!!!!!!!!
author: M P.

description:
Warning: I become a bully after a few cocktails. ;) 

David and Julien are both very sweet and good sports for putting up with me (& my friends) at the bar-- that alone is 5-star service. I had gone to Raven a few times before, but never really gotten to know any of the staff until Thursday, when I set up an impromptu reunion happy hour with some college friends. 1999 was the perfect setting for such an occasion.

Unlike any bar... they were extremely approachable, attentive, accommodating, fun, and friendly. I'd never had a knack of talking to strangers, but they made it very easy. Thanks, David, for giving me the upstairs tour, and adorable/charming Julien for all the ice refills! ;) Definitely true professionals who love what they do. You can see it in their eyes. 

Triptych deserves some love too. They forgot about my nachos order for a while, and then only charged me half price when I got them ($4). The brie burger was veeeeeeeeery good.

I'll be back soon!
author: Jeanne C.

description: For my first night in San Francisco I certainly went to the right place. My bartender, Jeff was so amazing. He definitely knew what he was doing behind the bar because my drinks were absolutely delicious. Great music, great atmosphere, great place all around.
author: Courtney K.

description:
Should read 4.5 stars! 

So I went to Raven Bar once in August when my friend was DJ'ing there and immediately knew I wanted to have my birthday party there (which wasn't until November!) Everything about the ambiance made it appealing to me -- I'm not a big fan of the club scene at all, and especially not for hosting my own birthday at one. That's why I love Raven because it's more of a bar feel than anything, with the upstairs almost like a little lounge. 
Anyways, so I made reservations to host my birthday in November and the manager, Vince, was more than helpful. He booked me the upstairs private seated area two months in advance and not to mention everything was free. No charge for the table, no charges for bottle service, no mandatory spending amount -- nothing! It's not common you find a lounge with perks like this. Oh and I got there and there were two huge "happy birthday" banners in our section as well.. so sweet. Anyways, all in all, after my party last night I can honestly say it was one of the best nights out I have had. 

Only reason why I wouldn't give it 5 stars was because of the music. When we first got there it was around 10:45 and they had been playing 80's club music for a good hour. Later I found out this was the DJ's specialty. I actually went up to the booth to ask him if he had more of a selection for the rest of the night. Around 11:30 the vibe changed to mostly top 40's and some random 90's songs (TLC- Waterfalls, lol). Anyways, I would have wanted more house music but it's okay, all in all it was an awesome night and it's always fun dancing to top 40's as well so I can't complain.

Great experience and I really suggest Raven Bar!
author: Naseem K.

description: I celebrated my birthday party this past weekend at Raven Bar, and had an awesome experience. I reserved the back bar area of the 1st floor, which had its own bartender and was roped off. Big THANK YOU to David Luu, the General Manager, who worked closely with me in the preparation and who provided excellent customer service during the event. A shout out also to Garrett, Tammy, and Woody for helping to make it a successful (and crazy-ass) night. Thank you!
author: Julian P.

description:
I went here since my cousin who was visiting out of town wanted to go there (his coworkers wanted to go). It's a cozy little bar, with 2 dance floors if you like dancing.

I honestly wasn't in a party mood that night, but it's a cute little bar. There's like two diff scenes here, if you like bar-bars.. stay downstairs, but if you like more of a club scene but not a full-on club.. go upstairs. 

The staff here is cool. They might not notice who got to the bar first to order, but that's typical. Depending on the bartender they may make you a custom drink (I asked what mixed-vodka drink they recommend and Tammy made a good mix for me). The shots are also big here, unless my cousin's friend was ordering double shots. So I had to ask for a chaser (I never use chasers, might've been my lack of party-mode), anyways I wanted a juice chaser since soda makes me tear (haha! yea I'm odd). So the cute dancing bartender upstairs hooked it up with a chaser that goes with my shot. I learned that pineapple "masks the taste" of vodka. OH! Also when they were shooing us off when they were closing.. I ran to the bar to ask if I can still get a glass of water. The guy teased me saying he can't since they stop serving after 2. But he gave me a glass of water anyways.. complete with a slice of lemon! Dang.. ahaha. 

Then by the end of the night I noticed I didn't have my card. So I emailed them and the manager responded even though he was on vacation. And they had my card all safe and sound! Yeayuh!

Also, when you call them.. they might startle you by greeting you by name. At least I got startled/baffled when they did it to me. (They have caller ID haha)

*whisper: I like this place better than Bloodhound (their neighbor)* haha

But yea, friendly staff .. cute little bar.. So if you like to drink and dance but don't like a lot of people.. this place is for you.
author: Kay T.

description: The staff members were really great. The bouncer, Clarence was amazing. The drinks weren't that good for the prices. It's filled with hella Asians and wasn't diverse at all. My friends and I felt uncomfortable the entire time. Also, the dance spaces were cramped and the music was old! They played old stuff from the 80-90s. I didn't like it at all. If I didn't meet the bouncer, I would have left in the first 30 minutes. So disappointing!
author: Jessica S.

description:
I've been here at least a dozen times now and, crowded or not, I've always had a great time.  The first day I walked in, by myself, I was greeted amicably by the bartender (all of whom, I have come to realize, are very friendly).  Customer service here is obviously a priority and that is very important to me.  I don't care how great your cocktails are, if I walk into an establishment or up to a bar, I expect to be greeted by someone with basic social skills, not by some elitist @sshole.  It's imperative no matter how busy the joint is.  They're very consistent in this regard.

I think I've had every drink on the menu at this point.  Of course, some I like better than others, but they're all fantastic.  My favorite is the Castaway.  If you're not sure what to order, the bartender will gladly guide you to something delicious.

The second time I went in, I brought a friend (a habit I've developed) for happy hour.  We got through a few cocktails and were offered a free round.  What a nice gesture!  This is how it usually works at legit places: you are polite, you tip appropriately (AT LEAST $2 for every single drink - don't order three drinks and tip $2), and sometimes you get a free drink or two.  Don't get me wrong, I absolutely do not tip with the expectation of getting one on the house, but I've noticed it happens.  Again, a very nice gesture, and a smart one, because you tell your friends you found a kick ass spot, bring them in and benefit the business.  Regardless, the staff is amazing and they deserve to be tipped very well (no, I don't work here - I swear).

I don't know what else to say.  I love '90s night on Thursdays.  You can get some great eats from Triptych.  It's a popular, yet personable establishment, which is what makes Raven rare.  I know the names of most bartenders.  I've patronized every night of the week and the crowd (if there even is one) has always been completely chill.  This is not Holy Cow.  Cheers!
author: D M.

description: to crowded didnt even drink because i didnt want a push and shove battle. music was good , that was it the layout sucks very narrow andf only one toilet on each floor so you may have to hold it or wait in line for 20 minutes
author: Ashley P.

description: The 2 stories helps this place out.  It reminded me of Gravity in the Marina.  I wonder if that place is still there. I am getting freakin old.  The dance floor is on the small side but a great place if you are not a fatty.
author: Fatty A.

description: Trashy and classy meet here. They play good old school hip hop. You can reserve a lounge spot without buying a bottle. There's ample room to dance and the bartenders can make a solid drink.
author: Sharon M.

description: We held a college alumni happy hour here on a weeknight and the staff was awesome.  They were more than happy to set aside some couches for us towards the back of the bar, making it really easy for us to gather in once spot.  I loved the ambiance of the space and their clever cocktails as well.  Now I really want to get here on a weekend.   Nice work Raven!
author: Tim N.

description: I went to this lounge on a Saturday night to party hard with 18other friends, we signed up on the guest list and had no problem checking in the bouncers were very nice and quick to help even though we got there at exactly 10:50pm they still let us with no cover charge as promised unlike other lounges who promise free entrance before 11 but once they see a long enough line they begin to charge. One last thing, the drinks were super delicious and the music was 90's hits, thank's RAVEN we had a blast for our double birthday celebration!
author: Iliana S.

description:
I recently came here for the first time to celebrate my birthday with my friends. If you are looking for a place to eat beforehand, because you know you will need the food to absorb things, I recommend Basil Thai Restaurant, which is like a 30 sec walk from Raven. 

Since my party was 10+ people i emailed the bar a week before so that i could reserve a booth. The reservation process was super simple! I just emailed the bar and the next day i got a reply from the general manager, who was super nice and chill. Since Raven doesn't require a fee for reservations, minimum bar tab, or bottle service, it is very nice on your wallet. You can save the extra money for the yummy cocktails they offer. However, if you wanted bottle service you can always get it at the place too. The bottle service girl was super friendly, helpful, and showed some of the girls in my party a thing or two on how to have some fun on the dance floor. 

The music was so-so. We went on a Saturday and the music selection was old school and top 40's. I am not a fan of the EDM or House music so I opted for the stuff i hear on the radio (instead of grooving in the car i can now dance it out in a club). We got to Raven at 10 pm and the old school music was a little too old school for us. Which was okay because then we could just focus on what drinks to get. Fortunately , around 12 am until closing the music became a little less old school and more of the recent stuff we all know and love from the radio. They also have a bigger dance floor upstairs, so you can strut more of your stuff. 

Since it was my birthday celebration, i blacked out probably 3 hours after i got to Raven, so i don't remember much after i hit the dance floor. Surprise Surprise. However, the next morning all my guest told me how happy they were at the club and how cute and friendly all the staff at Raven was to all of us. 

Bottom line: If you are looking for a club to go to, Raven should be one to check out! Great drinks for a very decent price and plenty of dancing room for all. Plus the staff was really great! Definitely coming back here again, but sober for the most part!
author: Danna L.

description: Awesome local bar with a decent sized (25x25?) dance floor. The drinks are good, normal prices, but the real draw is the music. There's tv's and a projector playing music videos going back to the 90s. Where else do you hear Ace of Base played right after Tupac and just before the Harlem Shake song??!
author: Calvin W.

description:
Came here last Friday with a couple of girl friends, and realized it was their Grand Opening shindig. I had just heard about the place on Thrillest, so with dining close by, it seemed like the obvious choice. In the pictures it looked like a cool lookin' lounge, but once inside, it seemed much different. It was loud and clubby (Soma style), and filled with young kids. Not really our scene. We decided to at least stay for a round, so our friend bought us 3 cinnamon whiskey shots. After a medium sized mouthful, I couldn't drink anymore....I'm sure it helped make my cab ride home blurry-- what was in those shots? Anyways, our friend also started chatting it up with someone who claimed "it was his spot", and bought us some free drinks, which he also claimed "he usually doesn't do." Right dude, we really believe you. 
Even though we weren't sure about the place, I glanced around and it seemed like it would be a somewhat cool place to go during happy hour or when it's been on the block longer than however long it has been open.
author: Sonya D.

description:
I had a good time at Raven Bar, and I liked the music. There was just the right amount of Bon Jovi being played, and I went home with a soar throat from singing in a circle amongst 30 of my friend's closest friends. 
We celebrated a birthday massacre here. It was fun, a little messy, and we still aren't sure about a few odd details that we're deciphering from photo evidence. But that's okay, we were celebrating. 
The drinks aren't cheap, the location is a little further from BART than I usually like to be, and I thought the description was a bit off. If Edgar Allen Poe and Humphrey Bogart were to meet for a drink, they'd probably go to Rick House, Local Edition, or even Vesuvio. But this place? Likely not. 
It's an okay spot- it's trendy, and had a good bartender in the back who must have injected a RedBull into his forearm before coming in for his shift. The pours were consistent (wouldn't call them generous) and the place got a little crowded toward the 11:00 hour. I also thought there weren't enough bathrooms for a bar of it's size (considering the upstairs opens up later).
author: Kelly B.

description: My friend and I went here on 8-22-13 11:40am'sh.  (Earlier I was at cat club, and met my other friend, he told me that they play '90s music).  The doorman checked our id's and we went upstairs, There was a small dance floor, and I purchased two heinenkens $5 each.  It's alright for what it is, but it is another option for club/bar hopping.
author: Jer W.

description: So. We came in. Ordered vodka sprite. Got only sprite. Charged us 9$. Later we decided to order shots of ciroc since we weren't getting any alcohol in our well drinks. Charged us 11$ per shot.. Of Smirnoff. They lie about what's in their bottles. Do not spend your money on their fake ass alcohol.
author: Brittany N.

description: Had my dirty 30 here. David the promoter was awesome in helping me get a table for my large party. When I arrived they had birthday banners and my name on the VIP section. Our hostess I think her name was Leslie she was really sweet. I had a great time there. Older crowd and great music. I was happy to not see a tenny bopper twerking haha and bottle service is not too expensive. The only reason I didn't give a 5 is because the place is kinda small. I had a blast I will be going again
author: Shirlee L.

description: I absolutely adore this place. We came on a Friday and it was free before 11. The place is nice and quite spacious with 2 levels. I really liked the fact that it wasn't crazily crowded like the other clubs around. Music variety is another plus. There's a little bit of everything, and the music videos were nice. Will definitely come back!!
author: Trang L.

description: My kind of music... every song that comes on I get excited about and I'm super picky about music, and it can make or break my  night. Everyone that works here is so welcoming and friendly and the bartenders make excellent drinks! Love this place!
author: Melissa R.

description: Had my birthday party here on Saturday night and it was great!! They let you reserve a table for free! No need to have bottle service and you can have 19 of your friends join you for no cover. The music is old school and they keep the urge to dance going all night. As the night went on the place got very packed and there was a line to get to the upstairs dance lounge. The crowd was definitely a downside but overall it was a good time and I highly recommend getting there on the earlier side.
author: Ashley R.

description: We came here at 9:30 no line, small amount of people inside made it comfortable. Enjoy the setting, the music wasn't too loud, the specialty drinks were too sweet tho. As the evening dragged on it became super crowded, and who knew this was where all the asians hung out? No space to dance, had to push in to order drinks. When we left at 12 there was a huge line outside, wow good thing we started early. Overall a nice place, staff and bouncers were friendly enuf.
author: Dang L.

description: I have been here a few times and have always had a blast, so I decided to have my 26th birthday here. I reserved a table through their website, but after 2 days and not hearing back from them I wrote them an email. They hadn't received my reservation so I am so happy I contacted them. I worked with David on my reservation. He was so nice and always replied to my emails right away. You don't have to do bottle service and can just reserve a booth, which I think is wonderful. Besides the fact this bar is so fun, that was another huge reason why I reserved a booth. I ended up doing bottle service, which was a wonderful idea. When I got to the bar I didn't know who to speak to about my reservation so I asked a bartender and he responds saying "The bottle service girl. She is walking around, you'll find her." Not going to lie I was like seriously? How is that helpful for anyone? They had my name on the booth and even did birthday decorations, which I thought was so nice. We were there for about 15 min and still no one came up to welcome us or anything, so I went to the back bar and was able to find the person  I needed to speak with. After that the night was a blast. The service was wonderful and David even came up to give me a birthday crown and a birthday card. If you want a fun place to have your birthday or even a fun bar where you can dance and have a good time, than I would recommend coming here. So much fun!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Having seen its website and being lured in by the promise of a, "21st century update of the shadowy, brooding hangouts...", I had somewhat high hopes for this new drinking spot.  As I approached, however, I knew that what awaited me was something less foreboding; the cheesy "drink specials" chalkboard out front was the first sign of my plight.  Sitting down at the bar - a very over-lit one at that - I ordered one of their special drinks, The Raven, and dove into conversation and calm.  Glancing up, I couldn't help noticing the television screen, with a baseball game on, above the bar. Yikes.  Then came,..well,... .yes,... Brittany Spears on the sound system,...and the Back Street Boys,... and on and on it went.  
My friend and I quickly drank our drinks and bolted, making quick calls to our other friends, telling them to instead meet us at the Stud, where darkness and killer music are pretty much the standard.  
I hope that the management does something to get the bar's identity a tad more defined.  Until then, it appears that this is just a really cheesy bar that's trying to recreate itself into something far more appealing.
author: Matthew W.

description: Well I saw the good reviews and decided to come here. My friends and I were having such a great time! Music and the crowd  was great! BUT as we were leave a security guy came up to my friend out of no where and said that she had to leave cause two random people said that she throw up in the bathroom! So he kicked us out! 1. She was waiting in a long line to use the bathroom! 2. She was no where near needing to throw up!! This ending ruin my night here!! This was my fist night out in SF!!!!
author: Lauren R.

description: Review for happy hour - great happy hour prices, friendly service, not crowded like the FiDi bars.  I love the space.  Only MINOR complaint - the music was too loud to have a conversation without shouting, at least in the front bar area.
author: Sona P.

description: Came here on saturday and it was jam packed.  They let way too many people in through the night, the place was so crowded you couldnt walk anywhere!  Not to mention the dance floor was way too packed and there was no A/C...the whole dance floor was stuffy and gross.  The bartenders are cool but they dont serve beer on tap..uhh what kind of bar is this?  An OK place, but if your looking for a better bar atmosphere go next door to bloodhound.
author: Terence N.

description: Fun place with pretty good music and clean bathrooms which was a big surprise! It was hot as hell in the back room though.
author: Dominique Y.

description: So I went o Raven recently with some girlfriends and must say that I had a perfect experience!! The bartender Jeff (who could be Patrick Dempsey's twin!) was quick to greet us as we came in and very attentive. I love the ambiance of this bar, and the drinks tasted amazing. It's fun to watch a sexy bartender, and he made our experience fun, entertaining, and exciting. It's the perfect place for a private party, and the dance floor upstairs was a pleasant surprise. Oh, and the DJ kicks ass! I will DEFINATELY be back, and if u haven't visited yet, put it in your to-do list because its more than worth it. Hats off Raven, u have a great staff, great location, and the specialty cocktails are the best!! Keep it coming!!!
author: amy b.

description: Highly recommend- this place is amazing. I threw my 23rd birthday here and it was such a great experience. The team at Raven Bar helped coordinate my large party of about 40+ guests. They were extremely easy to work with, very accommodating, and went to great lengths to make it a personal, fun, and enjoyable time. The GM came to personally wish me a happy birthday which was a really nice touch. We were at the bar the entire night- the drinks were creative and well made. I would throw another event there in a heart beat.. Cheers!
author: Ria P.

description: You would think the best thing about this bar is the amazing cocktails both on menu and off but you'd be wrong. The best thing about this bar is the bar staff. Intelligent, witty and on a good vibe you won't believe the level of enjoyment you can get here until you hang with the staff. Be friendly and tip big. It pays off.
author: Nils D.

description: I called up Raven Bar on a whim, after I had read from other Yelpers that this was a good place to host a birthday party--indeed it was! I reserved a spot for 30 of my friends about two months ahead of time (as I do...), and David (the owner) was kind when I couldn't figure out how to get the online guest list working. He even came and introduced himself to me earlier in the night.  The bartenders were darling, and extremely attentive to me and my friends no matter how crowded it got. And the music was also on point: 80's and 90's hip hop and R&B played through most of the night, and it was only after midnight that music got kind of funky and too EDM-y (for the record, that is a made up genre and it is stupid). If you're in need of a venue with a private area for you and your friends--and a dance floor--Raven Bar is quite a place.
author: Morence L.

description: Watch out!  Female bartender (shorter female, there were two working) on 11/14/12, double charged me!  I suspected that she was shady when she was quick to take my credit card because my friend already had his credit card on file, but I wanted to get some of the drinks so I provided the bartender w/ my credit card too.  When I realized that we were leaving this bar shortly after giving my credit card, I asked for my card back because I decided to pay with cash.  Today, my online bank statement shows a charge by Raven Bar last night.  It's not much but I'm disappointed.
author: L T.

description: Meh. Friendly service wasn't able to make up for poorly made cocktails. If they were cheap I could see going here for happy hour but, unfortunately, my disappointing drinks were pricey. The music was somewhat redeeming. Somewhat.
author: Brett B.

description: Raven is a nice and chill bar located in SoMa. I was recently here for an event. They play good music, make good mixed drinks, and the bartenders and staff are nice. Don't be fooled by small space you see at the entrance. There are 2 staffed bars on the 1st floor (1 at front and 1 at the back), and they also have a 2nd floor space with a 3rd bar.
author: Frances V.

description: Came here on Halloween around 630, made it for Happy Hour.  It took a while to get served, I think the bartenders were new, but then DAVID showed up.  Chinese, not Korean bar tending genius. He was efficient and had his own special drinks that were not on the menu.  Tell him what you like and he will make something awesome.  He made me a strawberry basil drink that was delicious.  Quality definitely skyrocketed once he came to the rescue. 5 stars for great service and great drinks.
author: Skye W.

description:
I hosted a 35-person birthday party at Raven and they were totally awesome.  We reserved the back bar, which is a 35-person space (and we fit very comfortably), for no rental fee and no bar minimum.  As others have mentioned on this page, that's a rare treat in SF.

We set up the reservation with the manager, Vince, who was easy to deal with and quick to respond via email.  When we arrived they had decorated the space with balloons and happy birthday signs, which was a really nice touch.  They gave us our own bartender (Dave, who is super nice - ask for him if you can) for the entire night, and made sure nobody else encroached on us.  Vince offered to let us adjust both the lighting and music volume in the back bar to whatever we wanted, although we found the default settings to be perfect on both counts.

Their list of signature cocktails are delicious, and reasonably priced at $8-9.  Also, they let us bring in our own snacks and food.  FYI, they have an upstairs area that you can reserve if you have a larger party (it was too big for us).

TLDR:  Very highly recommended for either an impromptu drink or a private event.
author: Adam F.

description: This is how much I love my friends: I got talked into going to goth club night here and downed a delicious caipirinha. Enough said.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Much more adult and manageable than Bloodhound next door.  You can actually hear each other speak.  The bartender was quick and greeted guests with a bright smile.  What else can you ask for?
author: Laurence H.

description: I went to Raven with all my single mom girl friends. We had the best time. Jeff was our favorite bar tender. He was personable, talked with us, had good drink suggestions when we needed them.  It was the first time I had been there. But, between the atmosphere, the great drinks and our super cute bat tender Jeff, we are definitely going there again!
author: Lynne H.
