description: This place was alright. My main complaint is that this place is too crowded and the raven drinks (winter kiss and herbal remedy) are okay. Music is popping and all, but the dance floor is too small.
author: Kosmo Z.

description: This place has changed so much in the last 2 years. We used to have a lot of fun. Now it's crowded and feels unsafe.
author: R G.

description: Music is great upstairs tonight. Lighting is pretty bad. All lights conflict with each other. The green laser is blinding. The clientele is not from SF. High heels, lots of makeup, lots of polyester. Bridge and tunnel folks. Lighting is really bad upstairs. Lights are hideous!
author: Beatriz M.

description: Great bar, great staff. Drinks were very affordable, such a rare treat in SF. 90s night was fun, went for a friends birthday party. No hassle with reservations. So glad to have found this spot.
author: Sanjay A.

description: I wandered in with a neighbor for a casual drink - and realized there is a great cocktail space I never knew existed. The space is very well done, the staff (especially Josh) is engaging and welcoming. Am excited to have a new SOMA location with no attitude and some really great cocktail selections.
author: Brian H.

description: Wonderful low key alternative to Bloodhound, with a fresh new design by Michael Brennan (Zero, Zero, Harry's Bar on Fillmore & a bunch more).  If you would like to enjoy a sophisticated cocktail in a more sophisticated environment, you should check this place out.l
author: Deborah K.

description: been to a couple birthday parties here and it's a chill atmosphere. 90's music always makes it a nostalgic good time
author: Christina K.

description: Raven is an awesome bar! The atmosphere is chill & comfortable, the drinks are delicious & the dance scene upstairs is great!  My bartender Jeff took care of us all night long, his drinks are amazing & he made a point to say goodbye as we left! Great people! Ill definitely be back for more.
author: Ian S.

description: Raven is a great lounge / bar / club in SOMA that I have just recently discovered. I was there on Friday for Vogue, which is a fun event (1st and 3rd Fridays) where they play the best hits from the 90's, as well as some contemporary. They play awesome dance music on both floors and my friends and I had a blast, dancing the night away! They also have yummy drink specials - I especially love the "Herbal Remedy". Highly recommended if you are looking for a fun night out on a Friday.
author: Kara E.

description: I just had my birthday at Raven, David (the manager) and staff are so accommodating & nice!! They allowed me to bring my own food. It's a great atmosphere,chill crowd & vibe a good mix of music & delicious drinks made with fresh ingredients!! Looking for a fun night out? Then Raven's your place!!
author: Zyanya H.

description:
I went on a night that they had advertised quite a lot about. Had heard decent things about the place from quite a few people but came back highly disappointed.

The music was tepid. The place smelled weird. Most of all I thought the crowd was too old (No offence meant). Normally you'd find a mix of people across age groups but here I found almost everybody was above 30. Clearly that leads to a very different dynamic in a club and one which I do not enjoy too much.

They do have a lot of space so thats definitely a plus. I did not end up having any drinks (since I did not like the place at all) so cant really give my comments there.
author: S M.

description: The bartender is so friendly and cool. He literally greets you at the door and wishes you goodnight as you leave. The crab cake burger was tasty. My buddy and I shared a cocktail (don't know the name but it had a mint leaf floating in it) which was pretty tasty as well.
author: Pravisti S.

description: I miss christy turlington. Downstairs is chill, upstairs is elbo to elbo. Wink wink
author: Pickle R.

description: This bar is so cozy and accommodating. The staff here is super friendly and it's one of the only bars in San Francisco where you can regularly find the owners in the bar and chat with them. I regularly attend Tech Trivia here at Raven Bar. The hosts of Tech Trivia are awesome and I can't believe no one thought of the idea sooner.
author: Captain J.

description: LOVE Raven Bar! I went there for Tech Trivia and fell in love with the decor, the music, the layout and the personality of the crowd it caters to. I now routinely book private events there and I've been back to Tech Trivia several times.
author: Joe G.

description: Right next door to Bloodhound, Raven was pretty much empty when we got there. Mostly because EVERYONE was at Bloodhound getting their drinks on. Don't get me wrong, this doesnt mean Raven is horrible. In fact, I had a ball at Raven, especially since we were drunk and just wanted to let loose. That meant, there was no one on the dance floor and we proceeded to be ridiculous and dance and sing our hearts out. I can't say much for the drinks, but the video dance floor upstairs is pretty legit. It's small, but was nice. Downstairs had more seating and was more of a lounge feel. All in all, 4 stars just because of the amazing time I had.
author: Jessica H.

description: A nice place in the middle of hipster Haight st. It feels like a lounge that should be in downtown. anyway, besides the ambiance itself, the food is pretty decent. They have some good cocktail choices too- i tried the summer's kiss and 5spot. both were very good.
author: Shal S.

description: Great new cocktail lounge in SoMa.  The lighting is beautiful, the bartenders are friendly, and the cocktails inventive and delicious.  The new Raven has a number of new takes on classic cocktails and a couple of totally original inventions.  They've put heavy emphasis on fresh ingredients in the cocktails and the beer pours are very generous.  Can't recommend this place enough for a chill weeknight or a rockin' weekend.
author: Steve D.

description: Came here for the elite event. All I know is its in the middle of nowhere, has multiple floors, multiple bars, and the best St Germaine cocktails you've ever tasted. We NEED to come back here for the one with muddled basil. It's is a very cool spot!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great drinks, friendly bartenders, and not too crowded. Plus, the restaurant next door delivers food into Raven until 10:30pm. I got a decent burger for $7.
author: David K.

description:
I would have given Raven 3 stars had the staff not been total pricks. 

This place is fun because it's truly a group of misfits. Lots of birthday party groups and bachelorette parties. Everyone has a good time because they are out with their friends and it's not really a "scene" of any sort. The music is old school, which I think is a hit because half of the crowd seemed to be made up of people who were probably saying to each other, "Oh my god! I haven't been to a club in 10 years!" They let in just about anyone. All ages, ethnicities, sizes, types, etc. 

The venue is pretty low budg. Kind of like a diner that turns into a club at night. The tables are something you would see in an airplane or on a boat. Very narrow to try and make more room in the middle area dance floor thing. In most clubs this would just be the entry way into another room, but it was the dance floor here. 

I had a fun time with my friends because our crowd was similar to the one I described in my first paragraph. We could have been anywhere and had fun. My friends ordered bottle service, of which the items barely fit on our table. 

You are probably asking, why only 1 star then??? That seems a little harsh. Well, because the bouncers and bus boy were horrendous. Considering my friends dropped a lot of cash at the place, we got less than par service. The one guy who was cleaning our table kept going over the couches where our purses and jackets were. He kept clearing glasses and drink before they were empty. This is a huge pet peeve of mine!!! We had 3 bottles of Vueve, a bottle of vodka, and whisky. DON'T TAKE OUR DRINKS WHEN THEY ARE HALF FULL. Period. It is so basic. This guy took so much of our alcohol, it was insulting. Then in his mission to clear our table every few minutes, drops a glass under the table (because of course he was on the couch/seat side), it shatters and we all feel glass hit our ankles, and wetness because .... yep, you guessed it, the glass wasn't empty because he was clearing a half full cocktail. He then proceeded to look up and say, "don't worry, I got it." Uh...YA! I hope so. I'm not trying to be a pretentious bitch, but come on. No apology and then implying that he's doing us a favor by cleaning up the glass shards from the drink he dropped. 

The last straw was that we were leaving and I told this same little shit that we would be heading out and could he get the caps to the bottles. He literally flips out on me, and starts screaming like he is ready to fight me. Super rude and sarcastically he said, "Are you serious?! Are you serious?! ARE YOU REALLY FUCKING SERIOUS?! I dont' think so! You really think I'm that dumb. If I see you take this bottles out of here, I will get your ass." .... uhhhhhhhhhhh......ME = STUNNED. WTF just happened?? Oh my god. Not sure if he was on meth or what, but he freaked out. Ok, I just learned it's against the law to do that. I didn't realize that because other places must have turned a blind eye. 

The next thing we know he has another bouncer and the manager. The bouncer comes over putting a flash light in our eyes. He was more calm, but still SUPER CONFRONTATIONAL. He stood about 3 inches from me and my friend asking us what our problem was, etc. To be honest it was quite embarrassing. Unfortunately, my drunken friend had already left with a bottle and was outside the bar. So, thinking that we were plotting against all of them, which we were not, and just wanted to be compliant, the little crazy one went outside and started yelling again and running up to her like he was going to attack my friend (honestly, I hope this is just a weird night) and the other flashlight guy came out too. In their toughest, scariest voices told my friend to stop, and then searched her body and purse and got the bottle. She had no idea what had gone on in the club, so was like a deer in headlights. After they got the bottle, the little guy continued to scream and yell at us as we were leaving. He was jumping up and pointing at us with his finger saying stuff like, "That's right. You thought you were going to get away with this. I'm 24 and I'm smarter than you!" (He actually said the thing about being 24 and smarter than us). 
I hope that this was a one-time unfortunate fluke. However, it was one of the most aggressive, unnecessarily confrontational events. It was weird and left a nasty taste in my mouth.
Oh, the main a$$hole guy I was taking about is about 5'7" or 5'8", half white, half African American, he's a bar back or bus boy type person, almost shaved head (very short hair). If you see him, run for the hills!
author: Shirin A.

description: Great new place in SOMA. Awesome drinks, attentive bartenders, friendly and hospitable doormen and an amazing vibe inside. The interior of this place is really nice and all brand new. Very comfortable seating, two floors with DJ's and dance floors and a nice patio area for smoking without having to go outside. Love this place.
author: Zach C.

description: Love this bar!  Great atmosphere, tasty drinks, and hot tunes.  Fast becoming the SF "it" bar!
author: Sean S.

description: Went here this past Saturday, the place is smaller than I thought and bottle service was pretty bad. We waited an hour to get our bottle and had to complain about mess ups on our tab. We got a free shots but after waiting an hour that was the least they could do!
author: Mimi N.

description:
The Raven looks great after the remodel and grand opening.  We were there early one night so we could unwind after work.  I liked how it was not over-crowded and loud at first, so we could actually have a conversation with friends.  The atmosphere was fun since the bartender got us to try a few new speciality drinks that matched our personalities well.  

As we stayed a little longer, and got more tipsy, the crowds came in and and it becamse a good party atmosphere, with a good mix of people.  Loved the hip music and trendy crowd.
author: Chris X.

description: New bar right next door to Bloodhound. Bloodhound is pretty popular these days, so it's sometimes difficult to find a seat or have a conversation without yelling. The owners of Raven are super friendly.  Cocktails are still a work-in-progress but they are developing/experimenting with a list currently so there should be an interesting written menu soon.  It's still trying to figure out what its clientele and theme will be.
author: David C.

description: It's so cool this place has 3 bars. You'll never go thirsty here. The upstairs one is the biggest!! I don't like tequila normally, but the margaritas they had on the opening day was delicious. I had 2 glasses!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Great first impression, decent ambience and good drinks. This place is cool, it looks like a bit divey in the front, loungey in the back, and hints of a small nightclub upstairs. Plenty of space with comfortable booths if you can get your hands on one. The place allows reservations on sections of the bar so don't be surprised if you are blocked off by a party or two. There is a total of three bars, two downstairs and one upstairs so make sure to get your drink on. Music varies with the nights. The lighting is a little tacky and if there's a party, the Happy Birthday decorations and balloons just makes it worse. As far as the drinks go, they have a huge selection across all three bars but only the front one makes their specialty drinks. Herbal Remedy and Hazel Eyes were good but not outstanding. Also, there's a 50% off all drinks on Scoutmob and Foursquare, so make sure you download those handy money-saving apps!
author: Ryan L.

description: Tech Trivia is so much fun!  Great staff, super fun and friendly!  Awesome atmosphere and super fun on the weekend to shake your groove thing!
author: Danielle A.

description:
Recently had a birthday event here on a Saturday night that went smashingly. I made reservations two weeks in advance for two 10-person booths, and they held them with no charge and no minimum. For comparison, I shopped around at a few other comparable bars... Many had at least $1000 drink minimum / reserved charges for a group of 20, or charged a flat fee for the space.

On the day of the event, the other birthday boy and I showed up to find welcoming bartenders who had even decorated our booths with balloons and a happy birthday sign.

I tried at least a sip of most cocktails on the menu, and honestly think they have a fun / creative mix that still all makes sense with their overall theme. And each of the main bartenders has their own signature drink, all of which we loved.

Kudos to you guys and gals @ Raven for making a great cocktail hour at the beginning of our birthday festivities. You rock.
author: Will C.

description: This place was formerly known as "Dragon" but now has turned into a straight bar/lounge. I've been here twice now for Happy Hour and and just for drinks later on in the evening and I must say that I really like the place. I mean I liked it before when it was just Dragon but it's nice and a good spot to go to. It gets a little crowded at night but other than it's a chill but still fun atmosphere. They have TV's playing club music so it's not too boring. Prices are good too!
author: Heidi K.

description: I've only been here Friday and Saturdays and it's the same DJ both days playing pretty much the same set so it gets kind of repetitive, but he plays songs from the late 90's and early 2000's which is a nice change from all the current hip hop and edm going on. I wish he played more of a variety though. Definitely get there before 10:30 or else you have to pay a cover charge or $10, which is ridiculous but yet again I think any cover charge is ridiculous. The drinks are inexpensive so you won't be breaking and arm and a leg just trying to buy one drink! I would have given another star but there is a really douchey bouncer who thinks he is above everyone and totally just ticked me off. His attitude was completely unnecessary, too bad I didn't get his name. The wait time to go upstairs can be freaking ridiculous depending on who's the bouncer so if you wanna go upstairs, get there early. It's a small spot but a lot of fun with the right people.
author: Tori C.

description: Tuesdays at the raven are where it's at. With dzu and Garrett, you really can't go wrong. Sweethearts who go above and behind you fulfill your every whim. Get into it!
author: Nina W.

description: Uhhhhh...Will definitely be back!  I stopped by last Tuesday for happy hour, and got their signature drink "The Raven."  It was scrumptious, to say the least!  Bartenders seem real nice, and more importantly, know what they are doing.  The prices are reasonable as well, and even better during happy hour.  Fun bar with a cool vibe!
author: Amy N.

description: I had my birthday party there Sat night. David was super responsive and reserved the upstairs space for free- though we ended up dancing the entire time! I was able to email my guest list to him rather than use the web interface, which means I didn't have to paste 80 names in! It gets a bit too hot/ stuffy- but I had an amazing time!!!
author: S V.

description: Josh, Dave, Jeff are the best  bartenders in the world -- a wonderful hangout spot.  Vince and Jonathan are excellent hotst -- a great place to hang out with friends.
author: Kathleen K.

description: For those of you who are looking for a bar that will provide you with a decent drink and good music, this is NOT the place. We went in to this bar after dinner at around 10:00pm and the bar was empty. We ordered quite a few drinks and every single one of them was weak. I can assure you my gin tonics were around 99.9% tonics with little to none gin. Some reviewers say their drinks were good. Well, a margarita can taste good too if it tastes like a lemonade but that's not what you are paying for. The bartenders are somewhat friendly but nothing to rave about. The music is great if you like the same music with a lot of repetitions. The DJ was unwilling to take our songs' requests which was kind of unusual. How could you be a DJ and refuse to take songs request? It's like a Chef refuses to cook. Understanding the bar was empty so it wasn't like he had his hands full. Given this bar is located in San Francisco and people have great choices to choose from I can't see why people would spend their good earned money there when they don't even have the very few basic things that a bar should have.
author: Viv M.
